exception.name: ActionNotAllowedException
exception.description:
The action is not allowed, the UpgradePackage MO is in wrong state.
For example if you try 'upgrade()' before an 'install()' or 'forcedInstall()' has been done.

exception.name: RepairDeliveryNoteAlreadyExistsException
exception.description: Only one operator entry is allowed in the hardware log.

exception.name: NoAccessToHwLogException
exception.description: Communication with the board/unit is lost, or access to the hardware log is not possible.

exception.name: ChecksumhandlerException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the control of checksum for loadmodules has been rejected due to 'null' recieved from resource layer.

exception.name: NotUniqueFroIdException

exception.name: WebServerPathConfigurationException

exception.name: InvalidIndexException
exception.description: Index specified is invalid, i.e. it is out of the range of valid indices.

exception.name: FroNotAccessibleException

exception.name: FroRequestFailedException
exception.description: Exception that is thrown when the result of a request to a FRO (Facade Resource Object in the resource layer) is not ok.

exception.name: IllegalArgumentTypeException

exception.description: Exception thrown when

exception.name: SwAllocationNotFoundException

exception.name: NoDiskException

exception.name: UpgradeLogFileNotInUseException

This is a property that can be changed in the trace property file (Trace_01.prop).

enum.name: SfpState
enum.description: The state of the SFP port.

enumMember.name: VALID
enumMember.description: The SFP module is valid.

enumMember.name: INVALID
enumMember.description: The SFP module is invalid and not approved to be used for this board.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: There is no SFP module installed on this port.

enumMember.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumMember.description: The port is no SFP port.

enum.name: Information
enum.description: Information about results from upgrade actions.

enumMember.name: EXECUTED
enumMember.description:
The invoked action has been successfully executed without warnings. One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS and EXECUTION_FAILED.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UNSPECIFIED
enumMember.description:
An error or warning that is not specified is detected. See additionalInfo in the structure ActionResultData for further details.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_CHECKSUM_VER_FAILED
enumMember.description:
A load module checksum verification has failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NOT_ENOUGH_AVAIL_DISK_SPACE
enumMember.description:
There is not enough disk space for the required number of new CVs to be created automatically during an upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: MAX_NO_CV_WILL_BE_EXCEEDED
enumMember.description:
The maximum number of allowed CVs will be exceeded if the required number of new CVs is created automatically during an upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_FROM_CURRENT_UP_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The Upgrade Window element in the UCF does not specify the current Upgrade Package as a valid upgrade-from version.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NON_SUPPORTED_PIU
enumMember.description:
A plug-in-unit that is not supported is detected, that is, the plug-in-unit in the node is not defined in the UCF.
This fault does not prevent an upgrade execution.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: FAULTY_PIU
enumMember.description:
A faulty plug-in-unit has been detected. This fault does not prevent an upgrade execution.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: CREATION_OF_CV_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The auto-creation of an install CV failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The requested action is not allowed as another action is already in progress for another UpgradePackage MO.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: INST_MANUALLY_CANCELLED
enumMember.description:
An ongoing installation has been cancelled (aborted) due to request from client.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_NOT_ACCESSIBLE
enumMember.description:
The FTP server to be used for downloads of load modules is not accessible.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: INSUF_DISK_FOR_LMS
enumMember.description:
The required disk space for load modules to be installed is insufficient.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_IP_ADDR_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected in the IP address of the FTP server.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: DELTA_INSTALL_MERGE_ERROR
enumMember.description:
The install of the delta UCF failed, that is, the analysis of the delta UCF with the current active UP's UCF failed.
Valid value for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: SELECTIVE_INSTALL_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected during the selection phase of an install.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: EXECUTION_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The execution of invoked action failed. One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED and EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS
enumMember.description:
The action has been successfully executed but with warnings.One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED and EXECUTION_FAILED.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_FILES_NOT_INST
enumMember.description:
All load module files required for a supported plug-in-unit (according to the UCF) are not installed.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NOT_SUPPORTED_SUBRACK_TYPE
enumMember.description: A subrack that is not supported is detected, that is, the subrack in the node is not defined in the UCF. This will prevent an upgrade from being executed.

enumMember.name: SLOT_OF_PIU_NOT_CONNECTED_TO_SWA
enumMember.description:
A Slot related to a plug-in-unit is not connected to an SwAllocation.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_TYPE_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
ManagedObject(s) will be connected (via an SwAllocation) to Repertoire(s) referencing load modules of not allowed types. Both configured data and data in the UCF has been used to predict the SwAllocation connections during upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PIUTYPE_NOT_UNIQUE
enumMember.description:
Several SwAllocations connected to the same Slot define the same PiuType.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PIUTYPE_LOADLIST_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
All Repertoires in a SwAllocation do not support the same set of PiuTypes.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PROGRAM_INSTANCES_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for program instance values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: HEAP_SIZE_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for heap size values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: POOL_SIZE_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for pool size values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LOADER_DATA_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for loader type and device loader name with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: DEVICE_LOADER_INFORMATION_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for device loader information with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LOADER_TYPE_NOT_ALLOWED_FOR_PARENT_MO
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for loader type with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED_IF_MORE_THAN_ONE_UP
enumMember.description: The action is not allowed if more than one UP exists on node.

enumMember.name: ACTION_ALLOWED_ONLY_IF_UP_HWSENSITIVE
enumMember.description: The action is allowed only if the attribute actualTypeOfUP indicates that the UP type is HW_SENSITIVE and if the UP type in all referring CVs are of type HW_SENSITIVE.

enumMember.name: ACTION_ALLOWED_ONLY_FOR_CURRENT_UP
enumMember.description: The action is only allowed for current (active) UP.

enumMember.name: REMOVED_LM_FILES
enumMember.description: The load module files that have been removed.

enumMember.name: REMOVED_LM_FILES_XML_FILE
enumMember.description: An XML file that contains information of load module files that have been removed.

enumMember.name: REFERRING_CV_INFO
enumMember.description: Information about the CVs, where this UpgradePackage MO exists.

enumMember.name: UCF_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumMember.description: There is syntax or format problem detected in the UCF.

enumMember.name: INIT_UP_ERROR
enumMember.description: Initialitation of the Upgrade Package Mo failed i.e. the setting of an attribute in the UpgradePackageMo with data specfied in the UCF failed.

enumMember.name: AUE_REPORTED_FAILURE
enumMember.description: An AUE has reported failure or has not answered within an expected time.

enumMember.name: AUE_REPORTED_WARNING
enumMember.description: An AUE has reported warning.

enumMember.name: LACK_OF_DISK_SPACE_ON_C_DISK
enumMember.description: There is not enough with disk space for the required Load Module files to be installed.

enumMember.name: NO_NODE_TYPE_LIST_FOUND_THAT_MATCHES_USED_PIUS
enumMember.description: Not all used PIUs in the node are supported by a specific node type according to the Upgrade Control File.

enumMember.name: DISK_HEALTH_CHECK_FAILURE
enumMember.description: Error(s) detected during disk health check, such as: corrupt file system, configuration version(s) and/or upgrade package(s).

enumMember.name: MISMATCHED_LM_PATH
enumMember.description: The LM file path in the UCF is not matches the one configured in the node.

enumMember.name: REPERTOIRE_REPLACEMENT_ERROR_DETECTED
enumMember.description: Repertoire replacement definitions in the ExplicitReplacment UCF are not consistent i.e. depending on selected upgrade action.

enum.name: InvokedAction
enum.description: The invoked action.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_UPGRADE
enumMember.description: The verifyUpgrade action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE
enumMember.description: An upgrade action (one of the variants) has been invoked.

enumMember.name: INSTALL
enumMember.description: An install action (one of the variants) has been invoked.

enumMember.name: CANCEL_INSTALL
enumMember.description: The cancelInstall action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: SHRINK
enumMember.description: The shrink action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: READREFERRINGCVINFORMATION
enumMember.description: The readReferringCvInformation action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: RESTORE_SU
enumMember.description: The restoreSu action has been invoked.

enum.name: EmergencyStatus
enum.description: This enumeration specifies the different stages of the emergency state.

enumMember.name: NEVER_USED
enumMember.description: EmergencyStatus has not been activated since installation of the LKF.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: EmergencyStatus goes from NEVER_USED to ACTIVE, the first time the node is emergency-unlocked. The licenses are open for the emergency state as described in the documentation about licensing. The maximum time in this state is 7 days. After expiry, EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DEGRADED. EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE to ACTIVE_AGAIN at second emergency unlock activation of the node. EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE to NEVER_USED when the LKF is installed with emergency unlock reset.

enumMember.name: USE_DEGRADED
enumMember.description:
EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DEGRADED from ACTIVE. All features and capacities are license-controlled in accordance with the installed LKF.
EmergencyStatus remains in USE_DEGRADED until: an emergency unlock of the node and EmergencyStatus goes to ACTIVE_AGAIN or, an LKF is installed with an entry, emergency unlock reset. Then EmergencyStatus goes to NEVER_USED.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE_AGAIN
enumMember.description: The EmergencyStatus goes from USE_DEGRADED or from ACTIVE to ACTIVE_AGAIN at emergency unlock of the node. The licenses are open for the emergency state as described in the documentation about licensing. The maximum time in this state is 14 days (14 days minus number of days in state ACTIVE). After expiry the EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE_AGAIN to USE_DISABLED. The EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE_AGAIN to NEVER_USED at installation of an emergency unlock reset LKF.

enumMember.name: USE_DISABLED
enumMember.description: The EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DISABLED from ACTIVE_AGAIN. All features and capacities are license-controlled in accordance with the installed LKF. The node remains in USE_DISABLED until an LKF with the entry, emergency unlock reset, is installed. Then it goes to NEVER_USED.

enum.name: SeqRestarts
enum.description: The sequential restarts.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_NO_LIMITS
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates unlimited restarts and no faulty marking of the PIU. Used for critical PIU's such as TUBs, SCBs and some ET-boards.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_FAULT_MARKED
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_COLD_TEST
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_COLD
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_WARM
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -warm -cold -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enum.name: SilPortState
enum.description: Indication of Switch Internal Link port status.

enumMember.name: PORT_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The port is active.

enumMember.name: PORT_PASSIVE
enumMember.description: The port is not active.

enumMember.name: PORT_NOT_CONNECTED
enumMember.description: The port is not connected.

enumMember.name: PORT_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The port is locked.

enumMember.name: PORT_NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The post is not installed.

enum.name: RestartRank
enum.description: This is used in the manualRestart action for the MOs ManagedElement, PlugInUnit and PiuDevice.

enumMember.name: RESTART_WARM
enumMember.description: Restarts the MO with the same software. The software is not reloaded from the disk. The traffic is affected least as warm restart is faster and no hardware is reset.

enumMember.name: RESTART_REFRESH
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk and restarts the MO. Parts of the hardware are reset, depending on the MO. The traffic is affected more than for a warm restart.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLD
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets all hardware. The traffic is affected more than for a refresh restart.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLDWTEST
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets and tests the hardware. The traffic is affected most.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description: Administrative states.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTING_DOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the unlocked state.

enum.name: AvailabilityStatus
enum.description:
Indicates possible status values of a corresponding availabilityStatus attribute. Since more than one status may be present at the same time while only one is shown, they are shown in the following order of priority (highest first):
NOT_INSTALLED POWER_OFF IN_TEST DEPENDENCY_LOCKED DEPENDENCY_FAILED FAILED OFF_LINE DEGRADED OFF_DUTY LOG_FULL NO_STATUS

enumMember.name: NO_STATUS
enumMember.description: No other availability status for this resource is currently present.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. Tests that do not exclude additional users can be present in any operational state or administrative state.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed to place it online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual, automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled or enabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by some internal control process in accordance with a predetermined time schedule. Under normal conditions the control process can be expected to reactivate the resource at some scheduled time, and it is therefore considered to be optional. The operational state is enabled or disabled.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect, such as in speed or operating capacity. However, the resource remains available for service, either because some services are satisfactory or because degraded service is preferable to no service at all. The operational state is enabled.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete. For example, a plug-in unit is missing, a cable is disconnected, or a software module is not loaded. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition. Currently not used.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down. The operational state is disabled.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: Operational states.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to the user(s).

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable and available for use.

enum.name: RestartReason
enum.description: The restart reason.

enumMember.name: PLANNED_RECONFIGURATION
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform planned activities such as reconfigurations.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_EXTERNAL_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve node external problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_UPGRADE_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve upgrade problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_O_AND_M_ISSUE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve O&M issues.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_CYCLIC_RECOVERY
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to stop further auto recovery attempts.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_LOCKED_RESOURCES
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to release locked resources.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_COLD_WITH_HW_TEST
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform HW tests.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_CALL_PROCESSING_DEGRADATION
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to improve Call Set Up or Call Drop Rate.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_LOW_COVERAGE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to improve Cell Availability.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_BOARD_RESTART
enumMember.description:
Restart ordered to effectuate autoconfiguration of a plug-in unit.
This is only used for PlugInUnit MO.

enumMember.name: OPERATOR_CLASSIFIED_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve procedural errors or office environmental problems. Example: power, grounding, temperature, humidity or security problems.

enumMember.name: DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF

enum.name: DefaultTraffic
enum.description:
Indicates the default router, to which the traffic is flowing.
0 = traffic toward default router 0 1 = traffic toward default router 1 2 = traffic toward default router 2
Values 1 and 2 are possible, only if these default routers are configured.

enum.description: Denotes whether the autoConfiguration mode for the IpAccessHost is turned on or off.

enumMember.name: ENABLED

enum.name: IntegrationUnlockStatus
enum.description: This enumeration specifies the different stages of the integration unlock state.

enumMember.name: NEVER_USED
enumMember.description: IntegrationUnlockStatus has not been activated.

enumMember.name: ACTIVATED
enumMember.description: IntegrationUnlockStatus goes from NEVER_USED to ACTIVATED when the node is integration-unlocked. The maximum time in this state is 21 days. After expiry, IntegrationUnlockStatus goes to USE_DISABLED.

enumMember.name: USE_DISABLED
enumMember.description: The IntegrationUnlockStatus goes to USE_DISABLED when integration unlock expires or when an LKF is installed. All features and capacities are license-controlled in accordance with the installed LKF.

enumMember.name: CFI_STATIC_3

enumMember.name: CFI_AUTO_MAXIMUM_3

enumMember.name: NO

enumMember.name: NO_CONFLICTING_CELL

enumMember.name: YES_CONFLICTING_CELL

enumMember.name: DIFF_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES
enumMember.description:
Not all neighbour cells have the same MBSFN subframe allocation as the serving cell.
Note that the value used in SIB3, SIB5 and MeasObjectEUTRA is '00' for DIFF_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES as specified in TS 36.331.

enumMember.name: SAME_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES
enumMember.description:
The MBSFN subframe allocations of all neighbour cells are identical to or subsets of that in the serving cell.
Note that the value used in SIB3, SIB5 and MeasObjectEUTRA is '10' for SAME_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES as specified in TS 36.331.

enumMember.name: NO_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES
enumMember.description:
No MBSFN subframes are present in all neighbour cells.
Note that the value used in SIB3, SIB5 and MeasObjectEUTRA is '01' for NO_MBSFN_SUBFRAMES as specified in TS 36.331.

enumMember.name: DIFF_UL_DL_ALLOCATION
enumMember.description:
Different UL/DL allocation in neighbouring cells for TDD compared to the serving cell.
Note that the value used in SIB3, SIB5 and MeasObjectEUTRA is '11' for DIFF_UL_DL_ALLOCATION as specified in TS 36.331.

enumMember.name: PDSCH_NO_BF
enumMember.description: Only PDSCH load without Beam Forming

enumMember.name: PDSCH_BF_TYPE1
enumMember.description: Only PDSCH load with Beam Forming Type 1. Beam Forming Type 1 emulates in total four predefined beams. One and the same beam per TTI is used during ailgChangePeriod, after which the beam is changed to another one according to a predefined order.

enumMember.name: PDSCH_NO_BF_AND_PDCCH
enumMember.description: PDSCH load without Beam Forming, and PDCCH load

enumMember.name: PDSCH_BF_TYPE1_AND_PDCCH
enumMember.description: PDSCH load with Beam Forming Type 1, and PDCCH load. Beam Forming Type 1 emulates in total four predefined beams. One and the same beam per TTI is used during ailgChangePeriod, after which the beam is changed to another one according to a predefined order.

enumMember.name: PDSCH_BF_TYPE2
enumMember.description: Only PDSCH load with Beam Forming Type 2. Beam Forming Type 2 emulates in total four predefined beams. Four beams per TTI are used during ailgChangePeriod, after which the PRB positions for each beam are changed according to a predefined order.

enumMember.name: PDSCH_BF_TYPE2_AND_PDCCH
enumMember.description: PDSCH load with Beam Forming Type 2, and PDCCH load. Beam Forming Type 2 emulates in total four predefined beams. Four beams per TTI are used during ailgChangePeriod, after which the PRB positions for each beam are changed according to a predefined order.

enumMember.description: The Mbsfn area can not be activated in the related cell because of an configuration conflict.

enumMember.name: CELL_DISABLED
enumMember.description: The Mbsfn area can not be activated in the related cell because the cell is disabled.

enumMember.name: RESERVED
enumMember.description: The related cell is restricted for Unicast traffic on those radio resources that are configured by the MBSFN area.

enumMember.name: NO_ACTION
enumMember.description: No recovery action is allowed

enumMember.name: CELL_RESTART
enumMember.description: Cell restart action is allowed

enumMember.name: CELL_AND_NODE_RESTART
enumMember.description: Cell restart and Node restart actions are allowed.

enumMember.name: EEA0
enumMember.description: EEA0 means that no ciphering is applied.

enumMember.name: EEA1
enumMember.description: This refers to the ciphering algorithm 128-EEA1 (based on SNOW 3G).

enumMember.name: EEA2
enumMember.description: This refers to the ciphering algorithm 128-EEA2 (based on AES).

enumMember.name: EEA3
enumMember.description: This refers to 128-EEA3 (based on ZUC).

enumMember.name: EIA1
enumMember.description: This refers to the algorithm 128-EIA1 (based on SNOW 3G)

enumMember.name: EIA2
enumMember.description: This refers to the algorithm 128-EIA2 (based on AES).

enumMember.name: EIA3
enumMember.description: This refers to the algorithm 128-EIA3 (based on ZUC).

enumMember.name: NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description: The cell indicated by the value of parameter cellrelation must not be used as secondary component carrier (SCell) for UE using this cell as their primary component carrier (PCell).

enumMember.name: ALLOWED
enumMember.description: The cell indicated by the value of parameter cellrelation may be used as secondary component carrier (SCell) for UE using this cell as their primary component carrier (PCell).

enumMember.name: AUTO
enumMember.description: Same as NOT_ALLOWED.

enumMember.name: EVENT_A5
enumMember.description: Event A5 Measurements

enumMember.name: EVENT_A3
enumMember.description: Event A3 Measurements

enumMember.name: ALLOWED
enumMember.description: If a QCI profile is configured as ALLOWED then a UE may use it (but does not have to) in order to qualify for load balancing to the target frequency.

enumMember.name: FORBIDDEN
enumMember.description: If a QCI profile is configured as FORBIDDEN then UEs using it are not qualified for load balancing to the target frequency.

enumMember.name: REQUIRED
enumMember.description: If one or more QCI profiles are configured as REQUIRED then only UEs using one or more of them are qualified for load balancing to the target frequency.

enumMember.name: NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description: Load balancing is not allowed

enumMember.name: OFFLOAD
enumMember.description: Offload is allowed

enumMember.name: EMSIS_ESN
enumMember.description: The type of MS identity is IMSI_S and ESN. This value is applicable only when TMSI is not supported

enumMember.name: IMSI_OR_TMSI
enumMember.description: The type of MS identity is TMSI if the TMSI is supported and a TMSI is assigned to the MS, or the type of MS identity will be IMSI

enumMember.name: IMSI_ESN_OR_TMSI
enumMember.description: The type of MS identity is TMSI if the TMSI is supported and a TMSI is assigned to the MS, or the type of MS identity is IMSI and ESN

enumMember.name: ABORTED_NOT_OK

The health check is aborted, since a PlugInUnit MO is not responding.
The health check has found one or more errors, see the alarms: - File System Diagnostic Error - Configuration Version Corrupt - Upgrade Package Corrupt
One alarm per error and MO is raised.

enumMember.name: STARTED

enumMember.name: HEALTH_CHECK_ONGOING

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_ONGOING

enumMember.name: SCTP_PATHS
enumMember.description:
Path management where retransmissions are counted for each destination IP address.
Specification: RFC 4960

enumMember.name: IP_PATHS
enumMember.description: Path management based on the concept of IP path. An IP path is a pair of local and remote transport addresses. Retransmissions are counted for each IP path. The attribute pathMaxRtx specifies the maximum number of retransmissions per IP path.

enumMember.name: IP_PATHS_OPTIMIZED
enumMember.description: Path management similar to IP_PATHS, with the addition that the active primary path is avoided, if the previous transmission through it failed. New data will be transmitted over other paths, even though the active primary path is not detected as broken yet.

enum.name: CommLostOrigin
enum.description: Originator of the Communication lost event.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: The originator is unknown, or there were no any Communication Lost after association establishment.

enumMember.name: LOCAL
enumMember.description: The last Communication Lost was originated by local node.

enumMember.name: REMOTE
enumMember.description: The last Communication Lost was originated by remote node.

enum.name: CommLostReason
enum.description: Reason of association closure.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Initial value or the reason is unknown after program restart.

enumMember.name: SCTP_RESTART
enumMember.description: The association was closed down because the SCTP Host has restarted.

enumMember.name: SHUTDOWN_FAILURE
enumMember.description: Shutdown Failure, max SHUTDOWN retransmits reached.

enumMember.name: USER_REQUEST_TERMINATE
enumMember.description: The SCTP user has requested graceful shutdown of the association.

enumMember.name: UNDETERMINED_ERROR
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with unknown reason was received by SCTP, or SCTP internal error.

enumMember.name: PEER_REQUEST_ABORT
enumMember.description: The remote side has closed the association ungracefully.

enumMember.name: MAX_RETRANSMIT_FAILED
enumMember.description: Maximum number of retransmissions (defined by associationMaxRtx and pathMaxRtx attributes of Sctp or SctpProfile MO) reached.

enumMember.name: RESOURCE_ERROR
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Out Of Resources" was received by SCTP, or there are not enough resources in the local SCTP to proceed.

enumMember.name: PEER_REQUESTED_TERMINATE
enumMember.description: The remote side has requested graceful shutdown of the association.

enumMember.name: NO_USER_DATA_IN_CHUNK
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "No user data" was received by SCTP.

enumMember.name: DATA_REASSEMBLY_ERROR
enumMember.description: SCTP is not able to reassemble a message that was fragmented on the remote side.

enumMember.name: STREAM_SEQ_ERROR
enumMember.description: SCTP has received a DATA chunk with incorrect stream sequence number.

enumMember.name: INVALID_SACK
enumMember.description: Invalid SACK chunk is received.

enumMember.name: LOCAL_REQUEST_ABORT
enumMember.description: The SCTP user has requested to close the association ungracefully or to delete the endpoint for the association.

enumMember.name: INVALID_STREAM_ID
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Invalid Stream Identifier" was received, or the SCTP has received a DATA chunk with invalid stream identifier.

enumMember.name: INVALID_MAND_PARAM
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Invalid Mandatory Parameter" has been received by SCTP, or a received chunk contains a mandatory parameter with an invalid value.

enumMember.name: RESTART_WITH_NEW_ADDRESSES
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "restart of an Association with New Addresses" was received, or an INIT chunk was received and its IP addresses were previously not part of the association.

enumMember.name: PROTOCOL_VIOLATION
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Protocol Violation" has been received, or the SCTP has detected a protocol violation of the peer.

enumMember.name: ICMP_RECEIVED
enumMember.description: An ICMP message is received and is treated as an ABORT chunk: - Type is "Destination unreachable", Code is "Protocol unreachable" for IPv4. - Type is "Parameter problem", Code is "Unrecognized Next Header type encountered" for IPv6.

enumMember.name: NO_USER_CONNECTION
enumMember.description: Connection with the SCTP user is lost.

enumMember.name: NO_SWITCHBACK
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where the active primary path continues to be used without switchback, unless there are new transmission problems.

enumMember.name: IMMEDIATE_SWITCHBACK
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where switchback to the preferred primary path is performed as soon as the preferred primary path becomes active.

enumMember.name: EXPONENTIAL_BACKOFF
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where switchback to the preferred primary path is performed only after a number of consecutive successful heartbeats.

enum.name: SecurityLevel
enum.description: The security level of the node. Describes both the requested and the operational security levels.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_UNDEFINED
enumMember.description:
Undefined. Equivalent to level 1.
Use the action adaptSecurityLevel to set the attribute requestedSecurityLevel to LEVEL_1, or the secmode command.
This value applies only during initial configuration of the node and does not normally occur in operation.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_1
enumMember.description:
Security Level 1, which is the lowest level. Corba security is not activated.
It is possible to login to the node remotely using Telnet, FTP, SSH, SFTP. Debug and Trace Port access may be enabled.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_2
enumMember.description: Security Level 2 adds secure Corba communication with authentication using an external database.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_3
enumMember.description: At Security Level 3, Authentication and Authorization using an external data base, is added to all remote access points. Telnet, FTP and debug access is not possible at this level (Timeout value is specified when calling the setSecurityLevel3 action).

enumMember.name: LEVEL_3_UNCONFIRMED
enumMember.description:
Security Level 3 has been activated, but it has not yet been confirmed with the command, secmode.
If the confirmation is not made within the timeout, the security level drops back to level 2.

enum.name: FileXferClient
enum.description: The protocol used by the node for transferring files

enumMember.name: FTP
enumMember.description: File Transfer Protocol

enumMember.name: SFTP
enumMember.description: Secure File Transfer Protocol

enumMember.name: LOCAL_AA_DB_FILE_SIGNERS

enumMember.name: AA_SERVERS

enumMember.name: CORBA_PEERS

enumMember.name: ERICSSON_1
enumMember.description: Trusted Ericsson certificate for verifying the classification files and the permission files. This certificate cannot be removed or changed.

enum.name: CertEnrollState
enum.description: Certificate Enrollment State

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: Idle. An initCertEnrollment request will be accepted.

enumMember.name: PREPARING_REQUEST
enumMember.description: The node is preparing the certificate enrollment sequence.

enumMember.name: POLLING
enumMember.description: An enrollment request has been sent to the enrollment server. The node is polling for a new certificate but the requested certificate has not yet been issued.

enumMember.name: NEW_CREDS_AWAIT_CONF
enumMember.description: Awaiting confirmation for the use of new credentials. An event is issued.

enumMember.name: ERROR
enumMember.description:
An error has occurred. An alarm is issued.
See the certEnrollErrorMsg attribute for a description of the error.
The only way to leave this state is by using the action, cancelCertEnrollment.

enumMember.description: Verifying that Slots related to plug-in-units are connected to an SWA.

enumMember.name: VERIFYING_LM_TYPE_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
Verifying that only allowed types of load modules are referenced in Repertoires to be connected to ManagedObject(s) via an SWA.
Both configured data and data in the UCF will be used to predict the SwAllocation connections during upgrade.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_PIUTYPE_LOADLIST
enumMember.description: Verifying that all Repertoires in a SwAllocation support the same set of PiuTypes.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_PROGRAM_CONSISTENCY
enumMember.description:
Verifying that programs that will exist in TO state are specified in a consistent manner, that is the result of combining UCF data with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU must be consistent. The following checks are done:
- heap value - pool value - program instances - loader data (attributes loader type, deviceLoaderName) - device loader information - loader type allowed for program parent MO

enum.name: ConfigurationVersionType
enum.description: Configuration version type

enumMember.name: STANDARD
enumMember.description: The value normally used for manually created CVs.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE
enumMember.description:
A CV created during system upgrade, after reconfigurations are completed and before the new SW is taken into operation.
UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR is used if the Upgrade Control File states that the function Tolerate Error is to be used in the upgrade path. The name of the CV starts with SU_.

enumMember.name: AUTOCREATE
enumMember.description:
A daily CV created automatically by the periodical CV function activated by setting autoCreatedCVIsTurnedOn to true.
The name of the CV starts with Au_.

enumMember.name: OTHER
enumMember.description: CVs of this type are created in many situations: - After a successful installation of an Upgrade package. The name of the CV starts with Si_. - A rollback CV created in the beginning of an upgrade after the prechecks are done and before any reconfiguration is started. The name of the CV starts with Rb_. - The final CV created after a successful upgrade. The name of the CV starts with Fi_. - A rollback CV created in the beginning of a restoration of an external CV. The name of the CV starts with RR_. - A CV created when the Autoconfiguration is switched off in order to save the configuration created during a PIU replacement. The name of the CV starts with CA_. - CVs created by the Robust Reconfiguration function. The name of the CV created when the function is activated starts with CB_. The name of the CV created when the function is confirmed starts with CC_.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR
enumMember.description:
A CV created during system upgrade, after reconfigurations are completed and before the new SW is taken into operation.
UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR is used if the Upgrade Control File states that the function Tolerate Error is to be used in the upgrade path. The name of the CV starts with SU_.

enumMember.name: DOWNLOADED
enumMember.description:
A backup CV downloaded to the node from an FTP server.
The CV has previously been created by the external CV function. This type of CV can not be set as startable. The CV can have any name.

enumMember.name: RESTORED
enumMember.description:
A CV created after a successful restoration of a CV.
It is created by the external CV function. Depending on the method used, the name of the CV starts with RR_ or RF_.

enumMember.name: STANDALONE
enumMember.description: A CV that may be created when only one configured instance of a PlugInUnit MO exists on the node.
