enum.name: RPUOperationalMode
enum.description:
This enumeration contains the following values:
AsConfigured = The RSHs runs as the RPU is configured. SwitchOver = The RSHs has been switched over. Unavailable = No RSHs, that uses this RPU, are running.

enum.name: RPUReplicationMode
enum.description:
This enumaration contains the following values:
Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
Never = Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enumMember.name: ALWAYS
enumMember.description: Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: NEVER
enumMember.description: Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: AT_SHUTDOWN
enumMember.description: AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: APPL_CONTROLLED
enumMember.description: ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUNormalisationMode
enum.description:
This enumeration can have the following values:
Manual = Indicates that no normalization is done until the "switch" action is performed.
Automatic = Indicates that the normalization is done automatically, when the failed RPU is available again. This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUSwitchOverMode
enum.description:
This attribute can have the following values:
AtPiuFault = When the PlugInUnit (where the reliable program is activated) is fault marked (HW fault or others) or when the PlugInUnit is restarted with rank ColdWithTest. This is the default value.
AtPiuRestart = When the PlugInUnit (where the reliable program is activated) is restarted with any rank or when the PlugInUnit is fault marked (HW fault or others).

enum.name: LoadClass
enum.description: Defines the phase in the load and start sequence.

enumMember.name: MP
enumMember.description: The board is a Main processor.

enumMember.name: BP
enumMember.description: The board is a device board.

enumMember.name: OTHERS
enumMember.description: The board is not a Main processor or a device board.

enumMember.name: CMXB
enumMember.description: The board is a CMXB or SCXB board.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The load module file is not installed on the disk.

enumMember.name: INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The load module file is installed on the disk.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: None of the load module file(s) required for this PiuType is installed.

enumMember.name: PARTLY_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: One or several load module file(s) required for this PiuType is not installed.

enumMember.name: INSTALLED
enumMember.description: All required load module file(s) for this PiuType are installed.

enumMember.name: STARTUP_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock is starting up.

enumMember.name: LOCKED_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is locked: a synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better.

enumMember.name: HOLD_OVER_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit has holdover quality: no synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better.

enumMember.name: FREE_RUNNING_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is free-running: no synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 4.6 ppm or better.

enumMember.name: FAILED_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is failed: there is fault in generating the system clock, no guarantee of clock accuracy level.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_TRACKING_MODE
enumMember.description: The frequency of the system clock is at its upper or lower limit.

enumMember.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on Timing Unit is not applicable: the TUB or the CBU is not present.

enumMember.name: DEGR_NOT_FAULT
enumMember.description: Degradation of the transmission link is NOT interpreted as a synchronization reference fault.

enumMember.name: DEGR_IS_FAULT
enumMember.description: Degradation of the transmission link is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault.

enumMember.name: INACTIVE
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference is currently not used in system clock generation.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Synchronization is used in system clock generation.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot perform its required tasks.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: Capability of the synchronization reference to perform its required tasks is degraded, for example, because of high bit error rate. This value is applicable only for synchronization references that carry traffic, that is, for ET physical path terminations.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_TRACKING
enumMember.description: The algorithm for system clock regulation cannot follow the synchronization reference signal either because of the poor quality of the signal or because of a HW fault.

enumMember.name: OK
enumMember.description: The synchronization reference is capable of performing its required tasks. If the reference MO has administrativeState equal to LOCKED or availabilityStatus equal to DEPENDENCY_LOCKED, the reference MO cannot be selected and syncRefActivity has the value INACTIVE. Similarly, if use of the reference type is under license control and if there is not a valid license, that is, the license state has the value DISABLED, the reference MO cannot be selected. There might also be configuration rules for the unit on which the reference is located and these rules might prevent selection of the reference. For more information, see the Unit Description.

enumMember.name: REF_PATH_FAILED_A
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot be distributed on plane A.

enumMember.name: REF_PATH_FAILED_B
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot be distributed on plane B.

enumMember.name: NOT_RELIABLE
enumMember.description: No NTP packets are received from the server. This value is only used for IP synchronization references.

enumMember.name: LOW_QUALITY
enumMember.description: The time stamp packets received from the NTP server are not reliable and the synchronization algorithm cannot lock to IP reference. This value is only used for IP synchronization references.

enumMember.name: PDV_PROBLEM
enumMember.description: A high or time-variant Packet Delay Variation (PDV) condition on a supervised IP synchronization reference is detected.

enumMember.name: SURVEY
enumMember.description: The node can move.

enumMember.name: POSITION_HOLD
enumMember.description: The node must not move.

struct.name: SfpInformation
struct.description: Gives information about the SFP port. Only valid if the attribute sfpPort is true.

structMember.name: sfpProductNumber
structMember.description: The product number of an SFP module.

structMember.name: sfpType
structMember.description:
The type of SFP.
Example: GE_1000_BASE_T or GE_1000_BASE_CX.

structMember.name: sfpState
structMember.description: The state of the SFP port.

struct.name: AccountInfo
struct.description: Accounting information

structMember.name: remoteHost
structMember.description:
The domain name, IPv4 or IPv6 address to the remote host (file server).
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. This means that a host name defininition in the DNS server should not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Instead, use two separate host names: one that resolves to the IPv4 address and one that resolves to IPv6 address.

structMember.name: userID
structMember.description: User ID for logging in to the remote host (file server).

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Password used for logging in to the remote host (file server).

struct.name: AdminProductData
struct.description: Administrative Product Data

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
The product number of the product or document.
Examples: ABC 101 001, CXC 123 456, 1/BFD 101 999
For UpgradePackage, this is the document number of the upgrade package.
Maximum length for a product number is 36 when referring to a document.
The product number is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
The revision state of the product.
Examples: R1, r1a, R1A02, P7B
The product revision is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description:
The name of the product.
The product name is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productInfo
structMember.description:
Information about the product.
If AdminProductData is used by LoadModule the range is 0.. (unlimited).

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date is represented in two ways:
- the preferred syntax is four-digits for the year, two digits for the month, and two digits for the day, a total of eight characters. Example: 19991231
- the date is also be represented by two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week, and two digits for the number of the week, a total of five characters. Example: 99W52
The production date is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage and LoadModule.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description: A user-friendly name of the product.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
Unique identity for each product, which is constituted by the Ericsson product number (ABC number).
The maximum number of characters for a product number is 24 including 2 slashes, 2 spaces and 2 characters for origination notation.
Example of product number: ABC 101 001 (1/ABC 101 01/1234) 123/ABCDE 101 1010/12345

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
Indicates the revision state of the product. It consists of a letter R or P, one or two digits and/or one or two letters. The maximum number of characters is four inclusive R or P. Example: R1A, R1A02, P7B
A suffix may be added to the revision state. The suffix may consists of one or two digits or one letter.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number consists of 13 alphanumerical characters grouped as 6 plus 7 characters. The first 6 characters are to be used for factory codes and the last 7 characters are used for an individual number or batch number.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date can be represented in two ways.
1) The preferable syntax is a four-digit representation of the year, and a two-digit representation of the month and a two-digit representation of the day. The numbers of characters in this case, is eight. Example: 19991231
2) The date can also consist of two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week and two digits for the number of week. The numbers of characters in this case, is five. Example: 99W12

structMember.name: countryCode
structMember.description: Two letter country code.

structMember.name: descriptionOfFault
structMember.description: Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described as well. For product safety reasons also specify fire, water damage, and so on.

structMember.name: preparedBy
structMember.description: Name of the person preparing the log entry.

structMember.name: reference
structMember.description: Compliant reference.

structMember.name: stateCode
structMember.description:
The HW status when the failure occurred:
R = repaired unit failed during installation or test S = unit in service failure occurred T = new unit failed during installation or test

structMember.name: timeDate
structMember.description: Time stamp date and time as yymmdd hhmmss.

structMember.name: trNumber
structMember.description: If the board has a connection with a trouble report, the trNumber must be supplied.

struct.name: PowerMeasurements
struct.description: Specifies information related to current and voltage of a subrack.

structMember.name: currentLeft
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the current, supplied from the leftmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no current measurement is available.

structMember.name: currentRight
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the current, supplied from the rightmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no current measurement is available.

structMember.name: voltageLeft
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the voltage, distributed from the leftmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no voltage measurement is available.

structMember.name: voltageRight
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the voltage, distributed from the rightmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no voltage measurement is available.

structMember.name: distributedPower
structMember.description:
Specifies the total distribution of power in the subrack.
This attribute is applicable only if all other measurements in this struct are available.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description:
Specifies an IPv6 address.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.

structMember.name: prefixLength
structMember.description: Network Prefix Length.

struct.name: RoutingTableEntry
struct.description: IP routing table entry.

structMember.name: destinationIpAddr
structMember.description: The destination IP address.

structMember.name: destinationNetworkMask
structMember.description: The destination IP network mask or network prefix length.

structMember.name: nextHopIpAddr
structMember.description: The next hop IP address.

structMember.name: routeMetric
structMember.description: The route metric.

structMember.name: routeType
structMember.description: The route type.

structMember.name: interfaceName
structMember.description: The interface name.

structMember.name: redistribute
structMember.description:
Indicates if the route should be redistributed.
This struct member is not applicable for IPv6.

structMember.name: active
structMember.description: Indicates if the route is active.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description: The subnet address of the range.

structMember.name: subnetMask
structMember.description:
IP subnet mask of the range to be added. The subnet mask must be contigouos. That is, has the LSB set to 0 (zero).
Example:
255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

structMember.name: advertise
structMember.description: Indicates whether the area range should be advertised into OSPF.

struct.name: StaticRoute
struct.description: An unique identifier for the static route.

structMember.name: indexOfStaticRoute
structMember.description: The index of the static route. It can differ from the index of the route in the routing table.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description: The destination IP address.

structMember.name: networkMask
structMember.description: The destination IP network mask or network prefix length.

structMember.name: nextHopIpAddr
structMember.description: The next hop IP address.

structMember.name: redistribute
structMember.description:
Indicates if the route should be redistributed.
This struct member is not applicable for IPv6.

structMember.name: routeMetric
structMember.description: The route metric.

struct.name: DhcpResultData
struct.description: The result of a request to the Dynamic Host Configuraiton Protocol server.

structMember.name: dhcpOptions
structMember.description: A list of Dhcp options provided by the DHCP Server. See RFC2132 for information on how to parse the received data.

structMember.name: bootFileName
structMember.description: The boot file name.

structMember.name: serverHostName
structMember.description: Optional server host name. Set to "" if no name was provided by the DHCP Server.

structMember.name: clientHwAddress
structMember.description: The client HW address. The MAC address of the interface in interfaceName.

structMember.name: relayAgentIpAddress
structMember.description: The ip address of the DHCP Relay Agent, if the DHCP request was relayed.

structMember.name: serverIpAddress
structMember.description: The Ip Address of the next server to use in bootstrap.

structMember.name: yourIpAddress
structMember.description: Your (client) ip address. The Ip address supplied by the DHCP Server.

structMember.name: clientIpAddress
structMember.description: The client Ip Address. This attribute is not used.

structMember.name: interfaceName
structMember.description: The IP link interface name used to send out DHCP request.

structMember.name: broadcastAddress
structMember.description:
Applicable only if ipAddress is an IPv4 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description:
Specifies an IPv4 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: prefixLength
structMember.description: Network Prefix Length.

struct.name: ChildSaLifeTime
struct.description: The life time of a Child SA is expressed both as data limit and as time limit. Both limits are checked and when one of them is exceeded, an SA re-keying is initiated.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description: The maximum time that an SA can be used.

structMember.name: dataLimit
structMember.description: The maximum number of MB that can be transmitted on an SA.

struct.name: ChildSa
struct.description: The properties of a child security association.

structMember.name: encryptionAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies the algorithm used for encryption.

structMember.name: localTrafficSelectors
structMember.description:
Specifies the local traffic selectors used by the SA. The traffic selectors are separated by a linefeed character. Each traffic selector is formated as follows:
IP Address Range = <min IP address> - <max IP address>, Protocol = <protocol>, Port Range = <min port number> - <max port number>
If the upper layer protocol is ICMP, the port range information is interpreted as follows: the first 8 bits denote the message type and the rest denotes the code type.
For other protocols, that do not support port numbers, the port range can be ignored.

structMember.name: direction
structMember.description: Specifies the direction of packet going into the tunnel or going out of the tunnel.

structMember.name: remoteTrafficSelectors
structMember.description:
Specifies the remote traffic selectors used by the SA. The traffic selectors are separated by a linefeed character. Each traffic selector is formated as follows:
IP Address Range = <min IP address> - <max IP address>, Protocol = <protocol>, Port Range = <min port number> -<max port number>
The port range is only included if the specified protocol supports port numbers.

structMember.name: integrityAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies the algorithm used for integrity check.

structMember.name: spiValue
structMember.description: Specifies the SPI value.

struct.name: SaTrafficSelector
struct.description:
The negotiated traffic selector for a Child SA.
Each Child SA has a SA Traffic Selector for the local end and one for the remote end. In the IKE protocol these are referred to as the Traffic Selector initiator (TSi) and Traffic Selector responder (TSr).

structMember.name: protocol
structMember.description: Specifies the type of protocol.

structMember.name: maxIpAddress
structMember.description: Specifies the maximum value of the IP address.

structMember.name: minIpAddress
structMember.description: Specifies the minimum value of the IP address.

structMember.name: maxPortNumber
structMember.description: Specifies the maximum value of the port number.

structMember.name: minPortNumber
structMember.description: Specifies the minimum value of the port number.

struct.name: ChildSaTransform
struct.description: Defines an integrity and encryption algorithm that can be used for a Child SA.

structMember.name: encryptionAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies a Child SA encryption algorithm.

structMember.name: integrityAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies an algorithm that is used for the integrity check.

struct.name: IkeSa
struct.description: The properties of an IKE security association.

structMember.name: remoteSpiValue
structMember.description: Specifies the remote SPI value.

structMember.name: diffieHellmanGroup
structMember.description: Specifies Diffie-Hellman group.

structMember.name: pseudoRandomFunction
structMember.description: Specifies the value of Pseudorandom function.

structMember.name: integrityAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies the type of integrity algorithm used.

structMember.name: encryptionAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies the encryption algorithm used.

structMember.name: localSpiValue
structMember.description: Specifies the local SPI value.

struct.name: IkeSaTransform
struct.description: Defines an integrity and encryption algorithm for an IKE SA.

structMember.name: diffieHellmanGroup
structMember.description: Specifies a Diffie-Hellman group.

structMember.name: pseudoRandomFunction
structMember.description: Specifies the type of Pseudorandom function.

structMember.name: integrityAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies an algorithm for integrity check.

structMember.name: encryptionAlgorithm
structMember.description: Specifies an encryption algorithm.

struct.name: TsIpAddressRange
struct.description:
The IP address range expressed by an IP address and a mask.
IP addresses where the X most significant bits are the same as in the specified IP address, are included in the range. The mask attribute specifies X. If mask is set to "0", all IP addresses match, independent of the value set in ipAddress.
Example: IP address = 15.16.17.18 mask =16 results in that the IP addresses between 15.16.0.0 and 15.16.255.255 are included in the range.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description: Specifies the IP address.

structMember.name: mask
structMember.description: Specifies the mask.

structMember.name: caFingerPrint
structMember.description:
The certificate fingerprint for the Certificate Authority which issues the node certificate.
The format is: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equal character is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colons.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39

structMember.name: keyLength
structMember.description: The length of the public and private keys for the certificate.

structMember.name: subjectAltNameType
structMember.description: Specifies the type of identifier in the field subjectAltName.

structMember.name: subjectAltName
structMember.description: The subject alternative name for the certificate.

structMember.name: challengePassword
structMember.description: Specifies the enrollment server to authenticate the request.

structMember.name: distinguishedName
structMember.description:
The Distinguished Name (DN) to be used in the Subject field of the requested certificate. The component fields of the DN are encoded as FIELDNAME "=" VALUE where fields are separated with a comma (,) character.
Example: C=SE, L=LI, O=Ericsson AB, OU=PJF/LO, CN=RBS 123
As the comma character is used as field delimiter, a field value cannot contain it.
This string cannot be empty.

structMember.name: enrollmentServerURL
structMember.description:
The full URL for the enrollment server to use. The URL contains: method, host, an optional port, and URI parts.
The method is always http://
The host must be an IPv4 or IPv6 address. The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. Example: 192.168.33.27 The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: [2001:db8:0::1] Note that the square brackets are included in the URL to distinguish the host IPv6 address from the port designation.
The optional port designation is written by appending a colon followed by the port to the host part. Example: 192.168.33.27:8080. If no port is given, the default HTTP port 80 is used.
The URI is the resource identifier of the resource on the server which will process the request. Example: /cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://192.168.33.27:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

structMember.name: preSharedKey
structMember.description:
Specifies the preshared key value.
Allowed characters are: a-z, A-Z, 0 to 9, and ! # $ % & ' * + - / = ? ^ _ ` { | } ~ . ,

structMember.name: encoding
structMember.description: Specifies type of encoding for the preshared key.

structMember.name: fileName
structMember.description: The full remote path and filename for the certificate file on a remote host (file server).

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description:
Specifies the unique serial number of the certificate assigned by the certificate issuer.
Allowed characters are digits 0 to 9.

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
The fingerprint of the certificate.
The format is: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equal character is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colons.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description:
Indicates the X.509 name of the authority that issues the certificate. It is the same type as the distinguished name used in the subject field of a certificate request. It is encoded as FIELDNAME=VALUE where fields are separated with a comma character.
Example: C=SE, L=LI, O=Ericsson AB, OU=FJK/LO, CN=PKS 2005-08-30

structMember.name: notValidAfter
structMember.description:
The time the certificate ends.
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is: YYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 2008 is 081106210627

structMember.name: notValidBefore
structMember.description:
The time the certificate starts.
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is: YYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 2008 is 081106210627

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description:
Indicates the unique serial number of the certificate assigned by the certificate issuer.
Allowed characters are digits 0 to 9.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: Indicates the X.509 name entity for which the certificate was issued.

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
The fingerprint of the certificate.
The format is: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equal character is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colons.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: subjectAltName
structMember.description: The subject alternative name for the certificate.

structMember.name: remoteHost
structMember.description:
IP address of the remote host (file server).
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. Example: 192.168.33.27 The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: [2001:db8:0::1]

structMember.name: userID
structMember.description: User identity to login to the remote host (file server).

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Password used to login to the remote host (file server).

structMember.name: idType
structMember.description: Specifies the type of peer identifier. If the value specifies any type of address, all types of peer identities must have values.

structMember.name: ipv4Address
structMember.description: The IPv4 address. If the idType specifies an IPv4 address and this field is empty, the value of the attribute peerIpAddress is used.

structMember.name: idFqdn
structMember.description: Specifies the fully qualified domain name.

structMember.name: ownIdType
structMember.description:
Specifies the type of identity that is used.
When this attribute is set to AUTOMATIC, the idFqdn and the ipv4Address cannot be set and empty strings are returned if the ownIdentity is read.

structMember.name: idFqdn
structMember.description: A fully qualified domain name string.

structMember.name: ipv4Address
structMember.description: An IPV4 address.

struct.name: DscpPbit
struct.description:
Default values according to IEEE 802.1p :
pBit 0 -> DSCP 0, 48, 56 pBit 1 -> DSCP 10, 12, 14 pBit 2 -> spare pBit 3 -> DSCP 18, 20, 22 pBit 4 -> DSCP 26, 28, 30 pBit 5 -> DSCP 34, 36, 38 pBit 6 -> DSCP 46 pBit 7 -> not used
All other DSCP values maps to priority 0.

structMember.name: dscp
structMember.description:
DSCP - differentiated services code point.
The number of members in this sequence is 64.

structMember.name: pbit
structMember.description:
802.1p priorities according to IEEE 8021D: 0 - Best effort 1 - Background 2 - Spare 3 - Excellent effort 4 - Controlled load 5 - Voice, less than 100 ms delay 6 - Voice, less than 10 ms delay 7 - Network control
The number of members in this sequence is 64.

struct.name: AclEntry
struct.description: Access Control List Entry

structMember.name: localIpAddress
structMember.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: remoteIpAddress
structMember.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: localPortFiltering
structMember.description: If set to true, the filter rule matches on the specific port number mentioned in the localPort attribute. If set to false, all possible ports are used.

structMember.name: remotePortFiltering
structMember.description: If set to true, the filter rule matches on the specific port number mentioned in the remotePort attribute. If set to false, all possible ports are used.

structMember.name: protocol
structMember.description: Specifies the protocol that matches.

structMember.name: aclAction
structMember.description: The performed action.

structMember.name: localIpAddressMask
structMember.description:
Specifies the number of most significant bits that match in the localIpAddress.
If this field is set to 0, all local IP addresses match, independently of the value set in the field localIpAddress.

structMember.name: localPort
structMember.description: The local port.

structMember.name: remoteIpAddressMask
structMember.description:
Specifies the number of most significant bits that match in the remoteIpAddress.
If this field is set to 0, all remote IP addresses match, independently of the value set in the field remoteIpAddress.

structMember.name: remotePort
structMember.description: The remote port.

structMember.name: icmpType
structMember.description: Specifies the ICMP type value (as specified by IANA). This field is only valid if the protocol is set to ICMP. The value 256 is used to state that all possible values are included.

structMember.name: dscp
structMember.description: DSCP value of the IP Packet Header. The number of members in this sequence is 64 (0-63).

structMember.name: queue
structMember.description: Queue number between 1 and 8. The number of members in this sequence is 64 (0-63).

structMember.name: redAveragingWeightFactor
structMember.description:
Specifies the averaging weight factor used by the Random Early Detection (RED) drop mechanism when calculating the average queue length. The averaging weight factor is used as the parameter n in the following formula:
average_queue_length = old_average_queue_length * (1 - 2^-n) + current_queue_length * 2^-n, where 2^-n means: 2 raised to the power of –n.
The averaging weight factor controls the sensitivity to bursts and rapid changes in the actual queue length. Setting the averaging weight factor too high causes the average queue length to respond too slowly to changes in the actual queue size, thus not reacting to congestion. Setting the averaging weight factor too low causes the average queue length to respond too fast to changes in the actual queue size, thus overreacting to bursts and dropping packets unnecessarily.
Guideline: The egress bandwidth, that is, the setting of attribute egressCir in MO TrafficSchedluer, and the average packet size should influence the choice of this attribute value.

structMember.name: redMaxThreshold
structMember.description:
Specifies the maximum threshold used by the Random Early Detection (RED) drop mechanism. If the average queue length calculated by the RED mechanism, reaches the maximum threshold, packets are dropped with a probability of 1.
The threshold is specified as a proportion of the maximum queue length specified in attribute queueLength.
Guideline: The egress bandwidth, that is, the setting of attribute egressCir in MO TrafficScheduler, and the average packet size should influence the choice of this attribute value.

structMember.name: redMinThreshold
structMember.description:
Specifies the minimum threshold used by the Random Early Detection (RED) drop mechanism. If the average queue length calculated by the RED mechanism, reaches the minimum threshold, packets are started to be dropped randomly with an increasing probability.
The threshold is specified as a proportion of the maximum queue length specified in attribute queueLength.
Guideline: The egress bandwidth, that is, the setting of attribute egressCir in MO TrafficScheduler, and the average packet size should influence the choice of this attribute value.
This attribute value should be less than or equal to the value of attribute redMaxThershold.

struct.name: EmergencyInfo
struct.description:
This attribute provides information about the current EmergencyState.
For the states NEVER_USED and USE_DISABLED the return value for time is insignificant.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The current emergency state of the license server.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description:
Indicates the remaining time in state ACTIVE or ACTIVE_AGAIN.
The time out values for the states ACTIVE is 7 days and for ACTIVE_AGAIN is varies from 14 to 7 days.
The time out value is 0 when the state is NEVER_USED, USE_DEGRADED and USE_DISABLED.
1 day = 86400 s 7 days = 604800 s 14 days = 1 209 600 s

structMember.name: expiryTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the expiry time as a string with the following format "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss".
The expiry time value is empty when the state is NEVER_USED, USE_DEGRADED and USE_DISABLED.

struct.name: IntegrationUnlockInfo
struct.description:
This attribute provides information about the current IntegrationUnlockState.
For the states NEVER_USED and USE_DISABLED the return value for remaining time is insignificant.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The current integration unlock state of the license server.

structMember.name: remainingTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the remaining time in state ACTIVATED
The time out value for the state ACTIVATED is 21 days.
The time out value is 0 when the state is NEVER_USED or USE_DISABLED.
1 day = 86400 s 21 days = 1814400 s

structMember.name: expiryTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the expiry time as a string with the following format "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss".
The expiry time value is empty when the state is NEVER_USED or USE_DISABLED.

structMember.name: lastSent
structMember.description:
Date and time when the last file was transferred.
The attribute is updated even if the transfer is unsuccessful.

structMember.name: transferInformation
structMember.description: Information about the last file transfer, including information about whether it was successful.

structMember.name: subFrameOffset
structMember.description: Frame synch offset measured in subframes.
structMember.deprecated: Since L11B. Value 6 is not part of the value range and shall not be used.

structMember.name: symbolOffset
structMember.description: Frame synch offset measured in symbols.
structMember.deprecated: Since L10B. Has no functional behaviour.

structMember.name: timeOffset
structMember.description: Frame synch offset measured in nano seconds.
structMember.deprecated: Since L10B. Has no functional behaviour.

structMember.name: mcc
structMember.description: Mobile Country Code (a part of the PLMN identity) for a cell that is served by a neighbor eNB.

structMember.name: mnc
structMember.description: Mobile Network Code (a part of the PLMN identity) for a cell that is served by a neighbor eNB.

structMember.name: mncLength
structMember.description:
This parameter defines the number of digits for the Mobile Network Code (a part of the PLMN identity) for a cell that is served by a neighbor eNB.
The PLMN identity combines the following two parts: 1. MobileCountryCode, MCC, 3 digits 2. MobileNetworkCode, MNC, 2 or 3 digits
Example: If MCC=125 and MNC=46, then plmnId=12546.

structMember.name: qHyst
structMember.description:
Cell reselection parameter that defines the hysteresis value for ranking criteria.
Corresponds to Qhyst in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tEvaluation
structMember.description:
The duration for evaluating criteria to enter mobility states.
Corresponds to TCRmax in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tHystNormal
structMember.description:
The additional duration for evaluating criteria to enter Normal-mobility state.
Corresponds to TCRmaxHyst in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: nCellChangeMedium
structMember.description:
The number of cell reselections during tEvaluation to enter Medium-mobility state.
Corresponds to NCR_M in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: nCellChangeHigh
structMember.description:
The number of cell reselections during tEvaluation to enter High-mobility state.
Corresponds to NCR_H in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: qHystSfMedium
structMember.description:
The additional hysteresis to be added, in Medium-mobility state, to qHyst.
Corresponds to 'Speed dependent ScalingFactor for Qhyst' in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: qHystSfHigh
structMember.description:
The additional hysteresis to be added, in High-mobility state, to qHyst.
Corresponds to 'Speed dependent ScalingFactor for Qhyst' in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: sIntraSearch
structMember.description:
Specifies the threshold when intra-frequency measurements are required.
Corresponds to SIntraSearchP in TS 36.304
Value 1000 means that the parameter is not present in System Information Block 3 and the UE applies the default value of infinity for SIntraSearchP.

structMember.name: sNonIntraSearch
structMember.description:
Specifies the threshold when inter-frequency and inter RAT measurements are required.
Corresponds to SNonIntraSearchP in TS 36.304
Value 1000 means that the parameter is not present in System Information Block 3 and the UE applies the default value of infinity for SNonIntraSearchP.

structMember.name: threshServingLow
structMember.description:
Specifies the threshold used by the UE on the serving cell when reselecting towards a lower priority RAT/ frequency.
Corresponds to ThreshServingLowP in TS 36.304.
structMember.deprecated: Since L12A. Replaced by new parameter (same name) in MOC EUtranCellFDD::threshServingLow and in MOC EUtranCellTDD::threshServingLow

structMember.name: sIntraSearchQ
structMember.description: Parameter "SIntraSearchQ" in TS 36.304. If the field is not present, the UE applies the (default) value of 0 dB for SIntraSearchQ.
structMember.dependencies: Including in system information depends on parameter sIntraSearchv920Active.

structMember.name: sIntraSearchP
structMember.description: Parameter "SIntraSearchP" in TS 36.304. See descriptions under s-IntraSearch.
structMember.dependencies: Including in system information depends on parameter sIntraSearchv920Active.

structMember.name: sNonIntraSearchQ
structMember.description: s-NonIntraSearchQ-r9 Parameter "SnonIntraSearchQ" in TS 36.304. If the field is not present, the UE applies the (default) value of 0 dB for SnonIntraSearch.
structMember.dependencies: Including in system information depends on parameter sNonIntraSearchv920Active.

structMember.name: sNonIntraSearchP
structMember.description: Parameter "SnonIntraSearchP" in TS 36.304. See descriptions under s-NonIntraSearch.
structMember.dependencies: Including in system information depends on parameter sNonIntraSearchv920Active.

structMember.name: threshServingLowQ
structMember.description:
Parameter "ThreshServing, LowQ" in TS 36.304.
Value 1000 means the parameter is not included in system information.

structMember.name: sIntraSearchv920Active
structMember.description: Enables sending of sIntraSearch v920 parameters in SIB3

structMember.name: sNonIntraSearchv920Active
structMember.description: Enables sending of sNonIntraSearch v920 parameters in SIB3

structMember.name: tReselectionUtra
structMember.description:
Specifies the cell reselection timer value which is applicable when evaluating cell reselection towards UTRAN.
Corresponds to TreselectionUTRA in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tReselectionUtraSfMedium
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionUTRA for Medium-mobility state.The parameter tReselectionUtra is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in Medium-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionUTRA" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionUtraSfMedium and tReselectionUtraSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionUtraSfHigh
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionUTRA for High-mobility state. The parameter tReselectionUtra is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in High-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionUTRA" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionUtraSfMedium and tReselectionUtraSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionGeran
structMember.description:
Specifies the cell reselection timer value which is applicable when evaluating cell reselection towards GERAN.
Corresponds to TreselectionGERA in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tReselectionGeranSfMedium
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionGERA for Medium-mobility state.The parameter tReselectionGera is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in Medium-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionGERA" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionGeraSfMedium and tReselectionGeraSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionGeranSfHigh
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionGERA for High-mobility state. The parameter tReselectionGera is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in High-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionGERA" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionGeraSfMedium and tReselectionGeraSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: acBarringFactorForMoSignalling

structMember.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by attributes on cell level. Replaced by EUtranCellFDD/EUtranCellTDD.acBarringForMoSignalling.AcBarringConfig.acBarringFactor.

structMember.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by attributes on cell level. Replaced by EUtranCellFDD/EUtranCellTDD.acBarringForMoData.AcBarringConfig.acBarringFactor.

structMember.name: searchWindowSizeCdma
structMember.description: Specifies the search window size for assisting in the search for neighbouring pilots in a CDMA2000 network.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdmaHrpd
structMember.description:
Specifies the cell reselection timer value which is applicable when evaluating cell reselection towards CDMA2000 HRPD.
Corresponds to TreselectionCDMA_HRPD in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdmaHrpdSfMedium
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionCDMA_HRPD for Medium-mobility state.The parameter tReselectionCdmaHrpd is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in Medium-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionCDMA_HRPD" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionCdmaHrpdSfMedium and tReselectionCdmaHrpdSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdmaHrpdSfHigh
structMember.description:
Specifies scaling factor for TreselectionCDMA_HRPD for High-mobility state. The parameter tReselectionCdmaHrpd is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in High-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0
Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionCDMA_HRPD" in TS 36.304
If both tReselectionHrpdSfMedium and tReselectionHrpdSfHigh is set to 100 they will not be broadcasted in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdma1xRtt
structMember.description: Cell reselection timer value applicable when evaluating cell reselection towards CDMA2000 1xRTT The value corresponds to TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT in TS 36.304.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdma1xRttSfHigh
structMember.description: Scaling factor for TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT for high-mobility state This parameter specifies the scaling factor to be used with TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT for High-mobility state. The parameter tReselectionCdma1xRtt is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in High-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0 Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT" in TS 36.304 If both tReselection1xRttSfMedium and tReselection1xRttSfHigh parameters are set to 100 they will not be broadcast in System Information.

structMember.name: tReselectionCdma1xRttSfMedium
structMember.description: Scaling factor for TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT for medium-mobility state The value of the tReselectionCdma1xRtt parameter is multiplied with this factor if the UE is in Medium-mobility state. Value mapping: 25 = 0.25 50 = 0.5 75 = 0.75 100 = 1.0 Corresponds to "Speed dependent ScalingFactor for TreselectionCDMA_1xRTT" in TS 36.304 If both tReselectionCdma1xRttSfMedium and tReselectionCdma1xRttSfHigh are set to 100 they will not be broadcast in System Information.

Indicates which subframes follow the OCNG pattern. For instance if indexes 3, 4 and 5 are set to TRUE in the array it means that subframe numbers 3, 4 and 5 use the OCNG pattern.
Takes effect: Feature start

structMember.name: bufferStatus

The status of the RLC buffer

structMember.name: noOfArtificialUsers
structMember.description:
Number of artificial users
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start

structMember.name: qciDistSinrHigh
structMember.description:
Distribution of UEs per QCI when SINR is HIGH
Unit: %
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start
Dependencies: The sum of all values through the distributions qciDistSinrHigh, qciDistSinrMedium and qciDistSinrLow must be 100%.

structMember.name: qciDistSinrMedium
structMember.description:
Distribution of UEs per QCI when SINR is MEDIUM
Unit: %
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start
Dependencies: The sum of all values through the distributions qciDistSinrHigh, qciDistSinrMedium and qciDistSinrLow must be 100%.

structMember.name: qciDistSinrLow
structMember.description:
Distribution of UEs per QCI when SINR is LOW.
Unit: %
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start
Dependencies: The sum of all values through the distributions qciDistSinrHigh, qciDistSinrMedium and qciDistSinrLow must be 100%.

structMember.name: ulDlRatioPerQci
structMember.description:
UL bit rate related to DL bit rate, per QCI. The value 100% means that UL has same load as DL. The value 0% means that there is no UL load.
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start

structMember.name: bitRatePerQci
structMember.description:
Average required bit rate needed by the service
Unit: kbit/s
Resolution: 1
Takes effect: Feature start

structMember.name: rncId
structMember.description: RNC identity used in the radio network. The RNC identity is a part of the RNTI.

structMember.name: cId
structMember.description: Cell Identity. Unique in the RNC. cId is the identifier of a cell in one RNC, and is used together with the rncId in the RNC as cell id at system information broadcast.

structMember.name: cornerLatitude
structMember.description: The latitude of a cell polygon corner expressed in 10^(-6) degrees. Positive values are used for the northen hemisphereare while negtive values are used for the southern hemisphere.

structMember.name: cornerLongitude
structMember.description: The longitude of a cell polygon corner expressed in 10^(-6) degrees. Positive values are used for the eastern hemisphere while negtive values are used for the western hemisphere.

structMember.name: posCellRadius
structMember.description: Defines the cell radius in meters.

structMember.name: posCellOpeningAngle
structMember.description:
Defines the opening angle of a cell (3 dB beam width) in deci-degrees.
The value 0 is used to define an omni cell.

structMember.name: posCellBearing
structMember.description: Defines the cell bearing in deci-degrees clockwise from north.

structMember.name: a1ThresholdRsrpPrimOffset
structMember.description:
QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a1ThresholdRsrpPrim. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA1Prim.a1ThresholdRsrpPrim. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA1Prim.a1ThresholdRsrpPrim+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a1ThresholdRsrpPrimOffset
If Mobility Control at Poor Coverage feature is enabled, "a1a2SearchThresholdRsrp" replaces "a1ThresholdRsrpPrim" and "ReportConfigSearch" replaces "ReportConfigA1Prim" in the above description.

structMember.name: a1ThresholdRsrpSecOffset
structMember.description: QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a1ThresholdRsrpSec. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA1Sec.a1ThresholdRsrpSec. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA1Sec.a1ThresholdRsrpSec+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a1ThresholdRsrpSecOffset

structMember.name: a1ThresholdRsrqPrimOffset
structMember.description: QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a1ThresholdRsrpPrim. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA1Prim.a1ThresholdRsrqPrim. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA1Prim.a1ThresholdRsrqPrim+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a1ThresholdRsrqPrimOffset

structMember.name: a1ThresholdRsrqSecOffset
structMember.description:
QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a1ThresholdRsrqSec. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA1Sec.a1ThresholdRsrqSec. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA1Sec.a1ThresholdRsrqSec+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a1ThresholdRsrqSecOffset
If Mobility Control at Poor Coverage feature is enabled, "a1a2SearchThresholdRsrq" replaces "a1ThresholdRsrqSec" and"ReportConfigSearch" replaces "ReportConfigA1Sec" in the above description.

structMember.name: a2ThresholdRsrpPrimOffset
structMember.description:
QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a2ThresholdRsrpPrim. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA2Prim.a2ThresholdRsrpPrim. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA2Prim.a2ThresholdRsrpPrim+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a2ThresholdRsrpPrimOffset
If Mobility Control at Poor Coverage feature is enabled, "a1a2SearchThresholdRsrp" replaces "a2ThresholdRsrpPrim" and"ReportConfigSearch" replaces "ReportConfigA2Prim" in the above description.

structMember.name: a2ThresholdRsrpSecOffset
structMember.description: QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a2ThresholdRsrpPrim. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA2Sec.a2ThresholdRsrpSec. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA2Sec.a2ThresholdRsrpSec+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a2ThresholdRsrpSecOffset

structMember.name: a2ThresholdRsrqPrimOffset
structMember.description: QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a2ThresholdRsrqPrim. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA2Prim.a2ThresholdRsrqPrim. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA2Prim.a2ThresholdRsrqPrim+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a2ThresholdRsrqPrimOffset

structMember.name: a2ThresholdRsrqSecOffset
structMember.description:
QCI dependent offset for the absolute threshold a2ThresholdRsqSec. If the value of the offset is 0, then the threshold corresponding to this QCI profile will be the same as the "base" value in the MO class, namely ReportConfigA2Sec.a2ThresholdRsrqSec. The rule is that the threshold for a certain QCI profile is computed as ReportConfigA2Sec.a2ThresholdRsrqSec+QciProfilePredefined.measReportConfigParams.a2ThresholdRsrqSecOffset
If Mobility Control at Poor Coverage feature is enabled, "a1a2SearchThresholdRsrq" replaces "a2ThresholdRsrqSec" and"ReportConfigSearch" replaces "ReportConfigA2Sec" in the above description.
