structMember.name: cellReselectionPriority
structMember.description: CellReselectionPriority concerns the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency, as used by the cell reselection procedure. Corresponds with parameter "priority" in TS 36.304. Value 0 means: lowest priority. The UE behaviour for the case the field is absent, if applicable, is specified in TS 36.304. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: connectedModeMobilityPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes EUTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. (0 means the lowest priority. -1 means the frequency is excluded.) When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of connectedModeMobilityPrio in MO: EUtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: arfcnValueEUtranDl
structMember.description: Indicates the ARFCN applicable for a downlink E-UTRA carrier frequency, as defined in 3GPP TS 36.104 for specified E-UTRA bands. For TDD this also indicate the ARFCN for uplink. The values that can be used depends on national operator specific frequency allocation as well as from the supported frequency band(s) of the equipment in the eNodeB. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: voicePrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes EUTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. Sets the priority to which frequency to perform mobility to for a voice session. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of voicePrio in MO: EUtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: cellReselectionPriority
structMember.description: CellReselectionPriority concerns the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency, as used by the cell reselection procedure. Corresponds with parameter "priority" in TS 36.304. Value 0 means: lowest priority. The UE behaviour for the case the field is absent, if applicable, is specified in TS 36.304. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: connectedModeMobilityPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes GERAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode (0 means the lowest priority. -1 means the frequency is excluded.) When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of connectedModeMobilityPrio in MO: GeranFreqGroupRelation is applied.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes GERAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of csFallbackPrio in MO: GeranFreqGroupRelation is applied.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrioEC
structMember.description: Prioritizes GERAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. Sets the priority to which frequency/frequency group to make CS Falback to. This parameter is only valid for emergency cs fallback calls. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of csFallbackPrioEC in MO: GeranFreqGroupRelation is applied.

structMember.name: bandIndicatorGERAN
structMember.description: GERAN-BandIndicator is used as an indication of how to interpret an associated GERAN carrier ARFCN. More specifically, the attribute indicates the GERAN frequency band in case the ARFCN value can concern either a DCS 1800 or a PCS 1900 carrier frequency. For ARFCN values not associated with one of these bands, the indicator has no meaning.

structMember.name: frequencyGroupId
structMember.description: This ID identifies the GeranFreqGroup in the network. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: cellReselectionPriority
structMember.description: CellReselectionPriority concerns the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency, as used by the cell reselection procedure. Corresponds with parameter "priority" in TS 36.304. Value 0 means: lowest priority. The UE behaviour for the case the field is absent, if applicable, is specified in TS 36.304. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: connectedModeMobilityPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes UTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. (0 means the lowest priority. -1 means the frequency is excluded.) When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of connectedModeMobilityPrio in MO: UtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: arfcnValueUtranDl
structMember.description: The arfcnValueUtran is used to indicate the ARFCN applicable for a downlink UTRAN carrier frequency, as defined in TS 25.331. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes UTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of csFallbackPrio in MO: UtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrioEC
structMember.description: Prioritizes UTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. Sets the priority to which frequency/frequency group to make CS Fallback to. This parameter is only valid for emergency cs fallback calls. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of csFallbackPrioEC in MO: UtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: voicePrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes UTRAN frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UEs in connected mode. Sets the priority to which frequency to perform mobility to for a voice session. The value -1 means the the frequency is excluded. The value 0 means the lowest priority. When value is cofigured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of voicePrio in MO: EUtranFreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: cellReselectionPriority
structMember.description: CellReselectionPriority concerns the absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency, as used by the cell reselection procedure. Corresponds with parameter "priority" in TS 36.304. Value 0 means: lowest priority. The UE behaviour for the case the field is absent, if applicable, is specified in TS 36.304. Note: The CellReselectionPriority within a hrpdBandClass must be the same.

structMember.name: connectedModeMobilityPrio
structMember.description: Prioritizes CDMA2000 bandclasses among all bandclasses related to the cell for UEs in connected mode (0 means the lowest priority. -1 means the frequency is excluded.) When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the value of connectedModeMobilityPrio in MO: Cdma2000FreqRelation is applied.

structMember.name: freqCdma
structMember.description: Identifies the carrier frequency within a CDMA2000 Band. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: hrpdBandClass
structMember.description: Identifies the HRPD Frequency Band in which the HRPD Carrier can be found.

structMember.name: enbId
structMember.description: The ENodeB ID that forms part of the Cell Global Identity.

structMember.name: cellId
structMember.description: RBS internal ID attribute for EUtranCell.

structMember.name: mcc
structMember.description: The MCC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network

structMember.name: mnc
structMember.description: The MNC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network.

structMember.name: mncLength
structMember.description: The length of the MNC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network.

structMember.name: acBarringFactor
structMember.description: If the random number drawn by the UE is lower than this value, access is allowed. Otherwise the access is barred.

structMember.name: acBarringTime
structMember.description: Mean access barring time in seconds for mobile originating signalling.

structMember.name: acBarringForSpecialAC
structMember.description: Access class barring for AC 11-15. The first instance in the list is for AC 11, second is for AC 12, and so on.

structMember.name: seqNo
structMember.description: The sequence number of the change request. This is unique for each change request. The number 0 is used only as initial value before the structure has been assigned valid values.

structMember.name: objectRef
structMember.description: Refererence to the MO instance containing the attribute to be changed.

structMember.name: attributeName
structMember.description: The name of the attribute to be changed.

structMember.name: originalValue
structMember.description: The original value of the attribute, in string format.

structMember.name: requestedValue
structMember.description: The requested value of the attribute, in string format.

structMember.name: causeCode
structMember.description: The cause of the change request.

structMember.name: causeString
structMember.description: The cause as the change request in free text description. Any trade-off between different functions is described here.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The state of the request. The initial state is Pending. If the request is rejected, the state is set to Rejected. If the request is approved, the state is set to Approved. If the eNodeB cancels the request, the state is set to Cancelled.

structMember.name: timeOfCreation
structMember.description: The date and time the request was created. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

structMember.name: timeOfChange
structMember.description: The date and time the request was changed. Format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

structMember.name: physicalLayerCellIdGroup
structMember.description:
The physical layer cell ID group. Physical-layer cell IDs are grouped into 168 unique physical-layer cell-identity groups, each group containing 3 unique subidentities.
This attribute together with physicalLayerSubCellId is used to calculate physical layer cell ID (see 3GPP TS 36.211).
Special Value: -1 is not a valid value and used as default.

structMember.name: physicalLayerSubCellId
structMember.description:
The subidentity within the physical layer cell ID group. Physical-layer cell IDs are grouped into 168 unique physical-layer cell-identity groups, each group containing 3 unique subidentities.
This attribute together with physicalLayerCellIdGroup is used to calculate physical layer cell identity (see 3GPP TS 36.211).
Special Value: -1 is not a valid value and used as default.

structMember.name: range
structMember.description: Indicates the number of physical layer cell identities in the range based on the start value derived form physicalLayerCellIdGroup and physicalLayerSubCellId.

structMember.name: radioframeAllocationPeriod
structMember.description: Radio-frames that contain MBSFN subframes occur when equation SFN mod radioFrameAllocationPeriod = radioFrameAllocationOffset is satisfied. When fourFrames is used for subframeAllocation, the equation defines the first radio frame referred to in the description below. Values 1 and 2 are not applicable when fourFrames is used for subframeAllocation.
structMember.dependencies: Values 1 and 2 are not applicable when 4 is used for subframeAllocation. It is required that radioframeAllocationOffset < radioframeAllocationPeriod.

structMember.name: radioframeAllocationOffset
structMember.description: Radio-frames that contain MBSFN subframes occur when equation SFN mod radioFrameAllocationPeriod = radioFrameAllocationOffset is satisfied.
structMember.dependencies: It is required that radioframeAllocationOffset < radioframeAllocationPeriod.

structMember.name: subframeAllocation
structMember.description: Defines the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period defined by the radioFrameAllocationPeriod and the radioFrameAllocationOffset. Two options are possible, i.e. if set to 1 the subframe allocation is set by the subframeAllocationOneFrame attribute, and if set to 4 the subframe allocation is set by the subframeAllocationFourFrame attribute.

structMember.name: subframeAllocationOneFrame
structMember.description: A bit-map indicating MBSFN subframe allocation in one radio frame. "1" denotes that the corresponding subframe is allocated for MBSFN. "0" denotes that the corresponding subframe is not allocated for MBSFN.The following mapping applies: FDD: The first/leftmost bit defines the MBSFN allocation for subframe #1, the second bit for #2, third bit for #3 , fourth bit for #6, fifth bit for #7, sixth bit for #8. TDD: The first/leftmost bit defines the allocation for subframe #3, the second bit for #4, third bit for #7, fourth bit for #8, fifth bit for #9. Uplink subframes are not allocated. The last bit is not used.

structMember.name: subframeAllocationFourFrame
structMember.description: A bit-map indicating MBSFN subframe allocation in four consecutive radio frames, "1" denotes that the corresponding subframe is allocated for MBSFN. "0" denotes that the corresponding subframe is not allocated for MBSFN. The bitmap is interpreted as follows: FDD: Starting from the first radioframe and from the first/leftmost bit in the bitmap, the allocation applies to subframes #1, #2, #3 , #6, #7, and #8 in the sequence of the four radio-frames. TDD: Starting from the first radioframe and from the first/leftmost bit in the bitmap, the allocation applies to subframes #3, #4, #7, #8, and #9 in the sequence of the four radio-frames. The last four bits are not used. Uplink subframes are not allocated.

structMember.name: mcc
structMember.description: The MCC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network.

structMember.name: mnc
structMember.description: The MNC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network.

structMember.name: mncLength
structMember.description: The length of the MNC part of a PLMN identity used in the radio network.

structMember.name: serviceId
structMember.description: Uniquely identifies the identity of an MBMS service within a PLMN. The field contains octet 3- 5 of the IE Temporary Mobile Group Identity (TMGI) as defined in TS 24.008 [49]. The first octet of the serviceId is set to 0. The second octet contains the third octet of the TMGI, the third octet contains the fourth octet of the TMGI and so on.

structMember.name: notificationRepetitionCoeff
structMember.description: The notification repetition coefficient Note: Actual change notification repetition period common for all MCCHs that are configured= shortest modification period/ notificationRepetitionCoeff. The 'shortest modificaton period' corresponds with the lowest value of mcch-ModificationPeriod of all MCCHs that are configured. Value n2 corresponds to coefficient 2, and so on.

structMember.name: notificationOffset
structMember.description: The notification offset Note:Specifies, together with the notificationRepetitionCoeff, the radio frames in which the MCCH information change notification is scheduled i.e. the MCCH information change notification is scheduled in radio frames for which: SFN mod notification repetition period = notificationOffset

structMember.name: notificationSFIndex
structMember.description: The notification SF index Note: Specifies the subframe used to transmit MCCH change notifications on PDCCH. FDD: Value 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 correspond with subframe #1, #2, #3 #6, #7, and #8 respectively. TDD: Value 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 correspond with subframe #3, #4, #7, #8, and #9 respectively.

structMember.name: notificationConfigurationPriority
structMember.description:
The absolute notification configuration priority
Value 0 means: lowest priority.

structMember.name: opProfileName
structMember.description: The Operational Profile name. Uniquely identifies an Operational Profile.

structMember.name: isActive
structMember.description: Indicates if the Operational Profile has been applied and is considered active.

structMember.name: isAutomatic
structMember.description: Indicates if the Operational Profile is applied automatic rather than manually applied.

structMember.name: lbA4ThresholdRsrpOffset
structMember.description: QCI specific offset for the absolute threshold a4ThresholdRsrp used for load management.

structMember.name: lbQciProfileHandling
structMember.description: Specifies QCI profile handling with regard to load management.

structMember.name: qciProfileRef
structMember.description: Refers to the QCI profile MO, QciProfilePredefined or QciProfileOperatorDefined.

structMember.name: lbUtranB1ThresholdRscpOffset
structMember.description: QCI specific offset to the threshold b1ThresholdRscp used for load management

structMember.name: lbQciProfileHandling
structMember.description: QCI profile handling with regard to load management

structMember.name: qciProfileRef
structMember.description: QCI profile MO: QciProfilePredefined or QciProfileOperatorDefined

structMember.name: freqCdma
structMember.description: Carrier frequency within a CDMA2000 1xRTT band When the value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored and the csFallbackPrio and csFallbackPrioEC apply to all frequencies within one band.

structMember.name: cdma1xRttBandClass
structMember.description: 1xRTT frequency band in which the 1xRTT Carrier can be found

structMember.name: cellReselectionPriority
structMember.description: Absolute priority of the concerned carrier frequency, as used by the cell reselection procedure The parameter corresponds with parameter "priority" in TS 36.304. Value 0 means: lowest priority. The UE behavior when the field is absent, if applicable, is specified in TS 36.304. Note: The CellReselectionPriority within a 1xRTTBandClass must be the same.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrio
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT CSFB frequency priority This parameter prioritizes CDMA2000 1xRTT frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UE in connected mode (0 means the lowest priority). When the value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored. Sets the priority to which frequency to make CS Fallback to (0 means the lowest priority). This parameter is only valid for normal CS Fallback calls. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: csFallbackPrioEC
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT CSFB frequency priority This parameter prioritizes CDMA2000 1xRTT frequencies among all frequencies related to the cell for UE in connected mode. It also sets the priority to which frequency to make CS Fallback to (0 means the lowest priority). This parameter is only valid for emergency CS Fallback calls. When value is configured to -1000, the parameter is ignored.

structMember.name: acBarring0to9R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload classes 0 through 9. It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload classes 0 through 9.

structMember.name: acBarring10R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 10.

structMember.name: acBarring11R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 11.

structMember.name: acBarring12R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 12.

structMember.name: acBarring13R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration Thisparameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 13.

structMember.name: acBarring14R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 14.

structMember.name: acBarring15R9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for access overload class N (N = 10 to 15). It is the parameter "PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0 for access overload class 15.

structMember.name: acBarringMsgR9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for modifying the access class barring factor for message transmissions. It is the parameter "MSG_PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0.

structMember.name: acBarringRegR9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for modifying the access class barring factor for autonomous registrations. It is the parameter "REG_PSIST" in C.S0004-A v6.0

structMember.name: acBarringEmgR9
structMember.description: Access class barring factor configuration This parameter used for calculating the access class barring factor for emergency calls and emergency message transmissions for access overload classes 0 through 9. It is the parameter "PSIST_EMG" in C.S0004-A v6.0

structMember.name: multipleSid
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Multiple SID storage indicator

structMember.name: multipleNid
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Multiple NID storage indicator

structMember.name: homeReg
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Home registration indicator

structMember.name: foreignSidReg
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT SID roamer registration indicator

structMember.name: foreignNidReg
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT NID roamer registration indicator

structMember.name: parameterReg
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Parameter-change registration indicator

structMember.name: powerUpReg
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Power-up registration indicator 2^(REG_PRD/4) * 0.08 seconds

structMember.name: registrationPeriod
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Registration period

structMember.name: registrationZone
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Registration zone The range for zones is only 0-255. Unique zones are identified by REG_ZONE, plus the SID/NID of the zone. When a mobile moves into a new registration zone (uniquely identified by REG_ZONE + SID + NID with its own timer) not on its internally stored list (up to TOTAL_ZONES entries) of visited registration zones, zone registration causes the mobile to register. Zones in the mobile are deleted upon expiration of a timer stored on mobile. After system access, timers (ZONE_TIMER value) are enabled for every zone except the one where the registration attempt was successful.

structMember.name: totalZone
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT number of registration zones to be retained The maximum number of zones in which the MS may be considered registered. 0 disables zone registration. Value of at least 2 should be used for hysteresis when zone registration is enabled. For MTX border sites, parameter registrations should always be disabled and zone registration should be enabled.

structMember.name: zoneTimer
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT zone timer length Range 0 - 7 (equates to 1, 2, 5, 10, 20, 30, 45, 60 minutes respectively). The higher the value, the less frequent the registrations.

structMember.name: powerDownRegR9
structMember.description: CDMA2000 1xRTT Power-down registration indicator If set to TRUE, the UE that has a valid / current CDMA2000 1xRTT pre-registration performs a CDMA2000 1xRTT power down registration when it is switched off.

structMember.name: protocolRev
structMember.description: P_REV in C.S0097 5=IS95B, 7=IS2000 Release A, 6 = 1S2000 Release 0. The protocol revision level of the BTS. The valid values for the 800 MHz band class are 2, 3, 5, 6, and 7. The valid values for the 1900 MHz band class are 1, 5, 6, and 7.
structMember.dependencies: Depends on value of cdmaBandClass If 1xRTTBandClass is "BAND_CLASS_0", the valid values are 2, 3, 5, 6, and 7. if 1xRTTBandClass is "BAND_CLASS_14", the valid values are 1, 5, 6, and 7.

structMember.name: minProtocolRev
structMember.description: MIN_P_REV in C.S0097 1 for 1900 MHz, 3 for 800 MHz
structMember.dependencies: Depends on value of 1xRTTBandClass If 1xRTTBandClass is "BAND_CLASS_0", the valid value is 3. if 1xRTTBandClass is "BAND_CLASS_14", the valid value is 1.

structMember.name: authenticationEnabled
structMember.description: AUTH in C.S0097 This parameter indicates whether the authentication is enabled.

structMember.name: maxNumAltServiceOption
structMember.description: MAX_NUM_ALT_SO in C.S0097 Use 0 for PREV 7 operation (to support 10-digit emergency call numbers). Set the value to 1 Per CAB 128 only if not using PREV 7 BTS. Value 0 is also a flag to IVSN to query if mobile capability is not stored in VLR, even for P_REV > 5 mobiles (Ensure a QueryOpt for IVSN is selected in MTX Table NOISBSC). EnableORCM set TRUE will address CAB-128 concern and effectively negates reason for CAB-128

structMember.name: preferredMsidType
structMember.description: PREF_MSID_TYPE in C.S0097 The preferred identity used by mobile
structMember.dependencies: Depends on IMSI_T_SUPPORTED. If IMSI_T_SUPPORTED is false, the value can not be set as "IMSIS_ESN"

structMember.name: mcc
structMember.description: Part of country code MCC of USA = 310 MCC of Canada = 302 MCC of Australia = 505

structMember.name: imsiBit11and12
structMember.description: IMSI_11_12 in C.S0097 The 11th and 12th digits of the IMSI.

structMember.name: imsiTSupported
structMember.description: BTS IMSI-T supported indicator Set to True to enable IMSI-T support.

structMember.name: fchFchInitSetupRc3
structMember.description: FPC_FCH_INIT_SETUP_RC3 in C.S0097 7dB, matches ECAM range/granularity of 8 bits/0.125dB.

structMember.name: fchFchInitSetupRc4
structMember.description: FPC_FCH_INIT_SETUP_RC4 in C.S0097 7dB, matches ECAM range/granularity of 8 bits/0.125dB.

structMember.name: fchFchInitSetupRc5
structMember.description: FPC_FCH_INIT_SETUP_RC5 in C.S0097 7dB, matches ECAM range/granularity of 8 bits/0.125dB.

structMember.name: fchFchInitSetupRc11
structMember.description: FPC_FCH_INIT_SETUP_RC11 in C.S0097 8dB, matches ECAM range/granularity of 8 bits/0.125dB.

structMember.name: fchFchInitSetupRc12
structMember.description: FPC_FCH_INIT_SETUP_RC12 in C.S0097 8dB, matches ECAM range/granularity of 8 bits/0.125dB.

structMember.name: pilotIncluded
structMember.description: PILOT_INC in C.S0097 This parameter indicates whether the pilot list is included.

structMember.name: localTimeOffset
structMember.description: LTM_OFF in C.S0097 This parameter indicates the offset of local time in units of 0.5hr from system time (GPS).

structMember.name: dayLightSaving
structMember.description: DAYLT in C.S0097 This parameter indicates whether Daylight savings is on or off.

structMember.name: gcsnaL2AckTimer
structMember.description: Length of time the mobile station or IWS waits after it sends GCSNA1xCircuitService message, in units of 80ms

structMember.name: gcsnaSequenceContextTimer
structMember.description: GCSNASequenceContextTimer value The value of GCSNASequenceContextTimer is greater than the value of GCSNAL2AckTimer. This field is in units of 100 ms.

structMember.name: marketId
structMember.description: Market ID in MSC identifier Refer to 3GPP2, A.S0014-C, table 4.2.17-4

structMember.name: switchNumber
structMember.description: Switch Number in MSC identifier Refer to 3GPP2, A.S0014-C, table 4.2.17-4

structMember.name: cellId
structMember.description: Cell identity, 12 bit Refer to 3GPP2, A.S0014-C, table 4.2.17-4. It is used along with sectorNumber, SID, and NID for the 1xRTT cell global identity. It is used with marketId, switchNumber and sectorNumber to set the sectorId field on S1AP UL CDMA Tunneling message.

structMember.name: sectorNumber
structMember.description: Sector number, 4bit Refer to 3GPP2, A.S0014-C, table 4.2.17-4. It is used along with CellId, SID, and NID for the 1xRTT cell global identity. It is used with marketId, switchNumber and CellId to set the sectorId field on S1AP UL CDMA Tunneling message.

structMember.name: name
structMember.description: The name of the attribute.

structMember.name: value
structMember.description: The value of the attribute.

structMember.name: message
structMember.description:
Provides additional results.
The initial value is an emtpy string (""). Currently not used.

structMember.name: startTime
structMember.description:
The time the health check starts.
Format: yyyy:MM:dd HH:mm
The initial value is an empty string ("").

structMember.name: healthCheckResultCode
structMember.description: The result of the health check.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description:
The time of the day, when the action startHealthCheck starts.
Format: hh:mm
hh - hour mm - minutes

structMember.name: weekday
structMember.description: The weekday, when the action startHealthCheck starts.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date is represented in two ways:
- the preferred syntax is four-digits for the year, two digits for the month, and two digits for the day, a total of eight characters. Example: 19991231
- the date is also be represented by two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week, and two digits for the number of the week, a total of five characters. Example: 99W52
The production date is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage and LoadModule.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description:
The name of the product.
The product name is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
The product number of the product or document.
Examples: ABC 101 001, CXC 123 456, 1/BFD 101 999
For UpgradePackage, this is the document number of the upgrade package.
Maximum length for a product number is 36 when referring to a document.
The product number is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
The revision state of the product.
Examples: R1, R1A, R1A02, P7B
The product revision is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number consists of 13 alphanumerical characters grouped as 6 plus 7 characters. The first 6 characters are to be used for factory codes and the last 7 characters are used for an individual number or batch number.

structMember.name: testState
structMember.description: Current state of battery test.

structMember.name: measuredElapsedTime
structMember.description: Time from test start until execution of this action Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: measuredConsumedCapacityInTest
structMember.description: Measured total consumed capacity from test start until execution of this action Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: estimatedRemainingBackupTime
structMember.description: Calculated estimate of remaining backup time Dependencies: The value is only defined if a battery capacity test is executed. The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test is executed. The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: initiation
structMember.description: Describes how the battery test was initiated.

structMember.name: startDate
structMember.description: The date the battery test was started. Format: "YYYYMMDD"

structMember.name: startTime
structMember.description: The time the battery test was started. Format: "HH:MM", 24 h format

structMember.name: measuredConsumedCapacity
structMember.description: Measured total consumed capacity from test start until end of test

structMember.name: measuredBackupTime
structMember.description: The measured time from test start until end of test

structMember.name: estimatedNominalBatteryCapacity
structMember.description: Estimated nominal battery capacity of the tested battery Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test was executed.

structMember.name: estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth
structMember.description: Estimated state-of-health of the tested battery. State-Of-Health is calculated as: estimatedNominalBatteryCapacity / referenceBatteryCapacity * 100 Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test was executed.

structMember.name: outcome
structMember.description:
Outcome of the automatic evaluation of the battery test Possible values: • UNDEFINED • PASSED • FAILED
Dependencies: For a battery capacity test, the evaluation is done by comparing the estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth with the minimumStateOfHealth, if test mode is set to CONFIGURED. If testMode is set to AUTOMATIC, the estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth is compared with 70%. For a battery backup time test, the evaluation is done by comparing the measuredBackupTime with the minimumBackupTime.

structMember.name: faultReason
structMember.description: The reason why the configuration failed.

structMember.name: faultInformation
structMember.description: Additional Information describing the configuration fault.

structMember.name: modificationState
structMember.description: Indicates the status of the modification operation.

structMember.name: modificationInformation
structMember.description: Indicates the progress of the modification operation.

structMember.name: countryCode
structMember.description: Two-letter country-code.

structMember.name: descriptionOfFault
structMember.description: Specific description of the fault observed.

structMember.name: preparedBy
structMember.description: Name of the operator preparing the log entry.

structMember.name: reference
structMember.description: Complaint reference.

structMember.name: stateCode
structMember.description:
The hardware status when the failure occurred.
R = Repaired unit failed during installation or test. S = Unit in service when failure occurred. T = New unit failed during installation or test.

structMember.name: timeDate
structMember.description: Date and time when the log entry was written in the format "yymmdd hhmmss"

structMember.name: trNumber
structMember.description: A trouble report number.

structMember.name: noLimit
structMember.description: Specifies if no limit is applied.

structMember.name: value
structMember.description: The value to apply, if noLimit is false.

structMember.name: startDate
structMember.description: Date when the grace period was activated by the system. Is empty if the grace period has not yet been triggered. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

structMember.name: originalLicenseLimit
structMember.description: Shows which value the capacity license had when it entered Grace Period.

structMember.name: isGracePeriodControlled
structMember.description: Indicates if a grace period is supported for the capacity.

structMember.name: gracePeriodState
structMember.description: Indicates the current state of the grace period.

structMember.name: stopDate
structMember.description: Date when sharp licence control for this capacity license will be enforced. Is empty if the grace period has not yet been triggered. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

structMember.name: fileName
structMember.description: The full remote path and filename denoting a certificate file on a remote host (file server).

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description:
A string of decimal digits containing the unique serial number of the certificate assigned by the certificate issuer.
Restriction: The only allowed characters for this string are the digits 0 to 9.

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name of the authority that has issued the certificate.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name denoting the entity for which the certificate was issued.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: A string representation of the certificate serial number (up to 40 digits long).

structMember.name: notValidBefore
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: notValidAfter
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: caFingerPrint
structMember.description:
The certificate fingerprint for the Certificate Authority which issues the node certificate.
The fingerprint is a string in the following format:<hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39

structMember.name: enrollmentServerURL
structMember.description:
This must be a full URL for the enrollment server to use. The URL contains: method, host, an optional port, and URI parts.
The method is always http://
The host must be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. Example: 192.168.33.27
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: [2001:db8:0::1] Note that the square brackets are included in the URL to distinguish the host IPv6 address from the port designation.
The optional port designation is written by appending a colon followed by the port to the host part. Example: 192.168.33.27:8080. If no port is given, the default HTTP port 80 is used.
The URI is the resource identifier of the resource on the server which will process the request. Example: /cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://192.168.33.27:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

structMember.name: distinguishedName
structMember.description:
The Distinguished Name (DN) to be used in the Subject field of the requested certificate. The component fields of the DN are encoded as FIELDNAME "=" VALUE where fields are separated with a comma (,) character.
Example: C=SE, L=LI, O=Ericsson AB, OU=PJF/LO, CN=RBS 123
As the comma character is used as field delimiter, a field value cannot contain it.
This string cannot be empty.

structMember.name: challengePassword
structMember.description: A string which allows the enrollment server to authenticate the request.

structMember.name: rollbackTimeOut
structMember.description:
If this parameter is set to a positive value and if no confirmation action has been executed within the rollback timeout, a rollback is performed automatically. After this rollback, the previous node credential applies.
This mechanism is a safeguard against the risk that the new credentials are unusable.
If this parameter is set to zero, no rollback takes place. It is recommended to set this parameter to 10 minutes.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name of the authority that has issued the certificate.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name denoting the entity for which the certificate was issued.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: A string representation of the certificate serial number (up to 10 digits long).

structMember.name: notValidBefore
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: notValidAfter
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

struct.name: BoardTypePositions
struct.description:
Indicates the slot positions in the subrack where it is possible to insert the CMXB, SCU and TU boards.
If any of these positions are not specified, then a board type position with the value 0 is created.

structMember.name: cmxbPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Ethernet Switch Board, CMXB, is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: cmxbPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Ethernet Switch Board, CMXB, is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: scuPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Switch Control Unit (SCU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: scuPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Switch Control Unit (SCU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: tuPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Timing Unit (TU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: tuPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Timing Unit (TU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

The value 0 means that this program instance does not belong to any restart group.

class.name: AnrFunction
class.description: Contains parameters and constraints for Automatic Neighbor Relations (ANR) functions, such as adding or removing neighbor cells.

attribute.name: AnrFunctionId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: cellAddRankLimitEutran
attribute.description: Threshold value for reported rank for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: cellAddRsrpOffsetEutran

attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Has no functional behavior, planned to be removed.

attribute.name: cellAddRsrpThresholdEutran
attribute.description: Threshold value for reported power for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::cellAddRsrpThresholdEutran.

attribute.name: cellAddRsrqOffsetEutran

attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Has no functional behavior, planned to be removed.

attribute.name: cellAddRsrqThresholdEutran
attribute.description: Threshold value for reported quality for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::cellAddRsrqThresholdEutran.

attribute.name: hoAllowedEutranPolicy
attribute.description: Starting value of the attribute isHoAllowed when a EUtranCellRelation is created by Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::hoAllowedEutranPolicy.

attribute.name: removeNcellTime
attribute.description: The length of time that neighbor cells without any neighbor relations remain in the RBS. 1000 means no automatic removal is performed. If set to 0, the neighbor cell MO is removed within 1 minute. Ericsson strongly recommend that value 0 shall not be used, due to the fact that when setting this value to 0, this might lead to that X2 connections are removed together with all external cells and are setup once again every minute this causes one a network level a huge pressure one the nodes.

attribute.name: removeNenbTime
attribute.description: The length of time that neighbor RBSs without any neighbor cells remain in the RBS. 1000 means no automatic removal is performed. If set to 0, the neighbor RBS MO is removed within 1 minute.

attribute.name: removeNrelTime
attribute.description: The length of time that neighbor relations without any communication to the neighbor cell remain in the RBS. 1000 means no automatic removal is performed. If set to 0, the neighbor relation MO is removed within 1 minute. Ericsson strongly recommend that value 0 shall not be used, due to the fact that when setting this value to 0, then new CGI measurements is performed, for any relation not used for handover already after 1 minute of not being used.

attribute.name: x2SetupPolicy
attribute.description: Indicates if X2 is set up when an ExternalEnbFunction not in the x2BlackList is created by Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::x2SetupPolicy.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFMax
attribute.description: The maximum target number of UEs in each cell that are assigned Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR)-specific thresholds for E-UTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::anrUesEUtraIntraFMax.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFMin
attribute.description: The minimum target number of UEs in each cell that are assigned Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR)-specific thresholds for E-UTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::anrUesEUtraIntraFMin.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFDecr
attribute.description: The decrease in the target number of UEs in each cell that are assigned Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR)-specific thresholds for E-UTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report is received with only known neighbor cells.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::anrUesEUtraIntraFDecr.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrHo
attribute.description: The increase in the target number of UEs in each cell that are assigned Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR)-specific thresholds for E-UTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report for handover is received with unknown neighbor cells.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrHo.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrAnr
attribute.description: The increase in the target number of UEs in each cell that are assigned Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR)-specific thresholds for E-UTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report for ANR is received with unknown neighbor cells.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by AnrFunctionEUtran::anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrAnr.

attribute.name: noOfTimesToCheckRel
attribute.description: This parameter defines the number of times that a suspected neighbour relation (if there are more then one cell with the same PCI), shall be checked using CGI reports.

attribute.name: zzzTemporary1
attribute.description: Temporary attributes are intended for temporary solutions, and their usage may vary depending on the installed software. It is strongly recommended to only set the attributes that correspond to a desired functionality and leave all other temporary attributes set to default value. Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

attribute.name: zzzTemporary2
attribute.description: Temporary attributes are intended for temporary solutions, and their usage may vary depending on the installed software. It is strongly recommended to only set the attributes that correspond to a desired functionality and leave all other temporary attributes set to default value. Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

attribute.description: Temporary attributes are intended for temporary solutions, and their usage may vary depending on the installed software. Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

Information in the descriptions about what attributes are in use may be overridden by the information in CPI Info documents. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

attribute.description: Temporary attributes are intended for temporary solutions, and their usage may vary depending on the installed software. Note that a later release may use another attribute to control the functionality previously provided by a temporary attribute, or may remove the functionality altogether. In these cases, the change is documented in the NIR.

attribute.name: prioTime
attribute.description: Defines the weight of "time since last use" when determining the relation priority. The priority is used when deciding which relation to remove, when too many relations have been added. The priority is also used when determining which UTRAN cell to perform mobility measurements for.

attribute.name: prioHoSuccRate
attribute.description: Defines the weight of "handover success rate" when determining the relation priority. The priority is used when deciding which relation to remove, when too many relations have been added. The priority is also used when determining which UTRAN cell to perform mobility measurements for.

attribute.name: prioHoRate
attribute.description: Defines the weight of "handover rate" when determining the relation priority. The priority is used when deciding which relation to remove, when too many relations have been added. The priority is also used when determining which UTRAN cell to perform mobility measurements for.

attribute.name: maxNoPciReportsInact
attribute.description: Defines a maximal value of reports that any UE has to provide the ANR function with based on periodical PCI measurements, that is used to measure on Utran and Geran neighbors. Special Value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: maxTimeEventBasedPciConf
attribute.description: Defines a maximal time that any UE has to assist ANR function with event based measurements, that is sued to measure on Eutran neighbors. Special Value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: maxNoPciReportsEvent
attribute.description: Defines a maximal value of reports that any UE has to provide the ANR function with on event based measurements, that is sued to measure on Eutran neighbors. Special Value: 0 means infinity.

class.name: AnrFunctionEUtran
class.description: The parameters and constraints for LTE Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) functions.

attribute.name: AnrFunctionEUtranId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: anrUesThreshInterFMax
attribute.description: This parameter defines the maximum target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.

attribute.name: anrUesThreshInterFMin
attribute.description: This parameter defines the minimum target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.

attribute.name: anrUesThreshInterFDecr
attribute.description: This parameter defines the decrease in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN inter-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report is received with only known neighbor cells.

attribute.name: anrUesThreshInterFIncrHo
attribute.description: This parameter defines the increase in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report for HO is received with unknown neighbor cells.

attribute.name: anrUesThreshInterFIncrAnr
attribute.description: This parameter defines the increase in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN inter-frequency neighbor cell reports, every time a neighbor cell report for ANR is received with unknown neighbor cells.

attribute.name: anrInterFreqState
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the Automated Neighbor Relation (ANR) function support for Inter frequency LTE for one RBS. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the ANR feature.

attribute.name: anrIntraFreqState
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the Automated Neighbor Relation (ANR) function support for Intra frequency LTE for one RBS. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the ANR feature.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFDecr
attribute.description: This parameter defines the decrease in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbour cell reports, every time a neighbour cell report is received with only known neighbour cells.

attribute.name: cellAddRsrpThresholdEutran
attribute.description: Threshold value for reported power for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrHo
attribute.description: This parameter defines the increase in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbour cell reports, every time a neighbour cell report for HO is received with unknown neighbour cells.

attribute.name: x2SetupPolicy
attribute.description: Indicates if X2 is to be set up when an ExternalEnbFunction that is not in the x2BlackList is created by ANR (Automatic Neighbor Relations).

attribute.name: cellAddRsrqThresholdEutran
attribute.description: Threshold value for reported quality for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFMin
attribute.description: This parameter defines the minimum target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbour cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFMax
attribute.description: This parameter defines the maximum target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbour cell reports. The actual number of UEs with these thresholds may deviate from the target.

attribute.name: hoAllowedEutranPolicy
attribute.description: Starting value of the parameter isHoAllowed when a EUtranCellRelation is created by ANR (Automatic Neighbor Relations) or X2.

attribute.name: anrUesEUtraIntraFIncrAnr
attribute.description: This parameter defines the increase in the target number of UEs in each cell, that are assigned ANR specific thresholds for EUTRAN intra-frequency neighbour cell reports, every time a neighbour cell report for ANR is received with unknown neighbour cells.

class.name: AnrFunctionUtran
class.description: This managed object contains parameters and constraints for the UTRAN Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) functions.

attribute.name: anrStateUtran
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the Automated Neighbor Relation (ANR) function support for Utran for one RBS. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the ANR feature.

attribute.name: AnrFunctionUtranId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: anrUtranMeasReportMax
attribute.description: Defines the maximum target number of measurement reports per hour for each UtranFreqRelation/UtranTDDFreqRelation. The number of measurement reports may deviate from the target. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrUtranMeasReportMin
attribute.description: Defines the minimum target number of measurement reports per hour for each UtranFreqRelation/UtranTDDFreqRelation. The number of measurement reports may deviate from the target. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrUtranMeasReportDecr
attribute.description: Defines the decrease in the target number of measurement reports for each UtranFreqRelation/UtranTDDFreqRelation each time an Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) UTRAN measurement report is received with only known neighbor cells. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrUtranMeasReportIncr
attribute.description: Defines the increase in the target number of measurement reports for each UtranFreqRelation/UtranTDDFreqRelation each time an Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) UTRAN measurement report is received with unknown neighbor UTRAN cells. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: hoAllowedUtranPolicy
attribute.description: Starting value of the parameter isHoAllowed when a UtranCellRelation is created by ANR (Automatic Neighbor Relations)

attribute.name: anrUtranMeasReportAcIncr
attribute.description: Defines the increase in the target number of measurement reports for each UtranFreqRelation/UtranTDDFreqRelation each time an PCI measurement report is received with known cell but the corresponding LAC or RAC missing. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrUtranAcMeasOn
attribute.description: Indicates whether more CGI measurements shall be initiated to find LAC and/or RAC for cells that were previously added by ANR with missing LAC or RAC.

attribute.name: rimIntegrationEnabled
attribute.description: This parameter indicates if ANR should be able to modify RIM associations to UTRAN cells.

attribute.name: cellAddRscpThresholdUtranDelta
attribute.description: This parameter together with b2Threshold2RscpUtra specifies "The Received Signal Code Power" (RSCP) threshold value for reported power for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor. The equation for calculating the RSCP threshold is b2Threshold2RscpUtra + cellAddRscpThresholdUtranDelta.

attribute.name: cellAddEcNoThresholdUtranDelta
attribute.description: This parameter together with b2Threshold2EcNoUtra specifies "Ratio of energy per modulation bit to noise spectral density" threshold value for reported EcNo for a cell to be automatically added as neighbor. The equation for calculating the EcNo threshold is b2Threshold2EcNoUtra + cellAddEcNoThresholdUtranDelta.

class.name: AnrFunctionGeran
class.description: This managed object contains parameters and constraints for GERAN Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) functions.

attribute.name: anrStateGsm
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) function support for GSM for one RBS. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the ANR feature.

attribute.name: AnrFunctionGeranId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: anrGeranMeasReportMax
attribute.description: The maximum target number of measurement reports per hour for each GeranFrequencyGroupRelation. The number of measurement reports may deviate from the target. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrGeranMeasReportMin
attribute.description: The minimum target number of measurement reports per hour for each GeranFrequencyGroupRelation. The number of measurement reports may deviate from the target. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrGeranMeasReportDecr
attribute.description: The decrease in the target number of measurement reports per GeranFrequencyGroupRelation each time an Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) GERAN measurement report is received with only known neighbor cells. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrGeranMeasReportIncr
attribute.description: Defines the increase in the target number of measurement reports per GeranFrequencyGroupRelation each time an Automated Neighbor Relations (ANR) GERAN measurement report is received with unknown neighbor GERAN cells or an unknown cell found in GERAN mobility report. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: rimIntegrationEnabled
attribute.description: This parameter indicates if ANR should be able to modify RIM associations to GERAN cells

attribute.name: anrGeranMeasReportRacIncr
attribute.description: Defines the increase in the target number of measurement reports for each GeranFreqGroupRelation each time an PCI measurement report is received with known cell but the corresponding RAC missing. Please note that the unit is decMeasurementReport. Thus, the given number of measurement reports will be divided by 10.

attribute.name: anrGeranRacMeasOn
attribute.description: Indicates whether more CGI measurements shall be initiated to find RAC for cells that were previously added by ANR with missing RAC.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: Specifies the Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) for the outgoing IP packets.

attribute.name: ipAccessList
attribute.description: Specifies the references to IpAccessHostEt MO (on EvoC 8200/RNC) or to IpTermServ MO (on RNC 3820).

attribute.name: firstMainServerAddresses
attribute.description:
Specifies the primary and secondary IP addresses for the first cluster member that holds a main INC server.
An added INC Server, which was previously unknown is added immediately.
A removed INC Server no longer acts as Main INC Server, but it remains in the cluster.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
IPv6 address is not support.

attribute.name: memberIdentity
attribute.description: Specifies the unique identity.

attribute.name: NodeClusterCommunicationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: secondMainServerAddresses
attribute.description:
Specifies the primary and secondary IP addresses for the second cluster member that holds a main INC server.
Main cluster members do not configure this attribute.
Normal cluster members use this attribute to allow redundancy in the cluster establishment.
An added INC Server, which was previously unknown is added immediately.
A removed INC Server will not take effect until after node restart.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
IPv6 address is not support.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.

class.name: SubrackProdType
class.description:
Subrack Product Type
Defines data specific for a subrack type, such as the configuration for the number of slots and the administrative product data.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade. It is also possible to create instances manually, but this is not recommended.

attribute.name: boardPositions
attribute.description:
Indicates the slot positions in the subrack where it is possible to insert the CMXB, SCU and TU boards.
If any of these positions are not specified, then a board type position with the value 0 is created.

attribute.name: defNumberOfSlots
attribute.description: Defines the number of slots to be created in the subrack.

attribute.name: fanConfiguration
attribute.description:
Indicates the fan configuration in the subrack.
It is silent ignored if the attribute numberOfDenibDevices in MO Subrack is set to > -1. In this case the numberOfDenibDevices overrides this attribute for the fan configuration.

attribute.name: maxPowerDissipation
attribute.description:
Enables programs to read the specified maximum power dissipation.
This reading is needed to prevent subrack from overheating.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
Specifies the product data for the backplane of the subrack.
Recommended: Exclude the trailing letters in the product revision of this MO. Examples: - R2B corresponds to R2 - R2B/3 remains as R2B/3 - R2B/A corresponds to R2

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: SubrackProdTypeId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.
Note that if this MO is manually created (not recommended) the value for this attribute has to be set.

attribute.name: transmissionType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of transmission.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Slot
class.description:
This MO represents a slot in a subrack. A slot can hold a plug-in-unit, a board represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The number of slots in a subrack is specified when defining the Subrack MO.
The required number of Slot MOs are created automatically at creation of the Subrack MO, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is selected with Slot=1 at the leftmost slot, and with incremental numbering towards the right hand side of the subrack.

attribute.name: SlotId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: slotState
attribute.description: Indicates the state of the slot.

attribute.name: slotNumber
attribute.description: The number of the slot position from the left hand side, starting with 1.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
Describes the plug-in-unit that is currently inserted. The information is only available when slotState = USED.
If the board inserted in the slot stops working or is pulled out of the slot, the productData attribute will not change its value. The value of this attribute is changed when a new board is inserted into the slot.

attribute.name: upgradeGroupId
attribute.description:
This attribute can to group a number of PIUs, all in the group can be upgraded at the same time.
If upgradeGroupTypeName is "", this attribute is not used.

attribute.name: upgradeGroupTypeName
attribute.description: The upgradeGroupTypeName, together with the upgradeGroupId, defines an upgrade group.

attribute.name: activeSwAllocation
attribute.description:
The SwAllocation instance, among the predefined instances, which is active.
The SwAllocation instance which is active is the one currently used by the PlugInUnit, configured in this Slot. If no PlugInUnit is configured or if no matching SwAllocation, containing the specific PiuType, is found, the value of this attribute is null.

action.name: updateConfiguration
action.description: If autoConfiguration is enabled in ManagedElementData, this action will trigger auto configuration activities for the slot.

class.name: Equipment
class.description:
This MO is used as a structural element for the network element, that is, it only acts as a container for other MOs. This MO structures the equipment of the network element.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Equipment=1.

attribute.name: EquipmentId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: lastHwPiChange
attribute.description: Indicates the timestamp when the last hardware product information is changed.

class.name: Subrack
class.description: This MO is used to represent a subrack.

attribute.name: SubrackId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: switchModule
attribute.description:
Reference to a SwitchModule MO, where the switch module number is retrieved.
This number describes how the subrack is connected to the node, that is, how the subrack's cables are connected to the hub subrack. The hub subrack has switch module number 0. The default value of this attribute is NULL, which means that the switch module number is 0.
If the attribute transmissionType in the MO SubrackProdType is set to ATM_TRANSMISSION or ETHERNET10G, this attribute is mandatory. If transmissionType is set to ETHERNET_CABLE or ETHERNET_1G_10G, this attribute must be set to NULL.

attribute.name: subrackType
attribute.description: There can only be one hub subrack in the node. The hub subrack is used to control switching and synchronization for the complete node.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: This attribute describes the product type and is always set to the value "HW".

attribute.name: administrativeProductData
attribute.description:
Specifies the product information for the backplane of the subrack. The production date is not used.
Setting of this attribute will not have any effect.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by attribute productData in MO SubrackProdType. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.

attribute.name: subrackPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies the subrack position within a cabinet.
The purpose of this attribute is to help in troubleshooting as its value is included in the alarm information.
The subrack position is also included in the product inventory.
The subrack position consists of: - a mandatory integer (1-n) stating the cabinet ID, starting from the left, - a mandatory letter (A-Z) stating the Subrack vertical position, starting from the ground, and - an optional integer (1-n) stating the Subrack horizontal position, starting from the left.
Example: 1B2, 5C

attribute.name: cabinetPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies the position of the cabinet, within a group of other cabinets, in which this subrack is placed.
The purpose of this attribute is to help in troubleshooting as its value is included in the alarm information.

attribute.name: numberOfSlots
attribute.description:
Specifies the actual number of slots configured on the node.
This attribute is set to the value of defNumberOfSlots in MO SubrackProdType at create of the subrack.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: The operational product data describes the backplane of the subrack that is actually installed.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: subrackProdTypeRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of SubrackProdType MO.
This attribute must be specified if administrativeProductData is not used.
If it is not specified, detection of a SubrackProdType MO with the exact matching product data is done, and if successful, attribute subrackProdTypeRef is set. If a SubrackProdType is not found, then the creation of the Subrack is rejected.
If both attributes administrativeProductData and subrackProdTypeRef are specified, this administrativeProductData is replaced by the product data for the SubrackProdType MO.

attribute.name: subrackNumber
attribute.description:
The number of the subrack.
If switchModule is set, any setting of this attribute will be ignored. It will instead display the value already set in the attribute switchModuleNumber, in the referred SwitchModule MO.

attribute.name: powerMeasurements
attribute.description: Indicates the power measurements of the subrack.

attribute.name: maxPowerDissipation
attribute.description: Indicates the maximum power dissipation of the subrack.

attribute.name: numberOfDenibDevices
attribute.description:
Specifies the total number of fans in the Denib-chain connected to the subrack.
This attribute is set to -1 by default, indicating that no Denib devices are used, and the attribute fanConfiguration then specifies the fan configuration for the subrack.
If fanConfiguration in MO SubrackProdType is set to NO_CPP_FAN, or BFD7422019_ONE, or EGEM2_TWO, then no external fan devices can be connected, and this attribute can only be set to -1.
If this attribute is set, it will always override the value in fanConfiguration.
If numberOfDenibDevices is to be changed, set this to 0 first to disable fan supervision. Configuration or maintenance changes can then be done to the Denib-chain of devices without generating any alarms. After HW changes, update the configuration accordingly, and then set the desired value for numberOfDenibDevices. This will then reactivate the fan supervision, and is the recommended way of working.
Otherwise, if fan supervision is activated and numberOfDenibDevices is to be changed to a value greater than 0, the cables from the SCBs must be disconnected from the fan units first. Wait about 3 min after the disconnection before setting the attribute.

action.name: removeSlots
action.description:
Removes the given number of Slot MOs from the model. The Slots with the highest slotNumber are removed. After this action no Slot will have APN = 0. The attribute numberOfSlots will be updated.
If there is a child MO the action will fail and the MOHasChildrenException is thrown.

parameter.name: numberOfSlotsToRemove
parameter.description: The number of slots to remove.

class.name: PlugInUnit
class.description:
Plug-In Unit
