This MO represents a plug-in unit, that is a board inserted in a slot in a subrack.
There are two mutually exclusively sets of LED attributes, depending on the version of the system. The sets are (greenLed, redLed, yellowLed) and (faultIndicator, operationalIndicator, maintenanceIndicator). The set not in use will display the value NOT_APPLICABLE for its attributes.

attribute.name: PlugInUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
It is set to ENABLED when the basic OS is started, all other programs on the MP/BP are loaded/started, and all hardware tests during start-up are performed.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: Describes the product type.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of PiuType.

attribute.name: piuGroupNumber
attribute.description:
Indicates which restart group the plug-in unit belongs to.
A restart group consists of a number of plug-in units, where at least one must be enabled (working) or performing recovery. When no plug-in unit in a group is working, the node is restarted automatically.
Must have a positive value.
Zero indicates no group.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmProcessorLoad
attribute.description: The average CPU load on the whole system (all the cores) during the last 5 minutes.
attribute.condition: Automatic and continuous measurement, where the CPU average for the last 5 minutes is calculated every time the value is read. The CPU load is defined as 1 - bg in percent, where bg is defined as background load.

attribute.name: allowedSeqRestarts
attribute.description:
The number of automatic sequential restarts that are allowed for a PIU. When this number of automatic restarts has been exceeded, the automatic restarting halts and the PIU is fault-marked.
The time limit between two restarts is 5 minutes. This means that if the time between two restarts is less than 5 minutes, the restarts are counted, otherwise the restart counter is reset.
For example, RESTARTS_WITH_WARM means 3 restarts with time limit less than 5 minutes are accepted but when the 4th occurs within 5 minutes, the board is considered faulty and an alarm is issued. The attribute specifies the escalation staircase for automatic (spontanenous) restarts, for the board. Example: if the attribute it set to RESTARTS_WITH_COLD, the first restart will be of rank cold, the second (within five minutes) will be cold with test. The third restart (within five minutes) will fault-mark the board.
If no value is specified when the MO is created, a default value, fetched from defAllowedSeqRestarts in the referenced MO, PiuType, is used.

attribute.name: hwTestResult
attribute.description: Contains text information from latest performed hardware tests.

attribute.name: hwTestStatus
attribute.description: Indicates the status of hardware tests.

attribute.name: greenLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the operational status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE = The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not readable at the moment STEADY_LIGHT = Power present SLOW_BLINK = Missing resource FAST_BLINK = Load or test in progress FLICKERING = Busy

attribute.name: redLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the fault status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE =The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = No fault STEADY_LIGHT = PIU fault

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the information status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE =The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = PIU unlocked STEADY_LIGHT = PIU locked SLOW_BLINK = Shutting-down in progress FLICKERING = Busy

attribute.name: unitType
attribute.description: Displays the same value as the attribute productName from the struct AdminProductData in MO PiuType.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: faultIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Fault indicator.

attribute.name: operationalIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Operational indicator.

attribute.name: statusIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Status indicator.

attribute.name: pmProcessorCoreLoad
attribute.description: The average CPU load on each processor core during the whole ROP period.
attribute.condition: Automatic and continuous measurement, where the CPU average for the whole ROP period is calculated every time the value is read. The CPU load is defined as 1 - bg in percent, where bg is defined as background load.

attribute.name: pmSwitchIngressDiscards
attribute.description:
Total number of cells discarded due to overload in the ingress direction.
This counter is not supported on all boards, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.condition: Incremented when discards detected.

attribute.name: pmSwitchIngressLoad
attribute.description:
Average ingress load on the board.
Maximum load depends on the hardware version (DBM). This counter is not supported on all boards, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.condition: Counts average load comparing ingress cells with the maximum value.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the plug-in-unit.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added.

action.disturbances: manualRestart causes loss of traffic!

action.name: writeRepairDelivNote
action.description: Writes HW log entry. Only one HW log entry is allowed for each HW unit. The existing entries in the HW log are not updated.

parameter.name: preparedBy
parameter.description: Name of operator preparing the log entry.

parameter.name: countryCode
parameter.description: Two letter country code.

parameter.name: stateCode
parameter.description: The HW status when the failure occurred: R = repaired unit failed during installation or test S = unit in service failure occurred T = new unit failed during installation or test

parameter.name: descriptionOfFault
parameter.description: Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described as well. For product safety reasons also specify fire, water damage, and so on.

parameter.name: trNumber
parameter.description: If the board has a connection with a trouble report, the trNumber must be supplied.

parameter.name: reference
parameter.description: Complaint reference.

action.name: readRepairDelivNote
action.description: Reads the content of the HW log entry, written with the action writeRepairDelivNote.

action.name: reconfigureProgramPrepare
action.description: Reconfigures Program MOs specified by the Repertoire Mos and PiuType MOs associated to this PlugInUnit MO. For the Program MOs that are not used anymore, the attribute startState is set to DISABLED.

action.name: removeDisabledPrograms
action.description: Removes disabled programs located under the PlugInUnit.

class.name: GeneralProcessorUnit
class.description:
General purpose Processor Unit (GPU)
The GeneralProcessorUnit MO represents the board specific hardware on the GPB, CBU, DUW or DUL, that is, hard disk, Ethernet, serial port and so on.
This unit may only be inserted in slot 1 - 27 (in a standard subrack).
The attribute availabilityStatus for the GeneralProcessorUnit MO is retreived from the PlugInUnit MO.

attribute.name: GeneralProcessorUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
The value for operationalState is retrived from the parent of this MO, that is PlugInUnit MO.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDSize
attribute.description: The total size of the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDFreespace
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePSize
attribute.description: The total size of the P volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePFreespace
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the P volume.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: minimumHdVolumeDFreespace
attribute.description:
Minimum number of Megabytes of free space on D volume before an alarm is issued. 0 means that no alarm will be sent.
It is used as a threshold that triggers alarms when the D volume of any board is about to be full, that is, when the attribute hdVolumeDFreespace exceeds this value.
This value should be set large enough so that an alarm is raised for each D volume that is starting to have too little space for the new files of the next upgrade package. On the core MPs, that is the Fault tolerant Core (FTC) GPB boards, this value should be even larger, so that there is also room for the configuration version files (in addition to the next upgrade files).
This value should be small enough for each board, so that alarms are not sent unnecessarily when there is a lot of free space.
Alarm is raised if the value of hdVolumeDFreespace becomes less than or equal to this value. But in order to cease the alarm, the free space must become at least 1 Megabyte larger than this value. To free space on the D volumes, some old UpgradePackage MOs must be deleted. If only the FTC boards are affected, then some old configuration versions must be deleted. This is done through the ConfigurationVersion MO.

class.name: Jvm
class.description:
Java Virtual Machine (JVM)
This MO configures JVM parameters, including SW management of Java class libraries used in the machine.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Jvm=1.

attribute.name: JvmId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: The current classpath that the JVM is using.

attribute.name: admClasspath
attribute.description: New classpath that is activated at next restart of JVM. The classpath has a directory, which contains the load module, that is the classpath references the load module.

attribute.name: freeMemory
attribute.description:
The free memory in the java machine.
Before this value is read from the system, the action garbageCollect is invoked.

attribute.name: totalMemory
attribute.description: The total amount of memory allocated to the java machine.

attribute.name: mopplets
attribute.description:
Contains all classes that are to be initialized and started when the JVM restarts.
Technical note: The specified classes must implement the se.ericsson.cello.moframework.Mopplet interface and be found in a jar/zip-file pointed out by the classpath.

attribute.name: main
attribute.description:
Specifies the start class name.
For example: "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms".

attribute.name: options
attribute.description: Current options: -D<property>=<value> Set a system property value. Commonly java.class.path -Xms<size> Specify the size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. -Xss<size> Set thread stack size in bytes. -Xverify:[all | remote | none] Verify classes according to the suboption. -Xverify:all verifies all classes. -Xverify:remote verifies remote classes only. -Xverify:none turns off class verification.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: Specifies the current system properties.

attribute.name: reliableProgramUniter
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the ReliableProgramUniter MO that refers to the programs where the JVM executes.

attribute.name: admMain
attribute.description:
New start class that is activated at next restart of the JVM.
For example: "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms".

attribute.name: admOptions
attribute.description:
This attribute is used when setting one or more administrative options.
A set option is operational after the next Java Machine restart.
One or more options can be set, one option in each string of the sequence according to description in the attribute option.

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description:
Contains the SwAllocation instance that reserves this MO instance.
Restriction: This MO instance can be reserved by only one instance of SwAllocation.

action.name: garbageCollect
action.description: Runs the garbage collector.

action.name: setProperty
action.description:
Sets a system property, that is properties in the operating system.
The values set with this action are not saved in the database.

action.name: restart
action.description: Restarts the executing JVM instance.

class.name: MediumAccessUnit
class.description:
Medium Access Unit (MAU)
The MediumAccessUnit MO represents the Ethernet transceiver function on a General Processor Board (GPB) or a CBU board.
It is not possible to configure both the MediumAccessUnit MO and the FastEthernet MO under the same GeneralProcessorUnit MO. These MOs are mutually exclusive.
Ethernet links which are modelled by a MediumAccessUnit MO are used for O&M IP traffic only. MediumAccessUnit MOs must not be configured under a GeneralProcessorUnit MO which has an IpAccessHostGpb MO referring to it, and where the IpAccessHostGpb MO refers to a FastEthernet MO.
This MO is known in standards as "MediumAttachmentUnit".
When this MO has been created, a node restart is required. Create and set a new CV and restart the node.
The MediumAccessUnit is not possible to be deleted if it is the last instance.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of O&M connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: MediumAccessUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: connectorLabel
attribute.description: This attribute is used by a management system to show the label on the port the connector is attached to.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsLateCollisions
attribute.description: The number of times that a collision was detected on the interface after the minimum length of a frame.
attribute.condition: A frame collision occurs.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsFCSErrors
attribute.description: The number of frames that did not pass the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) check. (When the packet is received, its value is compared with the FCS and if the package is damaged it is removed).
attribute.condition: A frame did not pass the FCS check.

attribute.name: linkSpeed
attribute.description: The Link Speed.

attribute.name: duplexMode
attribute.description: The duplex mode used.

attribute.name: operationalMode
attribute.description: The operational mode.

class.name: PiuDevice
class.description:
Plug-In Unit (PIU) Device
This MO represents a part of a plug-in unit, that is a separate restart domain.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.
Possible values when operationalState is set to DISABLED: - FAILED - DEPENDENCY_LOCKED - DEPENDENCY_FAILED

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: PiuDeviceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: deviceId
attribute.description: The local identity of the device within the PIU.
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute loaderType in LoadModule MO is set to OSE_LOADER, the value of deviceId is the same as for the attributes instanceId and restartGroup from Program MO, struct ProgramInstance.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the PIU device.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart. This parameter is mandatory.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added. This parameter is optional.

action.disturbances: manualRestart causes loss of traffic!

class.name: InterPiuLink
class.description:
Inter PIU Link
This MO represents a cable between two plug-in units.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: InterPiuLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: primaryPiuSlot
attribute.description: The slot where the primary PIU is placed.

attribute.name: secondaryPiuSlot
attribute.description: The slot where the secondary PIU is placed.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

class.name: Shelf
class.description: This MO represents a shelf.

attribute.name: ShelfId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: boardOrientation
attribute.description: Specifies the orientation of the hardware units in the shelf.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Specifies the content of the shelf.

attribute.name: noOfPositions
attribute.description: Specifies the number of physical positions in the shelf.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description:
Specifies the physical position of the shelf within the cabinet.
The position is given as a combination of vertical position, given in letters, and horizontal position, given in digits. Vertical positioning starts from the ground and horizontal positioning starts from the left.
Example: B1

attribute.name: positionRef
attribute.description: Reference to the cabinet, in which the shelf is placed.

class.name: AppUnit
class.description:
Active Patch Panel
The AppUnit MO represents one of the two APP units.
The APP unit is an optical-electrical unit which converts the node-external optical transmission to node-internal electrical transmission. The APP units are supervised by the closest subrack in the cabinet.

attribute.name: AppUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: connectedToScx
attribute.description: The AppUnit is controlled through an SCX board. This attribute specifies the Slot MO representing that SCX board.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: The operational product data describes the AppUnit that is actually installed.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

class.name: PfmUnit
class.description:
Power and Fan Module Unit
The PfmUnit MO represents one of the two PFM units in a subrack. The PFM unit is a combined power supply and cooling unit that is used in the EGEM2 hardware series, such as the RNC 8000.
This MO is system created when SubrackProdType MO with attribute transmissionType is set to ETHERNET_1G_10G.

attribute.name: PfmUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: activeSwAllocation
attribute.description:
The SwAllocation instance, among the predefined instances, which is active.
The SwAllocation instance which is active is the one currently used by the PfmUnit MO. If no matching SwAllocation containing the specific PiuType is found, the value of this attribute is null.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: connectedToScx
attribute.description: The PfmUnit is controlled through an SCX board. This attribute specifies the Slot MO representing that SCX board.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: Describes the product data of the PFM unit that is installed.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of PiuType.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Indicates the position of the PfmUnit on the subrack. Allowed values: - Upper - Lower

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status.

class.name: IpRoutingTable
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) Routing Table
This MO represents the IP routing table for the node.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Ip MO, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is IpRoutingTable=1.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of IP connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: IpRoutingTableId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: indexOfDeletableStaticRoutes
attribute.description:
This attribute gives the indices for the static routes that can be deleted.
The indices are the same as those that are listed with the action listRoutes.

attribute.name: staticRoutes
attribute.description:
List of static routes.
When this attribute is set, all the static routes in the node configuration are either added, removed, modified or unchanged.
The actions, addStaticRoute and deleteStaticRoute, can be used to add or remove one single static route.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect OAM traffic.

action.name: addStaticRoute
action.description: Adds a new static route to the routing table.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description:
The destination IP address.
This IP address shall be the subnetwork address or host address corresponding to the subnetMask parameter. Otherwise it will automatically be corrected by calculating the bitwise AND of ipAddress and subnetMask.
Examples: ipAddress subnetMask => ipAddress corrected to 134.138.14.1 255.255.255.0 => 134.138.14.0 2001::1 64 => 2001:: 134.138.14.1 255.255.255.255 => 134.138.14.1 134.138.14.1 0.0.0.0 => 0.0.0.0

parameter.name: subnetMask
parameter.description:
The destination IP network mask or the network prefix length.
For IPv4, this attribute can be specified in dot-decimal format (network mask) or as a digit (network prefix length), range 0..32. The output format for IPv4 routes, in the action listRoutes, is always in dot-decimal format.
For IPv6, this attribute must be specified as a digit, range 0..128.
Examples: 255.255.255.0 64

parameter.name: hopIpAddress
parameter.description:
The next hop IP address.
If an attempt is made to add a static route with hopIpAddress starting with 0 or :: an exception is thrown.

parameter.name: routeMetric
parameter.description: The route metric.

parameter.name: redistribute
parameter.description: Specifies if the route shall be distributed via OSPF. This is only valid for IPv4 routes, set to false for IPv6 routes.

action.disturbances: Using this operation on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

action.name: listRoutes
action.description:
Lists all static routes and some selected dynamic routes. It requires no input parameters.
The output is a formatted string, indicating the number of routes in the table followed by route information for each of these routes.
The routes are listed in an indexed order with the top row being index 0, the second row index 1, and so on. These indicies may be used in the action getRoutingTableEntry and are also the ones referred to in the attribute indexOfDeletableStaticRoutes. They are not the same as those in staticRoutes.indexOfStaticRoute.
The number of routes in the table is found at the very start of the returned string. Immediately following this is the information on each route in the list in turn. The route information for each route begins with a new line character (\n) and is followed by the following data items (in the order written below), which are separated from each other by a SPACE character:
- Destination IP address - Destination network mask for IPv4 routes or network prefix length for IPv6 routes - Next hop IP address or "onlink" for connected networks (interface routes) - Route metric - Route type - Interface name - Redistribute - Active
Below is an example list of routes that could be returned from this action: 6 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 134.138.14.1 10 2 le0 FALSE active 10.1.1.0 255.255.255.0 134.138.12.50 11 2 le0 FALSE active 134.138.14.0 255.255.255.0 onlink 1 2 le0 FALSE active 127.0.0.1 255.255.255.255 onlink 1 2 lo0 FALSE active 10.2.2.0 255.255.255.0 192.168.0.1 10 2 ~ FALSE inactive :: 0 2001:abcd:1234:5678::1 10 2 ipif1 FALSE active
In this case, there is one IPV4 default route, one active static route, two interface routes for le0 and lo0, one inactive static route and one IPV6 default route.
Note that the route types can be of the following types:
INET_RTPROTO_OTHER 1 INET_RTPROTO_LOCAL 2 INET_RTPROTO_NETMGMT 3 INET_RTPROTO_ICMP 4 INET_RTPROTO_OSPF 13
The types listed above also denote the origin of the routing entry.

action.name: getRoutingTableEntry
action.description:
Returns a RoutingTableEntry according to the specified index.
To be used with action, numberOfRoutes, within a transaction. To refresh the routing table stored in the MO, invoke the action numberOfRoutes.

action.name: numberOfRoutes
action.description:
Returns the number of entries in the routing table.
Each time this action is invoked, the MO retrieves routing table information from the resource layer and then builds a new array of RoutingTable structs to store this information.
The position or index of each route, in this array, is used to identify the route in getRoutingTableEntry() and in the indexOfStaticRoute in struct StaticRoute, which is a unique identifier for a static route. The unique identifier remains the same until explicitly changed, whereas its position in the array, built by this action, may change as routes are added or removed. The array contains both static and dynamic routes.
If this action is used together with getRoutingTableEntry(), which allows one to iterate through the array stored in the MO, the actions need transaction handling and they should be handled within the same transaction.

action.name: deleteStaticRoute
action.description:
Removes the RoutingTableEntry submitted as a parameter from the Routing Table, if it is found in the table.
Only static routes, previously added, can be deleted with this action.
action.disturbances: Using this operation on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

action.name: modifyStaticRoute
action.description:
Modifies a static route in the routing table. All properties of a static route can be changed with this action.
All properties in oldRoute and newRoute must be specified.

parameter.name: oldRoute
parameter.description: Describes the properties of an existing route.

parameter.name: newRoute
parameter.description: Describes the properties wanted, after this action has been executed.

action.disturbances: Using this operation on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

class.name: Ip
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP)
This MO represents the IP protocol layer with IP forwarding functionality.
The PM counters in the Ip MO have a wrap-around time of approximately 2 hours.
The PM counters on the IP MO do not increment for IPv6 traffic. The counters reflect the aggregated OAM IPv4.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: dnsServerAddresses
attribute.description:
A list of IP addresses to Domain Name Servers.
IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: 192.168.33.27 2001:db8:0::1
A maximum of 3 DNS server addresses is supported.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: IpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: workingMode
attribute.description: Specifies if the IP stack in the node works as a combined host/router (ROUTER_MODE) or only as a host (HOST_MODE).
attribute.dependencies: If the IpHostLink MO is used, do not set this attribute to ROUTER_MODE, since routing on incoming OAM traffic is not supported on this link type.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM routing functionality.

attribute.name: retransInterval
attribute.description: The retransmission interval.

attribute.name: noOfRetrans
attribute.description: The number of retransmissions.

attribute.name: isRecursiveSearch
attribute.description:
Specifies how the DNS client wants the DNS server do the search for the IP address in the network .
true - recursive search false - non-recursive search

attribute.name: isSubDomainName
attribute.description:
Specifies whether to use subsets of the fully qualified domain name to reach the simple domain name.
true - use subsets of domain name false - do not use subsets of domain name

attribute.name: isDefDomainName
attribute.description:
Specifies whether the default domain name is present.
true - present false - not present

attribute.name: defDomainName
attribute.description:
Contains default domain name. If isDefDomainName is set to true, the domain name found in this attribute is used by the DNS resolver and there is no need to submit the complete domain name. If the domain name is for example 'ws5741.uab.ericsson.se', then the default domain name would be '.uab.ericsson.se'. If isDefDomainName is set to true, there is no need for using '.uab.ericsson.se'. If set to false, then the complete domain name has to be used.
A valid domain name consists of one or more labels separated by dots ("."). Valid characters for a label shall be limited to letters 'a' - 'z', 'A' - 'Z', digits '0' - '9', the character '-' ("dash"). Character case shall be preserved. Total length of a label shall not exceed 255 characters.
The first and last character in the domain name has to be within the following alphabet: letters 'a' - 'z', 'A' - 'Z' and digits '0' - '9'.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute is set to ENABLED if at least one link is operational.

attribute.name: numberOfLinks
attribute.description: Indicates the number of links which are configured for the Ip MO. The links are the MOs: EthernetLink, IpAtmLink, IpHostLink and IpAccessHostEt.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an Ospf MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: useHostFile
attribute.description:
Specifies if the host file is used. The hostFile is used by the resolver and chosen as a source of information before querying a DNS server.
true - use the host file false - do not use the host file
This is an example of the host file: 127.0.0.1 localhost 192.102.73.6 somehost 2001:db8::1 somehost
The file name is hosts and the path is /c/configuration.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity depending on the contents of the hosts file.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description:
The DiffServ CodePoint.
The code point values are used by DiffServ enabled hosts and router to identify different service levels. When set, the DSCPs are mapped to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) by forwarding devices along the path between the source and destination. PHBs dictates how each packet is handled, that is, what type of service that is applied to the packet when it is forwarded.
Only traffic originated from the node is tagged with the dscp value. The CPP based router does not implement functionality for handling different service levels when routing IP traffic.

attribute.name: icmpRedirect
attribute.description: Indicates if ICMP redirects is sent out or not.

attribute.name: udpChecksumState
attribute.description:
Enables or disables generation of UDP checksum. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled
The UDP checksum is used to verify that the UDP header has not been damaged during transmission.

attribute.name: connectionAttemptTimer
attribute.description: The time that elapses before a connection (TCP) attempt times out.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behaviour. It has become redundant and will be silently ignored. The default value is always used.

attribute.name: maxRetransmissionAttempts
attribute.description: The maximum number of retransmission attempts before a TCP connection is dropped. The default value is 12 attempts, which is around 15 minutes.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behaviour. It has become redundant and will be silently ignored. The default value is always used.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpInReceives
attribute.description: Total number of datagrams received.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to format error.
attribute.condition: An datagram with errors in its IP header is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to error in the address.
attribute.condition: A datagram with faulty destination address is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpForwDatagrams
attribute.description: The number of datagrams forwarded.
attribute.condition: A datagram is forwarded.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to resource limitations.
attribute.condition: A lot of datagrams that are needed to be fragmented and forwarded are received at a high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to lack of resources.
attribute.condition: A lot of datagrams that are needed to be forwarded are received at a high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpReasmReqds
attribute.description: The number of fragments received that need reassembly.
attribute.condition: The fragmented datagrams that are addressed to the node are received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpReasmOKs
attribute.description: The number of datagrams successfully reassembled.
attribute.condition: A successful fragment reassembly occurred.

attribute.name: nodeInterfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name of the link object that determines the OAM IPv4 address for the node. This attribute cannot be set to an empty string.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute is set to the value of the attribute interfaceName in the EthernetLink MO, or in the IpHostLink MO. The referenced link MO must exist, and specify the wanted nodeIpv4Address as the first element of the ipv4addresses attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: nodeIpAddress
attribute.description: The OAM IPv4 address for the node.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description:
Specifies an IpAccessHostEt MO to be used as an alternative OAM access.
The purpose of the alternative OAM access is to have a limited access to the node through the outer IP host, if IPsec protection is used for the OAM traffic and the contact through IPsec is lost. If IPsec protection is used for OAM traffic the IpHostLink MO for the node access is connected to a VpnInterface MO. The alternative OAM access can be used for SSH communication (TCP port 22). The alternative OAM access is handled as any other type of link. That is, it is included in the attribute numberOfLinks, and in the operationalState and the availabilityStatus. The alternative OAM access is also visible as a route in the IpRoutingTable MO.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute might endanger OAM connectivity robustness if an IpHostLink MO connected to a VpnInterface MO is used.

attribute.name: nodeIpv6InterfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name of the link object that determines the OAM IPv6 address for the node. The OAM IPv6 address for the node is removed if this attribute is set to an empty string.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute is set to the value of the attribute interfaceName in the IpHostLink MO. The referenced link MO must exist, and specify the wanted nodeIpv6Address as the first element of the ipv6addresses attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: nodeIpv6Address
attribute.description: The OAM IPv6 address for the node.

action.name: enableLink
action.description:
Enables the link referred to by the parameter.
For use by Ericsson staff only.

parameter.name: interfaceName
parameter.description: The interface name of the link.

action.name: disableLink
action.description:
Disables the link referred to by the parameter.
For use by Ericsson staff only.

parameter.name: interfaceName
parameter.description: The interface name of the link.

class.name: EthernetLink
class.description:
Ethernet Link
This MO represents the Internet Protocol over Ethernet link. There is a maximum of just one EthernetLink MO on the node.
Up to 5 unique IPv4 addresses can be assigned to this MO. The addresses are stored in a list in the attribute ipv4Addresses. The first entry of the address list is a candidate to be used as a node OAM IP address, which is configured in the Ip MO.
The EthernetLink MO cannot be deleted, if its first IP address is used as a node OAM IP address. Refer to the attribute nodeInterfaceName in the Ip MO for details.
The PM counters in the EthernetLink MO have a wrap-around time of approximately two hours.
Disturbances: Changing attributes of this MO can cause interruption of the OAM communication if the network management tool is connected via the Ethernet link. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: EthernetLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute can be used as a reference, by the attributes nodeInterfaceName and nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the first IPv4 address of the Ethernet link. This attribute together with the attributes broadcastAddress and subnetMask is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The address must not be a broadcast or multicast address.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute must not be identical to the value of the attribute ipAddress in the IpHostLink MO.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: subnetMask
attribute.description:
States the subnet mask for the first IPv4 address of the Ethernet link.
This attribute together with the attributes ipAddress and broadcastAddress, is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
This attribute and the attribute ipv4Addresses must not be set in the same transaction.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The subnet mask must be contiguous.
Example: 255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet masks: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: broadcastAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the first IPv4 broadcast address for the Ethernet link.
This attribute, together with the attributes ipAddress and subnetMask, is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
This attribute and the attribute ipv4Addresses must not be set in the same transaction.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: mtuSize
attribute.description: Maximum transmission Unit for the Ethernet link.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: metric
attribute.description:
Specifies the metric of the Ethernet link. The metric value is calculated as 10^8 divided by the link bit speed.
For example: Metric for 10 Mbps Ethernet = 10^8/10^7 = 10 Metric for 100 Mbps or faster Ethernet = 10^8/10^8 = 1
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute is dependent of the operational states of the underlying MAUs that represent the Ethernet transceiver function. If there is at least one operational MAU, the operationalState of EthernetLink is set to ENABLED.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description: The MAC address is persistently stored in the flash PROM on the MP where the IP stack resides. It is stored there when the board is manufactured.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to any error.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An erroneous IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets received at high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of transmitted outgoing broadcast or multicast packets.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of outbound packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets sent at high rate.

attribute.name: activeMau
attribute.description: Reference to the active Medium Access Unit (MAU).

attribute.name: availableMaus
attribute.description: Contains a list of references to all available Medium Access Units (MAUs).

attribute.name: ipv4Addresses
attribute.description: Specifies a list of all IPv4 addresses for the EthernetLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address. The first entry of this list is also represented by the IPv4 address attributes: broadcastAddress, ipAddress and subnetMask. The ipAddress in the first element of this attribute cannot be set to 0.0.0.0 or an empty string.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: ipv6Addresses
attribute.description:
Specifies a list of all IPv6 addresses for the EthernetLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address.
IPv6 addresses can be used for test purposes only.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInOctets
attribute.description:
The total number of received IP octets, including those with errors.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInReceives
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams, including those with errors.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutOctets
attribute.description:
The total number of transmitted IP octets.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutTransmits
attribute.description:
The total number of transmitted IP datagrams.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInHdrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInAddrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of recived IP datagrams discarded, because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInUnknownProtos
attribute.description:
The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmReqds
attribute.description:
The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these fragments were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the fragments.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmFails
attribute.description:
The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc.).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams that should be sent, but were discarded due to resource problems (for example, lack of buffer space).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram, which should be sent, is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutFragCreates
attribute.description:
The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

action.name: assignAllIpAddresses
action.description:
Sets the attributes: ipAddress, subnetMask and broadcastAddress.
If broadcastAddress is set to the string CURRENT_VALUE, the old value remains.
If the IP address of the EthernetLink MO is an OAM IP address for the node, and if the IP address is changed, there is a risk that some sessions are closed.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

parameter.name: subnetMask
parameter.description:
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The subnet mask must be contiguous.
Example: 255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet masks: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

parameter.name: broadcastAddress
parameter.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

action.disturbances: Changing the IP address with this action, can cause an interruption of the communication between the node and the network management tool, if the network management tool is connected using the EthernetLink MO. If an incorrect or erroneous IP address is configured, the communication with the node can be lost until the node is restarted or until the IP address is changed to the correct value.

class.name: IpOam
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) for Operation and Maintenance (OAM)
This MO constitutes the top structure level for MOs in IP for OAM.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is IpOam=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: IpOamId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

action.name: ping
action.description:
Calls a host or router to find out if it is present in the network.
The following parameter is returned: Ping result: The IP address or domain name - is alive or no answer.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The domain name or IP address to the host that is called.

action.name: traceRoute
action.description:
Gets information about the route through the IP network that is used for a destination with a specific IP address.
The following input parameter is used by this action: The domain name or IP address to a host that is trace-routed.
The following parameter is returned: Trace result - list of IP addresses/domain names or path not found.

class.name: Dhcp
class.description:
Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol
This MO represents a DHCP client and a DHCP Relay Agent.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Dhcp =1.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: DhcpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: dhcpServerAddresses
attribute.description:
IP addresses to the DHCP server, used by the DHCP Relay Agent.
Default is an empty array.
Adding and removing addresses are done using the actions, addDhcpServerAddress() and removeDhcpServerAddress().

action.name: addDhcpServerAddress
action.description: Takes an array of IP addresses and adds them to the list contained in the DHCP Relay Agent.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot, for example 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

action.name: removeDhcpServerAddress
action.description: Takes an array of IP addresses and removes them from the list contained in the DHCP Relay Agent.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot, for example 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

action.disturbances: Using this operation on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

class.name: IpHostLink
class.description:
IP Host Link
This MO, together with the IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO and related MOs, enables OAM node access via a Gigabit Ethernet interface.
A maximum of 5 unique IP addresses can be assigned to this MO. The addresses are stored in lists, in the attributes ipv4Addresses and ipv6Addresses. An instance of IpHostLink can be configured with either IPv4 or IPv6 addresses. IPv4 addresses can be used when this MO refers to IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO. IPv6 addresses can be used when this MO refers to Ipv6Interface MO.
The first entry of each address list is a candidate to be used as OAM IP address for the node. See the Ip MO for information on how to configure an OAM IP address for the node. The first entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses is also supported in the deprecated attribute ipAddress.
The IP Host Link MO cannot be deleted, if one of its IP addresses is used as a node OAM IP address. Refer to the attributes nodeInterfaceName and nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO for details.
Disturbances: Changing attributes of this MO can cause interruption of the OAM communication, if the network management tool is connected via the IP host link. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute can be used as a reference, by the attributes nodeInterfaceName or nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The IPv4 address of the IP host link.
The IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
The IP address must belong to the subnet defined in the referenced IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute must not be identical to the value of the attribute ipAddress in the MO EthernetLink.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: IpHostLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ipInterfaceMoRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO.
Only one IpHostLink is allowed to refer to the same IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to any error.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An erroneous IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets received at high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of transmitted outgoing broadcast or multicast packets.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of outbound packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets sent at high rate causes buffer overflow.

attribute.name: ipv4Addresses
attribute.description:
Specifies a list of all IPv4 addresses for the IpHostLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM IP address for the node. See the Ip MO for configuration of OAM IP address for the node.
The first entry of this list is also represented by the IPv4 address attribute: ipAddress.
The IP addresses must belong to the subnet defined in the referenced IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can only be set if this MO refers to IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO. The first element of this attribute cannot be set to 0.0.0.0 or an empty string, if this specific IpHostLink is referenced by the attribute nodeInterfaceName in Ip MO.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: ipv6Addresses
attribute.description: Specifies a list of all IPv6 addresses for the IpHostLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See the Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can only be set if this MO refers to Ipv6Interface MO.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

action.name: assignIpAddress
action.description:
Use this action if this MO refers to an IpInterface MO. Sets the first address in the attribute ipv4Addresses of this MO, and affects the referenced IpInterface MO. See the description of the parameters.
This action is not supported if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO or an IPv6Interface MO.
If the IP address of this IpHostLink MO is the OAM IP address for the node, there is a risk that some sessions are closed when the IP address is changed.
This action overrides the restriction regarding changing the attribute networkPrefixLength in the IpInterface MO. This means that the subnet address can be changed by this action, as networkPrefixLength and defaultRouter0 can be changed simultaneously. All given IP addresses must belong to the same subnet.
If the subnet address (networkPrefixLength and defaultRouter0) must be changed, any other IP host that is configured on this IpInterface MO must first be deleted. This means that the reservedBy attribute for the IpInterface MO can contain only a single reference to the IpHostLink MO.
The IP address can temporarily be set to 0.0.0.0, to enable autoconfiguration of the node, using DHCP. The value 0.0.0.0 can only be set for one IpHostLink MO at a time. See also IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The value assigned to ipAddress in this MO. The IP address must be an IPv4 address, and it must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.

parameter.name: networkPrefixLength
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute networkPrefixLength in the related IpInterface MO. Unit: 1 bit

parameter.name: defaultRouter0
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter0 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: defaultRouter1
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter1 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: defaultRouter2
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter2 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: ownIpAddressActive
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute ownIpAddressActive in the related IpInterface MO.

action.disturbances: The changing of the IP address with the operation assignIpAddress, may cause an interruption of the communication between the node and the network management tool. If an incorrect or erroneous IP address is configured, the communication with the node might be lost until the node is restarted or the IP address is changed to the correct value.

action.name: assignIpAddress2
action.description:
Use this action if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO. Sets the first address in the attribute ipv4Addresses of this MO, and affects the referenced VpnInterface MO. See the description of the parameters.
This action is not supported if this MO refers to an IpInterface MO or an Ipv6Interface MO.
If the IP address of this IpHostLink MO is the OAM IP address for the node, there is a risk that some sessions are closed when the IP address is changed.
This action overrides the restriction regarding changing the attribute networkPrefixLength and subnet in the VpnInterface MO.
The subnet address for the VpnInterface MO is calculated from the ipAddress and networkPrefixLength assigned in this action.
The IP address must not be set to 0.0.0.0, if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The value assigned to ipAddress in this MO. The IP address must be an IPv4 address, and it must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.

parameter.name: networkPrefixLength
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute networkPrefixLength in the related VpnInterface MO. Unit: 1 bit

action.disturbances: The changing of the IP address with the operation assignIpAddress2, may cause an interruption of the communication between the node and the network management tool. If an incorrect or erroneous IP address is configured, the communication with the node might be lost until the node is restarted or the IP address is changed to the correct value.

class.name: IpSec
class.description: This MO is the top level MO for IPsec. It contains attributes, which are common for all parts of IPsec in the node.

attribute.name: IpSecId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: trustedCertInstallErrorMsg
attribute.description:
Trusted certificate installation error message.
If the trusted certificate installation enters the ERROR state, this message indicates the cause of the error. If the trusted certificate installation does not enter the ERROR state, this message is empty.
The reason for failure is one of the following: - a downloaded certificate is corrupted - a downloaded certificate does not match the information provided in the structure, IpSecCertInfo.
Possible values: "Certificate validation failed" "Internal error" "Connection to remoteHost failed" "Error retrieving certificate from remoteHost"

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: certEnrollErrorMsg
attribute.description:
Certificate enrollment error message.
If the enrollment enters the error state, this message indicates the cause of the error.
If the enrollment does not enter the error state, this message is empty.
Possible values: "Certificate validation failed"

attribute.name: certEnrollState
attribute.description:
Certificate enrollment state.
Indicates the current state of the certificate enrollment process started by the action initCertEnrollment.

attribute.name: certExpirWarnTime
attribute.description:
Certificate expiry warning time.
Specifies how far in advance an alarm is issued, when the node certificate is about to expire.

attribute.name: installedTrustedCertificates
attribute.description:
Contains information about the installed trusted certificates.
If the list is empty, then there is no trusted certificate on the node.

attribute.name: certificate
attribute.description:
Information about the installed certificate for IPsec in the node.
If the serial number of certificate is empty, then there is no certificate installed on the node.

attribute.name: trustedCertInstallState
attribute.description: Indicates the state of the installation process for the trusted certificates, started by the action installTrustedCertificates.

attribute.name: featureState
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the feature IPsec is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED.
The actual IpSec service is not enabled until the feature state is ACTIVATED and there is a valid IpSec license in the node.

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed state of the feature IPsec is ENABLED or DISABLED, that is, whether a valid IpSec license is installed or not.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

action.name: initCertEnrollment
action.description:
Initiate a certificate enrollment, that is, create a certificate and have it signed by a CA.
This action can be invoked when no enrollment is ongoing or has failed.
The certificate is automatically taken into service when the enrollment is completed.

parameter.name: enrollmentData
parameter.description: Contains the information needed to request a certificate

action.name: cancelCertEnrollment
action.description:
Cancels an ongoing or failed certificate enrollment process ordered by the action initCertEnrollment.
This action must be performed if a certificate enrollment has entered an error state, before a new enrollment can be ordered.
This action sets certEnrollState to IDLE.

action.name: installTrustedCertificates
action.description:
Installs a set of trusted certificates to the node. This action can be invoked when no installation is ongoing or has failed.
The operation is atomic, that is, if an error occurs for one certificate, the entire installation is aborted and no certificates are installed. If there are already installed trusted certificates and a new installation fails, the already installed trusted certificates remain.

parameter.name: certSpecList
parameter.description: Contains information about the trusted certificates to be installed. There should be at least one certSpec.

parameter.name: accountInfoList
parameter.description:
Contains information about the file servers from where the trusted certificates can be downloaded. There should be at least one accountInfo.
Either the accountInfoList can include only one IpSecAccountInfo item, or it must include the same number of IpSecAccountInfo items as the number of IpSecCertSpec items in the certSpecList.
If only one IpSecAccountInfo is included, it is used for all IpSecCertSpec items in the certSpecList. If many IpSecAccountInfo items are included, the first IpSecAccountInfo is used to together with the first IpSecCertSpec, the second IpSecAccountInfo with the second IpSecCertSpec, etc.

action.name: cancelInstallTrustedCertificates
action.description:
Cancels an ongoing or failed trusted certificate installation process ordered by the action installTrustedCertificates.
This action must be performed if the trusted certificate installation has entered an error state, before a new installation can be ordered.
This action sets trustedCertInstallState to IDLE.
If there are already successfully installed trusted certificates and this action is used to cancel the new ongoing or failed installation, the already installed trusted certificates remain.

action.name: removeTrustedCert
action.description: Removes a trusted certificate uniquely identified by its issuer and serial number.

parameter.name: serialNumber
parameter.description:
A string of decimal digits containing the unique serial number of the certificate assigned by the certificate issuer.
Restriction: The only allowed characters for this string are the digits 0 to 9.

parameter.name: issuer
parameter.description:
This is a string representation of the X.509 name of the authority that has issued the certificate. It is of the same type as the distinguished name used in the subject field of a certificate request. It is encoded as FIELDNAME=VALUE where fields are separated with a comma (,) character.
Example: C=SE, L=LI, O=Ericsson AB, OU=FJK/LO, CN=PKS 2005-08-30

class.name: IpSecTunnel
class.description:
This MO represents a tunnel for traffic that shall be protected. Multiple Child SAs may be created for each tunnel.
All IpSecTunnel MOs referring to the same IkePeer MO must refer to VpnInterface MOs that refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO.
IpSecTunnel MOs referring to two IkePeer MOs with the same value of peerIpAddress, must not refer to VpnInterface MOs that refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: IpSecTunnelId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: pmOutDiscSeqOw
attribute.description: The number of outgoing packets which are discarded due to sequence number overflow.
attribute.condition: Incremented when an outgoing packet is discarded due to a sequence number overflow.

attribute.name: tsLocalIpAddressRanges
attribute.description: The local IP address range that is part of the traffic selector which specifies the traffic allowed through the tunnel.

attribute.name: tsProtocols
attribute.description: The protocol that is part of the traffic selector which specifies the traffic allowed through the tunnel.

attribute.name: tsRemoteIpAddressRanges
attribute.description: The remote IP address range that is part of the traffic selector which specifies the traffic allowed through the tunnel.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description:
Specifies the priority of the tunnel with respect to other configured tunnel in the node.
If outgoing traffic that matches the traffic selectors in more than one tunnel, the traffic will be sent on the tunnel with the highest priority. If the tunnels have same priority, traffic will be send out on a randomly selected tunnel.
1 is the highest priority.

attribute.name: pmOutPkt
attribute.description: The number of outgoing packets for the tunnel.
attribute.condition: Incremented for each thousand of packet that is transmitted on the tunnel.

attribute.name: pmInPkt
attribute.description: The number of incoming packets for the tunnel.
attribute.condition: Incremented for each thousand of packets that is received on the tunnel.

attribute.name: pmOutEspData
attribute.description:
The number of MB of outgoing data which are processed by ESP.
The bytes belonging to the Initialization Vector (IV), which are part of the ESB payload but not encrypted, are not counted.
attribute.condition: Incremented for each MB of payload that is transmitted on the tunnel.

attribute.name: pmInEspData
attribute.description:
The number of MB of incoming data which are processed by ESP.
The bytes belonging to the Initialization Vector (IV), which are part of the ESB payload but not encrypted, are not counted.
attribute.condition: Incremented for each MB of payload that is received on the tunnel.

attribute.name: pmInDiscNoSa
attribute.description: The number of incoming packets, which are discarded due to mismatch of the traffic selectors for the Child SA through which they are received.
attribute.condition: Incremented when a packet that does not match the agreed traffic selector on an SA is received.

attribute.name: pmInDiscAReFail
attribute.description: The number of incoming packets (after reassembly) which are discarded due to failed anti-replay check.
attribute.condition: Incremented when an incoming packet has a sequence number that is outside the anti-replay window.

attribute.name: pmInDiscIntCh
attribute.description: The number of incoming packets (after reassembly) which are discarded due to failure in integrity check.
attribute.condition: Incremented when the integrity check fails on an incoming packet.

attribute.name: pmInDiscDec
attribute.description: The number of incoming packets (after reassembly) which are discarded due to failure in decryption.
attribute.condition: Incremented when decryption of a packet fails.

attribute.name: pmOutDiscNoSa
attribute.description: The number of outgoing packets which are discarded because the applicable SA is not established. During normal operation, when an applicable SA does not exist for a stream of outgoing packets, packets will be discarded until an SA has been established.
attribute.condition: Incremented if an outgoing packet is discarded due to no SA established.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: allowedTransforms
attribute.description: Specifies possible transforms that can be used for this tunnel. The selected transform depends on the Ike negotiations with the peer node. There must be at least one allowed transform.

attribute.name: securityAssociations
attribute.description: Indicates the used Child SAs.

attribute.name: ikePeerRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of IkePeer.

attribute.name: vpnInterfaceRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of VpnInterface.

attribute.name: antiReplayProtection
attribute.description: Specifies if anti-replay protection is enabled.

class.name: IkePeer
class.description: This MO represents a relationship to a neighbor node with IPsec capability and to which IKE signalling is possible. A dedicated SA protects the IKE signalling.

attribute.name: pmOutInfoReq
attribute.description: Indicates the number of sent IKE information requests.
attribute.condition: Incremented when an IKE information request message is transmitted.

attribute.name: peerIdentity
attribute.description: The identity of the IKE peer.

attribute.name: IkePeerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: logging
attribute.description: Specifies whether IPsec events are logged for the IKE peer.

attribute.name: pmInInvalidSpi
attribute.description: Indicates the number of received IP or ESP packets with SPI that does not match an existing SA.
attribute.condition: Incremented when a packet is received with an SPI that does not match an existing SA. Counted at a maximim rate of one event per second.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status.

attribute.name: allowedTransforms
attribute.description: Specifies the set of integrity and encryption algorithms that can be applied to the IKE SA toward the peer. There must be at least one allowed transform.

attribute.name: securityAssociations
attribute.description:
Contains a list of the IKE SAs that exist toward the Peer.
If there is no IKE SA, the list is empty.

attribute.name: pmChildSaRekey
attribute.description: Indicates the number of completed Child SA re-keyings.
attribute.condition: Incremented when a Child SA re-keying is completed.

attribute.name: pmInInfoReq
