attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: featureStateBestNeighborSI
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the licensed feature Best Neighbor For Redirect With SI. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the feature.

attribute.name: keyIdBestNeighborSI
attribute.description: The product ID of the key for the licensed feature Best Neighbor For Redirect With SI.

attribute.name: licenseStateBestNeighborSI
attribute.description: The license status of feature Best Neighbor For Redirect With SI, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: serviceStateBestNeighborSI
attribute.description: Indicates if the feature Best Neighbor For Redirect With SI is operable or inoperable.

attribute.name: BestNeighborSIId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: CapacityLicenses
class.description: Container for capacity license MOs for the various types of capacities.

attribute.name: CapacityLicensesId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: gracePeriodLength
attribute.description: The length of grace period i.e. the number of days that grace period is active.

attribute.name: gracePeriodResetThreshold
attribute.description: Configures how many percent the licensed value for connected users must be increased before grace period is activated again.

attribute.name: gracePeriodActivationThreshold
attribute.description: Shows how much accumulated overshoot (% over 24 hours of the current licensed capacity) is allowed before Grace Period is activated.

class.name: OptionalFeatures
class.description: Container for optional features license MOs for the various types of capacities.

attribute.name: OptionalFeaturesId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: DlBasebandCapacity
class.description: Contains information about the capacity license, Downlink baseband capacity.

attribute.name: DlBasebandCapacityId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: licenseCapacityDlBbCapacity
attribute.description: The licensed capacity limit for downlink baseband capacity. It reflects the capacity value in the license key file.

attribute.name: capacityUnitDlBbCapacity
attribute.description: Defines the unit for the licensed capacity downlink baseband capacity.

attribute.name: keyIdDlBbCapacity
attribute.description: The product identity of the key for the capacity license downlink baseband capacity.

attribute.name: dlBbCapacityHardLimit
attribute.description: Inidicates the hard limit for downlink baseband capacity in the RBS.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: licDlBbPercentileConf
attribute.description: The percentile to use for the counter pmLicDlCapActual.

attribute.name: licenseStateDlBbCapacity
attribute.description: The license status of downlink baseband capacity, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: pmLicDlCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicDlCapLicense
attribute.description:
Indicates the licensed capacity limit for downlink baseband capacity. The value reflects the capacity value in the license key file i.e. the value of the parameter licenseCapacityDlBbCapacity.
Source Attribute: licenseCapacityDlBbCapacity
attribute.condition: Is changed when a new license key file with a new value for downlink baseband capacity is installed on the RBS.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicDlCapActual
attribute.description:
The X percentile of the utilization for downlink baseband capacity during a measurement period. The value for X is set in the parameter licDlBbPercentileConf.
Source Data: licDlBbPercentileConf and pmLicDlCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.condition: Is calculated at the end of a ROP period.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicDlCapMax
attribute.description: Reports the maximum achieved throughput in the downlink direction expressed as a percentage of the DL capacity license.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.
attribute.condition: For each TTI, the following procedure is used to calculate the value of the counter: If the current throughput is higher than the value of the counter, then assign the current throughput to the counter. The counter shall be initialized to zero.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

attribute.name: pmZtemporary40
attribute.description: Normally this counter is not used, it can however sometimes be temporarily used for very late additions in a release. If so, for description see Network Impact Report in the CPI.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

class.name: CapacityConnectedUsers
class.description: Contains information about the capacity license, Number of connected users.

attribute.name: CapacityConnectedUsersId
attribute.description: Identity attribute for the MO.

attribute.name: licenseCapacityConnectedUsers
attribute.description: The licensed capacity limit for the Connected Users feature. It reflects the capacity value in the license key file.

attribute.name: capacityUnitConnectedUsers
attribute.description: Defines the unit for the Connected Users feature.

attribute.name: keyIdConnectedUsers
attribute.description: The product ID in the license key for the feature Connected Users.

attribute.name: licConnectedUsersPercentileConf
attribute.description: The attribute that specifies the percent to use for the counter pmLicConnectedUsersActual.

attribute.name: capacityConnectedHardLimit
attribute.description: The hard limit for the number of connected users for the Connected Users feature.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: licenseStateConnectedUsers
attribute.description: The license status of the Connected Users feature, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersDistr
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersLicense
attribute.description:
The licensed value for connected users. The value reflects the capacity value in the license key file i.e. the value of the parameter licenseCapacityConnectedUsers.
Source Attribute: licenseCapacityConnectedUsers
attribute.condition: Is changed when a new license key file with a new value for number of connected users is installed on the RBS.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersHardLimit
attribute.description:
Indicates the hard limit for the number of connected users i.e. the value of the parameter capacityConnectedHardLimit.
Source Attribute: capacityConnectedHardLimit
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersTimeCong
attribute.description: Accumulated time during the ROP when the number of connected users is equal to the licensed value.
attribute.condition: Is stepped each second when the number of connected users is equal to the licensed limit for number of connected users.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersActual
attribute.description:
The X percentile of the utilization for connected users during a measurement period. The value for X is set in the parameter LicConnectedUsersPercentileConf.
Source Data: licConnectedUsersPercentileConf and pmLicConnectedUsersDistr
attribute.condition: Is calculated at the end of a ROP period.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: gracePeriodActive
attribute.description: Indicates if licensing grace period is activated for the Connected Users feature.

attribute.name: gracePeriodTimeLeft
attribute.description: Remaining time for the grace period. Irrelevant if gracePeriodActive is not activated.

attribute.name: gracePeriodAvailable
attribute.description: Indicates if grace period is available for the Connected Users feature.

attribute.name: gracePeriodOriginalLicenseLimit
attribute.description: The value of the Connected Users license when grace period was activated.

attribute.name: pmZtemporary38
attribute.description: Normally this counter is not used, it can however sometimes be temporarily used for very late additions in a release. If so, for description see Network Impact Report in the CPI.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

attribute.name: pmZtemporary39
attribute.description: Normally this counter is not used, it can however sometimes be temporarily used for very late additions in a release. If so, for description see Network Impact Report in the CPI.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersMax
attribute.description: Peak number of Connected Users.
attribute.condition: This counter is based on an internal level counter maintained by eNB. The internal level counter maintains the current number of Connected Users. pmLicConnectedUsersMax is updated when the internal level counter shows a higher level.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersLevSamp
attribute.description: Number of times the corresponding Sum counter has been incremented. Associated ACC pmCounter pmLicConnectedUsersLevSum .
attribute.condition: The counter is increased at every occasion when the corresponding sum counter is increased.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicConnectedUsersLevSum
attribute.description: Sum of all sample values recorded for "Connected Users".
attribute.condition: This counter is based on an internal level counter maintaining the current number of Connected Users. Values are read periodically and accumulated.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: licenseStateMultiErabsPerUser
attribute.description:
Enables or disables the licensed state of feature Multiple Radio Bearers per User. Indicates if a valid license key is installed for the feature.
Indicates the license status of feature MultiErabsPerUser, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: serviceStateMultiErabsPerUser
attribute.description: Indicates the operability of the licensed feature Multiple Radio Bearers per User. This attribute is a logical AND between other two attributes, featureState MultiErabsPerUser and licenseStateMultiErabsPerUser.

class.name: CsfbToGsmWcdma
class.description: Contains the licensing parameters for the optional feature CSFB (Circuit Switched Fallback) to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA. When the feature is activated CS Fallback requests is accepted and the UE is redirected to a GSM frequency band or a WCDMA or TD-SCDMA frequency.

attribute.name: featureStateCsfbToGsmWcdma
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed feature CS Fallback to GSM,WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED. Note that the value of the attribute is irrelevant in case no valid license key is installed for the CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA feature.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by featureStateCsfbToGeranUtran.

attribute.name: keyIdCsfbToGsmWcdma
attribute.description: The license key ID for the feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA .
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by keyIdCsfbToGeranUtran.

attribute.name: licenseStateCsfbToGsmWcdma
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed state of feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is ENABLED or DISABLED. That is, whether a valid license key is installed for the feature or not.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by licenseStateCsfbToGeranUtran.

attribute.name: serviceStateCsfbToGsmWcdma
attribute.description: Indicates if the feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is operable or inoperable, i.e. is the feature providing service or not.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by serviceStateCsfbToGeranUtran.

attribute.name: CsfbToGsmWcdmaId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by CsfbToGeranUtranId.

class.name: DlPrbCapacity
class.description: Contains information about the capacity license "DL PRB capacity", for Physical Resource Block.

attribute.name: capacityUnitDlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Defines the unit for the licensed capacity DL PRB capacity.

attribute.name: DlPrbCapacityId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: dlPrbCapacityHardLimit
attribute.description: Inidicates the hard limit for DL Physical Resource Block (PRB) capacity in the RBS.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: keyIdDlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: The product identity of the key for the capacity DL Physical Resource Block (PRB) capacity.

attribute.name: licenseCapacityDlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Indicates the licensed capacity limit for DL PRB capacity and reflects the capacity value in the license key file.

attribute.name: licenseStateDlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Indicates the licensed status of DL PRB capacity, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: pmLicDlPrbCapActual
attribute.description:
The X percentile of the utilization for DL PRB capacity during a measurement period. The value for X is set in the parameter licDlPrbPercentileConf.
Source Data: licDlPrbPercentileConf and pmLicPrbCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.condition: Is calculated at the end of an ROP period.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicDlPrbCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicDlPrbCapLicense
attribute.description:
Indicates the licensed capacity limit for DL PRB capacity. The value reflects the capacity value in the license key file i.e. the value of the parameter licenseCapacityDlPrbCapacity.
Source Attribute: licenseCapacityDlPrbCapacity
attribute.condition: Is changed when a new license key file with a new value for DL PRB capacity is installed on the RBS.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: licDlPrbPercentileConf
attribute.description: The attribute specifies which percentile to use for the counter pmLicDlPrbCapActual.

attribute.name: pmZtemporary42
attribute.description: Normally this counter is not used, it can however sometimes be temporarily used for very late additions in a release. If so, for description see Network Impact Report in the CPI.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

class.name: UlPrbCapacity
class.description: Contains information about the capacity license "UL PRB capacity", for Physical Resource Block.

attribute.name: capacityUnitUlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Defines the unit for the licensed capacity UL PRB capacity.

attribute.name: UlPrbCapacityId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ulPrbCapacityHardLimit
attribute.description: Inidicates the hard limit for UL Physical Resource Block (PRB) capacity in the RBS.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: keyIdUlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: The product identity of the key for the capacity UL Physical Resource Block (PRB) capacity.

attribute.name: licenseCapacityUlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Indicates the licensed capacity limit for UL PRB capacity and reflects the capacity value in the license key file.

attribute.name: licenseStateUlPrbCapacity
attribute.description: Indicates the licensed status of UL PRB capacity, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: pmLicUlPrbCapActual
attribute.description:
The X percentile of the utilization for UL PRB capacity during a measurement period. The value for X is set in the parameter licUlPrbPercentileConf.
Source Data: licUlPrbPercentileConf and pmLicPrbCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.condition: Is calculated at the end of an ROP period.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicUlPrbCapDistr
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Planned to be removed.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: pmLicUlPrbCapLicense
attribute.description:
Indicates the licensed capacity limit for UL PRB capacity. The value reflects the capacity value in the license key file i.e. the value of the parameter licenseCapacityUlPrbCapacity.
Source Attribute: licenseCapacityUlPrbCapacity
attribute.condition: Is changed when a new license key file with a new value for UL PRB capacity is installed on the RBS.
attribute.scanner: Primary

attribute.name: licUlPrbPercentileConf
attribute.description: The attribute specifies which percentile to use for the counter pmLicUlPrbCapActual.

attribute.name: pmZtemporary43
attribute.description: Normally this counter is not used, it can however sometimes be temporarily used for very late additions in a release. If so, for description see Network Impact Report in the CPI.
attribute.scanner: Not included in any predefined scanner

class.deprecated: Since L12B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: featureStateImLoadBalancing
attribute.description:
Activates or deactivates the licensed feature Idle Mode Load Balancing. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for this feature.
When enabled, the pmAvSubRatioSum and pmAvSubRatioSamp starts report load information, regardless if the actual load balancing function is enabled (EUtranCellRelation:imLoadBalancingActive).
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: licenseStateImLoadBalancing
attribute.description: Indicates if the licensed status of feature Idle Mode Load Balancing, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: serviceStateImLoadBalancing
attribute.description: Indicates if the licensed feature Idle Mode Load Balancing is operable or inoperable.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

class.description: Rps (Relative Priority Scheduling) contains the licensing parameters for the optional feature relative priority scheduling.

attribute.name: featureStateRps
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed feature Relative Priority Scheduling is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the the Relative Priority Scheduling feature.

attribute.name: keyIdRps
attribute.description: The license key ID for the Relative Priority Scheduling feature

attribute.name: licenseStateRps
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed state of feature Relative Priority Scheduling feature is ENABLED or DISABLED, whether a valid license key is installed for the feature.

attribute.name: serviceStateRps
attribute.description: Indicates if the Relative Priority Scheduling feature is operable or inoperable. The RPS feature becomes operable only if there are valid licenses for both the RPS and the QoS Aware Scheduling features.

attribute.name: RpsId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

class.name: Pws

attribute.name: featureStatePws

attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed state of feature Public Warning System is ENABLED or DISABLED and whether a valid license key is installed for the feature.

attribute.name: serviceStatePws
attribute.description: Indicates if the feature Public Warning System is operable or inoperable.

attribute.name: serviceStateSupport6Cells

attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: featureStateCsfbToGeranUtran
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed feature CS Fallback to GSM,WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED. Note that the value of the attribute is irrelevant in case no valid license key is installed for the CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA feature.

attribute.description: The license key ID for the feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA .

attribute.name: licenseStateCsfbToGeranUtran
attribute.description: Indicates whether the licensed state of feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is ENABLED or DISABLED. That is, whether a valid license key is installed for the feature or not.

attribute.name: serviceStateCsfbToGeranUtran
attribute.description: Indicates if the feature CS Fallback to GSM, WCDMA and TD-SCDMA is operable or inoperable, i.e. is the feature providing service or not.

class.name: TransportNetwork
class.description:
Transport Network
This MO structures the transport network of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is TransportNetwork=1.

attribute.name: TransportNetworkId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: ManagedElement
class.description:
Managed Element
This MO is the top MO in the MOM. A management application will communicate with the ManagedElement MO for the purpose of monitoring and controlling it.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is ManagedElement=1.

attribute.name: ManagedElementId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: site
attribute.description: This attribute gives information about geographical location, for example place name.

attribute.name: logicalName
attribute.description: Specifies the logical name of a node.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: This attribute describes the product type and is always set to the value "Node".

attribute.name: productName
attribute.description: This attribute describes the implemented functionality.

attribute.name: productNumber
attribute.description: This attribute uniquely identifies the product, for example ROF123.

attribute.name: productRevision
attribute.description: This attribute identifies the version of the product, for example R2A.

attribute.name: mimName
attribute.description: The name and version of the MIM on the node.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by mimInfo

attribute.name: faultTolerantCoreStates
attribute.description:
Retrieves information of PIUs (maximum 2 PIUs) that are running Fault Tolerant Core (FTC). This attribute contains an array of strings, for example:
ManagedElement=1,Equipment=1,Subrack=1,Slot=1,PlugInUnit=1;ftcState=Active ManagedElement=1,Equipment=1,Subrack=1,Slot=2,PlugInUnit=1;ftcState=PassiveReady
The possible FTC states are Init, NotConfigured, Active, Unavailable, PassiveNotReady, PassiveReady.

attribute.name: applicationConfiguration
attribute.description: Specifies configuration data critical for an application.

attribute.name: mimInfo
attribute.description: The name, version and release of the MIM.

attribute.name: healthCheckSchedule
attribute.description: The scheduled time and weekday, when the health check starts.

attribute.name: healthCheckResult
attribute.description: The result of the latest health check.

action.name: startHealthCheck
action.description:
Initiates a health check.
The health check investigates consistency of the file systems, configuration versions and upgrade packages. Alarms will be generated if a fault is found, see the alarms: - File System Diagnostic Error - Configuration Version Corrupt - Upgrade Package Corrupt
Only one health check action at a time can be active. Further attempts to start the health check are rejected. If the attribute operationalState of a PlugInUnit MO instance is set to DISABLED, the corresponding plug-in unit is not checked.
During an ongoing health check, configuration versions cannot be created or deleted.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the node.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added.

action.disturbances: manualRestart causes loss of traffic!

class.name: ManagedElementData
class.description:
This object contains attributes and actions on node level.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is ManagedElementData=1.

attribute.name: ManagedElementDataId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: autoConfigurationAllowed
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies if the system is allowed to automatically configure detected objects.
Autoconfiguration is supported for upgradable hardware connected to CPP Subrack and Slot.
When setting this attribute from true to false the system creates a new CV.

attribute.name: documentServerAddress
attribute.description:
The base URL for the documentation server.
The attribute is read by the Element Management application to find the documentation server in the network. The URL shall contain the document server, for example:
http://cpi2.al.sw.ericsson.se/alexserv
The syntax "http://cpi.al.sw.ericsson.se/alexserv?LI=EN/LZN7450008R2A" is deprecated, and will not be supported in a future release. Please use the attribute docLibUserDefined if docLibSystemDefined is not available.

attribute.name: logonServerAddress
attribute.description:
A list of node names or IP addresses of the single logon servers (SLSs). The list uses commas to seperate the single logon server addresses, e.g. "https://SLS1,https://SLS2,https://SLS3", these addresses consists of the URLs to the concerned SLS servers. Maximum of 3 SLSs are supported. The attribute is read by Element Management application to find the single logon server in the network.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressPrimary
attribute.description:
This is the IP address to the NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActivePrimary
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the primary NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagPrimary
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the primary NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressSecondary
attribute.description:
This is an alternative IP address to an NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActiveSecondary
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the secondary NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagSecondary
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the secondary NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: nodeUTCTime
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies the UTC time used in the node.
It is the number of milliseconds elapsed since the epoch time (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT).
To set this attribute, all the three attributes, ntpServiceActive for Primary, Secondary and Third, must be false.

attribute.name: nodeLocalTimeZone
attribute.description:
Specifies the time zone of the node. This attribute is needed by management application to convert UTC time from a log or NTP service to local time. It will not change the real time clock on the node.
Choose a time zone abbreviation, three characters, in the list below, or specify a node local time in the format "+/-" and "hh:mm", where "hh" is hours and "mm" is minutes. Example: GMT or +01:30
Time zone and its offset in hours:
GMT (Greenwich Mean Time) 0 UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) 0 ECT (Central European Standard Time) + 1 EET (Eastern European Time) + 2 ART (Eastern European Time) + 2 EAT (Eastern African Time) + 3 MET (Iran Time) + 3.5 NET (Armenia Time) + 4 PLT (Pakistan Time) + 5 IST (India Standard Time) + 5.5 BST (Bangladesh Time) + 6 VST (Indochina Time) + 7 CTT (China Standard Time) + 8 JST (Japan Standard Time) + 9 CST (Central Standard Time) + 9.5 EST (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 AET (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 SST (Solomon Is. Time) + 11 NST (New Zealand Standard Time) + 12 CAT (Central Alaska Time) - 1 AGT (Argentina Time) - 3 BET (Brazil Time) - 3 CNT (Newfoundland Standard Time) - 3.5 PRT (Atlantic Standard Time) - 4 IET (Eastern Standard Time) - 5 ACT (Central Standard Time) - 6 PNT (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 MST (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 PST (Pacific Standard Time) - 8 AST (Alaska Standard Time) - 9 HST (Hawaii Standard Time) - 10 MIT (West Saoma Time) - 11 --
Reference: http://www.greenwichmeantime.com

attribute.name: daylightSavingTime
attribute.description: This attribute states if daylight saving time is used on this node. It is used by the node, and will not change the real time clock on the node.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCSize
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by hdVolumeCExt.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCFreespace
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by hdVolumeCFreespaceExt.

attribute.name: nodeUniqueID
attribute.description: This is a unique node identity to be set only in the factory.

attribute.name: swServerUrlList
attribute.description:
A comma-separated list of URLs, ending with the folder name containing CXC folders.
Example: Entering URL "http://111.222.333.444:8080/Ericsson" makes the node look for files located in "http://111.222.333.444:8080/Ericsson/CXC112233/Rxxx/jarfile.jar"
For downloading of software for system upgrade, see the attribute ftpServerIpAddress in MO UpgradePackage.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

attribute.name: piuGroupEscalationType
attribute.description: The type of node restart when it is a problem with the last PIU in a PIU group.

attribute.name: minimumHdVolumeCFreespace
attribute.description:
Minimum number of Megabytes of free space on C volume before an alarm is issued. 0 means that no alarm will be sent.
It is used as a threshold that triggers alarms when the C volume is about to be full (i.e. when the attribute hdVolumeCFreespaceExt exceeds this value).
The value should be set large enough so that an alarm is raised when the C volume is starting to have too little space for the new files of the next upgrade package.
The value should be small enough, so that the alarm is not sent unnecessarily when there is a lot of free space.
Alarm is raised if the value of hdVolumeCFreespaceExt becomes less than or equal to this value. But in order to cease the alarm, the free space must become at least 1 Megabyte larger than this value. To free space on the C volume, some old UpgradePackage MOs should be deleted.

attribute.name: docLibSystemDefined
attribute.description:
The identity of the ALEX document library defined for this node type and version, set by the system.
The attribute is read by the Element Management application to find the documentation library. The value must contain the used library identity, without spaces, for example: EN/LZN7450008R2A

attribute.name: docLibUserDefined
attribute.description:
The identity of an ALEX document library that can be defined by the user.
Use this attribute to set the library identity, if the attribute docLibSystemDefined is not available, or if the system-defined ALEX library is not available on the document server. If this attribute is set, it is used by the Element Manager to indentify the documentation library, instead of the value of docLibSystemDefined.
The value contains the library identity, without spaces, for example: EN/LZN7450008R2A

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagThird
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the third NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollThird
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the third NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollThird
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the third NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressThird
attribute.description:
This is an alternative IP address to an NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActiveThird
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the third NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: autoConfigurationStatus
attribute.description: Displays if autoconfiguration is in progress or not.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCSizeExt
attribute.description: The total size of the C volume on the node. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCFreespaceExt
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the C volume. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks in a node.

action.name: createNtpPrimary
action.description:
This action creates the primary Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: createNtpSecondary
action.description:
This action creates the secondary/alternative Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: deleteNtpPrimary
action.description: This action deletes the primary NTP.

action.name: deleteNtpSecondary
action.description: This action deletes the secondary NTP.

action.name: setNodeUniqueId
action.description:
Used for setting the attribute nodeUniqueId.
This action should only be used in the factory, it is not for general use by the operator.

action.name: createNtpThird
action.description:
This action creates the third alternative Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: deleteNtpThird
action.description: This action deletes the third NTP.

class.name: WebServer
class.description:
Web Server
This MO is used for publishing data over HTTP in the node. The loadmodules to be published over HTTP are normally displayed in the SwAllocation MO, where the attribute repertoireList contains at least one reference to a Repertoire MO with load modules for web publishing and the attribute slotList contains a reference to the WebServer MO.
If the SwAllocation MO is not configured as above, then all loadmodules defined for HTTP publishing in the UCF file are published.
The SwAllocation MO is created automatically and cannot be changed or deleted. Only userLabel can be set.
The RDN of this MO is WebServer=1.

attribute.name: WebServerId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description:
Contains the SwAllocation instance that reserves this MO instance.
Restriction: This MO instance can be reserved by only one instance of SwAllocation.

class.name: SystemFunctions
class.description:
System Functions
This MO structures the system functions of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is SystemFunctions=1.

attribute.name: SystemFunctionsId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: PmService
class.description:
Performance Management Service for statistical rop files.
This MO configures limits of this service for the node.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is PmService=1.

attribute.name: minorAlarmCeasingDelta
attribute.description:
The percentage of the attribute maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the minor alarm ceasing limit.
Minor alarm ceasing limit = maxNoOfCounters * (100 - minorAlarmCeasingDelta) / 100
A minor alarm is ceased when the total number of active counters becomes lower than the minor alarm ceasing limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rule: The calculated minor alarm ceasing limit >= the calculated warning alarm ceasing limit.

attribute.name: maxNoOfMonitors
attribute.description:
The maximum number of simultaneously active performance monitorings.
If this limit is exceeded, when a performance monitoring is created or resumed, the create or resume operation is rejected.
To keep the number of active performance monitorings below the limit, performance monitorings can be suspended if the value is set to a lower value than before. The most recently defined performance monitorings are suspended first.

attribute.name: maxNoOfPmFiles
attribute.description:
The maximum number of Result Output Period (ROP) files that are maintained in the node.
If a new file is created and the limit is exceeded, the oldest file is deleted.
If the value is set to a lower value than before, files can be deleted to keep the number of stored files below the limit. The oldest file is deleted first.

attribute.name: performanceDataPath
attribute.description: The name of the path to where the ROP files are stored.

attribute.name: performanceDataVolume
attribute.description: The volume (c, p or any r-volume) where the ROP files are stored. The format for this attribute is: /c/, /pxxxxxx/ or /rxxxxxx/, where each x is a digit (0..9).

attribute.name: PmServiceId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: warningAlarmLimitPercent
attribute.description:
The percentage of the attribute maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the warning alarm limit.
Warning alarm limit = maxNoOfCounters * warningAlarmLimitPercent/100
A warning alarm is raised if the total number of active counters exceeeds the warning alarm limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rule: warningAlarmLimitPercent > warningAlarmCeasingDelta.

attribute.name: warningAlarmCeasingDelta
attribute.description:
The percentage of maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the warning alarm ceasing limit.
Warning alarm ceasing limit = maxNoOfCounters * (warningAlarmLimitPercent - warningAlarmCeasingDelta)/100.
A warning alarm is ceased when the total number of active counters becomes lower than the warning alarm ceasing limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rules: The calculated warning alarm ceasing limit <= the calculated minor alarm ceasing limit. warningAlarmLimitPercent > warningAlarmCeasingDelta.

attribute.name: maxNoOfCounters
attribute.description:
The maximum number of simultaneously active counters.
If this limit is exceeded, when a performance monitoring is created or resumed, the create or resume operation is rejected. If the total number of simultaneously active counters becomes higher than a preset percentage of the maximum limit, a alarm is issued.
To keep the number of active counters below the limit, performance monitorings can be suspended if this value is set to a lower value than before. The most recently defined performance monitorings are suspended first.

attribute.name: transactionTimeOut
attribute.description: The time for the transaction timeout that is applied for all transactions created internally by the Performance Management Service, for example when creating a performance monitoring.

class.name: Ncli
class.description:
Node Command Line Interface (NCLI)
This MO is responsible to start/stop the NCLI Server.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Ncli=1.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
The NCLI Server is stopped by setting the administrativeState to LOCKED. This will close down all ongoing NCLI sessions immediately.
When setting the administrativeState to SHUTTING_DOWN, 1800 seconds (30 minutes) will elapse before the MO goes into state LOCKED. During this time no new NCLI sessions are accepted.
Setting the administrativeState to UNLOCKED starts the NCLI Server.

attribute.name: NcliId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

action.name: executeCommandFile
action.description:
This action executes a NCLI command file on the node file system.
The action is synchronous and not possible to abort.
All commands in the command file will be included in an internally created transaction. This transaction is committed only if all commands in the file are successfully executed. If any command fails, the transaction is rolled back.
The command file can specify a transaction mode where each command in the file is run in its own transaction.
The command file contains one valid NCLI command per row.

class.name: Srb1Profile
class.description: Represents mapping from SRB1 to parameters that have impact on bearer-level QoS.

attribute.name: Srb1ProfileId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: logicalChannelPriority
attribute.description: Corresponds to the logical channel priority (see TS 36.321) for SRB1.

class.name: Srb2Profile
class.description: Represents mapping from SRB2 to parameters that have impact on bearer-level QoS.

attribute.name: Srb2ProfileId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: logicalChannelPriority
attribute.description: Corresponds to the logical channel priority (see TS 36.321) for SRB2.

class.name: SrbLogicalChannelGroup
class.description: Represents QoS configuration related to the SRB Logical Channel group.

attribute.name: SrbLogicalChannelGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN). The Logical Channel Group ID for signalling radio bearers. The RDN for this MO type must always be 0.

class.name: SrbTable
class.description:
Contains mapping from SRBs to parameters that has impact on bearer-level QoS.
The RDN for this MO type is "default".

attribute.name: SrbTableId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of cells that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: DataRadioBearer
class.description: Radio Bearer configuration.

attribute.name: DataRadioBearerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: pelr
attribute.description: Defines the packet loss rate for this DRB. Note that the parameter shall be multiplied by 10^(-6) as indicated by the Unit.

attribute.name: rlcMode
attribute.description: RLC Mode: Acknowledged Mode (AM), Unacknowledged Mode (UM) or Transparent Mode (TM).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Attribute moved to QciProfilePredefined

attribute.name: headerCompression
attribute.description: What type of header compression to use.

attribute.name: tPollRetransmitUl
attribute.description: Time before asking for new poll if no STATUS report arrives for the Sequence Number of the PDU where the poll bit was set

attribute.name: ulPollPDU
attribute.description:
Maximum number of PDUs before polling for a STATUS report.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: tReorderingDl
attribute.description: Time before sending STATUS report when a Sequence Number is outstanding
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Attribute moved to QciProfilePredefined

attribute.name: tStatusProhibitDl
attribute.description: Time after sending STATUS report before a new STATUS report is allowed to be sent.

attribute.name: tPollRetransmitDl
attribute.description: Time before asking for new poll if no STATUS report arrives for the Sequence Number of the PDU where the poll bit was set

attribute.name: dlPollPDU
attribute.description:
Maximum number of PDUs before polling for a STATUS report.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: tReorderingUl
attribute.description: Time before sending STATUS report when a Sequence Number is outstanding
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Attribute moved to QciProfilePredefined

attribute.name: tStatusProhibitUl
attribute.description: Time after sending STATUS report before a new STATUS report is allowed to be sent.

attribute.name: dlMaxRetxThreshold
attribute.description: Maximum number RLC re-transmissions in DL before stopping and indicating to RRC that maximum number of RLC re-transmissions have been reached.

attribute.name: ulMaxRetxThreshold
attribute.description: Maximum number RLC re-transmissions in UL before stopping and indicating to RRC that maximum number of RLC re-transmissions have been reached.

class.name: MACConfiguration
class.description: MAC configuration.

attribute.name: tPeriodicBSRTimer
attribute.description:
Maximum time between Buffer Status Reports.
Special values: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: dlMaxHARQTx
attribute.description: Maximum number of transmissions for one HARQ process in DL.

attribute.name: ulMaxHARQTx
attribute.description: Maximum number of transmissions for one HARQ process in UL.

attribute.name: MACConfigurationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: tTimeAlignmentTimer
attribute.description:
Timer to supervise synchronous UE transmissions.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: tPeriodicPHRTimer
attribute.description:
Periodicity of Periodic PHR.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: tProhibitPHRTimer
attribute.description: Timer to prohibit excessive PHR.

attribute.name: dlPathlossChange
attribute.description:
DL Pathloss change threshold for triggering PHR.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

class.name: RadioBearerTable
class.description:
Contains Radio Bearer configurations.
The RDN for this MO type is "default".

attribute.name: RadioBearerTableId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of cells that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: SignalingRadioBearer
class.description: Signaling Radio Bearer configuration.

attribute.name: SignalingRadioBearerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: tReorderingUl
attribute.description: Time before sending STATUS report when a Sequence Number for a UL transmission is outstanding.

attribute.name: tStatusProhibitUl
attribute.description: Time after sending STATUS report before a new STATUS report is allowed to be sent.

attribute.name: tPollRetransmitDl
attribute.description: Time before asking for new poll if no STATUS report arrives for the Sequence Number of the PDU where the poll bit was set.

attribute.name: dlPollPDU
attribute.description:
Maximum number of PDUs before polling for a STATUS report.
Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: dlMaxRetxThreshold
attribute.description: Maximum number RLC re-transmissions in DL before stopping and indicating to RRC that maximum number of RLC re-transmissions have been reached.

attribute.name: tPollRetransmitUl
attribute.description: Time before asking for new poll if no STATUS report arrives for the Sequence Number of the PDU where the poll bit was set.

attribute.name: ulPollPDU
attribute.description: Maximum number of PDUs before polling for a STATUS report. Special value: 0 means infinity.

attribute.name: tReorderingDl
attribute.description: Time before sending STATUS report when a Sequence Number is outstanding.

attribute.name: tStatusProhibitDl
attribute.description: Time after sending STATUS report before a new STATUS report is allowed to be sent.

attribute.name: ulMaxRetxThreshold
attribute.description: Maximum number RLC re-transmissions in UL before stopping and indicating to RRC that maximum number of RLC re-transmissions have been reached.

class.name: LogicalChannelGroup
class.description: Represents QoS configuration related to a Logical Channel group.

attribute.name: LogicalChannelGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN). Valid values for this MO type are: 0, 1, 2, or 3. The values correspond to logical channel group IDs in 3GPP TS 36.321.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of QciProfile instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: ulMinBitRate
attribute.description: This parameter defines the minimum Bit rate which the scheduler will attempt to enforce for users with this QCI. The value does not guarantee that we can always achieve this minrate. Value 0 means that the minRate scheduler is not used.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is used only if one of the Proportional Fair scheduling strategies is selected under ENodeBFunction: Scheduling Strategy

attribute.name: absPrioOverride
attribute.description: Indicates if the data radio bearers of the logical channel group are subject to Absolute Priority Override.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Replaced by QciProfilePredefined::absPrioOverride.

class.name: QciProfilePredefined
class.description:
Contains bearer-level QoS configuration. It is not possible to create or remove instances of this MO. Each QciProfilePredefined instance corresponds to a standardized QCI as described in TS 23.203, except for a default QCI profile activated whenever a profile related to a specific QCI is not defined.
The RDNs for this MO type is “qci1”, “qci2”, .. “qci9”, “default”.

attribute.name: schedulingAlgorithm
attribute.description: Specifies which scheduling algorithm is to be used for a certain QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active. The value DELAY_BASED can only be used if the attribute serviceType has value VOIP.

attribute.name: QciProfilePredefinedId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: qci
attribute.description:
Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI) as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203 (Release 8). Each instance of this MO has a unique value for the QCI.
Special value: 0 refers to a default QCI profile activated whenever a profile related to a specific QCI has not been defined.
attribute.dependencies: Each qci must be set to a unique value.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI)-related priority as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203 (Release 8).

attribute.name: pdb
attribute.description: The contribution from eNodeB to the Packet Delay Budget (PDB) for a QCI. Packet delays outside eNodeB e.g. in the transport network are excluded. For more information about PDB refer to TS 23.203.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and active.

attribute.name: pelr
attribute.description: The packet loss rate for a QCI as defined in TS 23.203 (Release 8). Note that the parameter shall be multiplied by 10-6 as indicated by the Unit.
attribute.deprecated: Since L12A. Has no functional behaviour. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point for a Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI). This corresponds to mappings from RAN QoS to Transport Network QoS.

attribute.name: logicalChannelGroupRef
attribute.description: Refers to an instance of LogicalChannelGroup. Assigns a Logical Channel Group to a Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI).

attribute.name: aqmMode
attribute.description: Active Queue Management (AQM) mode

attribute.name: pdbOffset
attribute.description: An offset to the PDB used by Active Queue Management (AQM).
attribute.dependencies: pdb + pdbOffset >= 0

attribute.name: dlMinBitRate
attribute.description: The scheduler will attempt to achieve minbitrate for all bearers before giving any user a higher rate. Value 0 means that the minRate scheduler is not used.
attribute.dependencies: This parameter will only be used if one of the following Proportional Fair scheduling algorithms, "maximum_C_over_I", "proportional_fair_low", "proportional_fair_medium", "proportional_fair_high" or "equal_rate", has been selected. Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: rlcSNLength
attribute.description: Indicates the Radio Link Control (RLC) Sequence Number as specified in TS 36.322
attribute.dependencies: RLC UM needs to be configured. rlcMode = UM

attribute.name: pdcpSNLength
attribute.description: Indicates the Packet Data Convergence Protocol (PDCP) Sequence Number length in bits as specified in TS 36.323.
attribute.dependencies: RLC UM needs to be configured. rlcMode = UM

attribute.name: tReorderingDl
attribute.description: This timer is used by the receiving end of Acknowledged Mode (AM) or Unacknowledged Mode (UM) Radio Link Control (RLC) entity in UE, to detect loss of downlink RLC protocol data units at lower layers.
attribute.dependencies: Not applicable for RLC TM. Only relevant when rlcMode is UM or AM

attribute.name: tReorderingUl
attribute.description: This timer is used by the receiving end of the Acknowledged Mode (AM) or Unacknowledged Mode (UM) Radio Link Control (RLC) entity in eNB, to detect loss of uplink RLC protocol data units at lower layers.
attribute.dependencies: Not applicable for RLC TM. Only relevant when rlcMode is UM or AM

attribute.name: rlcMode
attribute.description: RLC Mode

attribute.name: resourceType
attribute.description: Indicates if the resource type of the Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI) is Guaranteed Bit Rate (GBR) or non-GBR as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203.

attribute.name: dataFwdPerQciEnabled
attribute.description: Enables forwarding of data for this QCI. Only valid if the licence IntraLTEHODataFwd is installed and active.

attribute.name: ulMinBitRate
attribute.description: The scheduler will attempt to achieve minbitrate for all bearers before giving any user a higher rate. Value 0 means that the minRate scheduler is not used.
attribute.dependencies:
This parameter will only be used if one of the following Proportional Fair scheduling algorithms, "maximum_C_over_I", "proportional_fair_low", "proportional_fair_medium", "proportional_fair_high" or "equal_rate", has been selected.
Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: absPrioOverride
attribute.description: Indicates if the data radio bearer is subject to Absolute Priority Override.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: resourceAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: Defines the resource allocation strategy of the QoS Class Identifier (QCI).
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the licenses for Uplink Frequency Selective Scheduling and QoS Aware Scheduler are present and the features are active.

attribute.name: srsAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: If the parameter srsAllocationStrategy in the QoS configuration for a Data radio Bearer assigned to a UE is set to ACTIVATED, then an attempt is made to allocate sounding for a UE. If several Data Radio Bearers are setup towards the UE with different QoS configurations, and the QoS configurations has different QCI parameter, an algorithm using the priority parameter in the QoS configuration, will resolve which QoS configuration that will define sounding.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the licenses for QoS Aware Scheduler and frequency selective scheduling are present and the features are active.

attribute.name: measReportConfigParams
attribute.description: Encapsulates the offset quantities of the mobility measurement thresholds. Only absolute mobility measurement thresholds are considered. The structure holds, for example, offsets for the thresholds a1ThresholdRsrpPrim, a2ThresholdRsrpPrim, and a5Threshold1Rsrp. The offsets are meant mainly to have values that differentiate the measurement threhsolds between QCIs.

attribute.name: qciSubscriptionQuanta
attribute.description: Normalized subscription quantity associated with the specific the QCI. Specifies the subscription cost of a bearer with this predefined profile. The subscription cost is used for traffic load balancing purposes.

attribute.name: qciACTuning
attribute.description: Tuning factor per QCI for admission control. Only valid for QCIs with resource type GBR.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for Dynamic GBR admission control is present and the feature is active.
attribute.disturbances: Setting values below one means overbooking of GBR resources and thus a risk of letting in more GBR traffic than can be supported. Setting values above one means underbooking of GBR resources and thus a risk of underutilization of the resources.

attribute.name: dlResourceAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: Defines the downlink resource allocation strategy of the QoS Class Identifier (QCI).
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the licenses for Downlink Frequency Selective Scheduling and QoS Aware Scheduler are present and the features are active.

attribute.name: relativePriority
attribute.description: The relative priority associated with a QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the feature states of the QoS Aware Scheduler , Proportional Fair Scheduler, and the Rps are enabled.

attribute.name: rohcEnabled
attribute.description: Indicates if Robust Header Compression (ROHC) is enabled.

attribute.name: serviceType
attribute.description: Indicates the service that the bearer is used for.
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: drxProfileRef
attribute.description: Points out the DRX profile associated with this QCI. If not set the default reference will be to the DrxProfile instance corresponding to Local Distinguished Name (LDN) = ManagementElement=1, ENodeBFunction=1, DRxProfile=0.
attribute.dependencies: The DRX profile must exist, otherwise it will be interpreted as default DRX profile.

attribute.name: drxPriority
attribute.description: The relative priority among the DRX profiles, i.e. if the bearer that is setup with this QCI has a higher DRX priority than any of the existing bearers, the DRX configuration will be set to those selected by the drxProfileId for this QCI. The drxPriority has to be unique across all the configured QciProfilePredefined and QciProfileOperatorDefined MOC instances except for instances where the drxProfileId is the same. That is, instances that share the same drxProfileId may have the same drxPriority value. Also note that larger drxPriority values indicate higher relative priority.

attribute.name: counterActiveMode
attribute.description: Defines the interpretation of active for the QCI: FALSE (DEFAULT): Active time is measured in the case of: DRB: as the time when there is data in a buffer, DL and/or UL, with an added guard period of 100 ms thereafter UE: as the time when there is data in a buffer, DL and/or UL, with an added guard period of 100 ms thereafter in any of the DRBs connected to the UE The pmCounters for active E-RABs are stepped in case of data in a buffer, DL and/or UL. TRUE: Active time is measured in the case of: DRB: from the first data occurence in a buffer to the last data occurence in a buffer for that DRB UE: from the first data occurence in a buffer to the last data occurence in a buffer for any DRB associated with the UE The pmCounters for active E-RABs are always stepped since the DRB is considered always active

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: QciTable
class.description:
Contains mapping from QCIs to parameters that has impact on QoS for DRBs.
The RDN for this MO type is "default".

attribute.name: QciTableId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of cells that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: QciProfileOperatorDefined
class.description: Contains bearer-level QoS configuration. Instances of this class are created on demand by the operator. Each QciProfileOperatorDefined instance corresponds to a unique operator defined QCI number within the range 10-255. The instances can be created and configured independent of the serviceStateOperatorDefinedQci. However the configured QCI profiles can not be used at bearer setup / modify unless the service state is OPERABLE.

attribute.name: absPrioOverride
attribute.description: Indicates if the data radio bearer is subject to Absolute Priority Override.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: aqmMode
attribute.description: Active Queue Management (AQM) mode

attribute.name: dataFwdPerQciEnabled
attribute.description: Enables forwarding of data for this QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Only valid if the licence IntraLTEHODataFwd is installed and active.

attribute.name: dlMinBitRate
attribute.description: The scheduler will attempt to achieve minbitrate for all bearers before giving any user a higher rate. Value 0 means that the minRate scheduler is not used.
attribute.dependencies:
This parameter will only be used if one of the following Proportional Fair scheduling algorithms, "maximum_C_over_I", "proportional_fair_low", "proportional_fair_medium", "proportional_fair_high" or "equal_rate", has been selected.
Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: The Differentiated Services Code Point for a Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI). This corresponds to mappings from RAN QoS to Transport Network QoS.

attribute.name: logicalChannelGroupRef
attribute.description: Refers to an instance of LogicalChannelGroup. Assigns a Logical Channel Group to a Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI).

attribute.name: measReportConfigParams
attribute.description: Encapsulates the offset quantities of the mobility measurement thresholds. Only absolute mobility measurement thresholds are considered. The structure holds, for example, offsets for the thresholds a1ThresholdRsrpPrim, a2ThresholdRsrpPrim, and a5Threshold1Rsrp. The offsets are meant mainly to have values that differentiate the measurement threhsolds between QCIs

attribute.name: pdb
attribute.description: The contribution from eNodeB to the Packet Delay Budget (PDB) for a QCI. Packet delays outside eNodeB e.g. in the transport network are excluded. For more information about PDB refer to TS 23.203
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and active.

attribute.name: pdbOffset
attribute.description: An offset to the PDB used by Active Queue Management (AQM).
attribute.dependencies: pdb + pdbOffset >= 0

attribute.name: pdcpSNLength
attribute.description: Indicates the Packet Data Convergence Protocol (PDCP) Sequence Number length in bits as specified in TS 36.323.
attribute.dependencies: RLC UM needs to be configured. rlcMode = UM

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI)-related priority as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203 (Release 8).

attribute.name: qci
attribute.description: Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI) as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203 (Release 8). Each instance of this MO has a unique value for the QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Each qci must be set to a unique value.

attribute.name: qciACTuning
attribute.description: Tuning factor per QCI for admission control. Only valid for QCIs with resource type GBR.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for Dynamic GBR admission control is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: QciProfileOperatorDefinedId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: qciSubscriptionQuanta
attribute.description: Normalized subscription quantity associated with the specific the QCI. Specifies the subscription cost of a bearer with this predefined profile. The subscription cost is used for traffic load balancing purposes.

attribute.name: resourceAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: Defines the resource allocation strategy of the QoS Class Identifier (QCI).
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active

attribute.name: resourceType
attribute.description: Indicates if the resource type of the Quality of Service Class Indicator (QCI) is Guaranteed Bit Rate (GBR) or non-GBR as defined in 3GPP TS 23.203.

attribute.name: rlcMode
attribute.description: RLC Mode

attribute.name: rlcSNLength
attribute.description: Indicates the Radio Link Control (RLC) Sequence Number as specified in TS 36.322
attribute.dependencies: RLC UM needs to be configured. rlcMode = UM

attribute.name: schedulingAlgorithm
attribute.description: Specifies which scheduling algorithm is to be used for a certain QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active. The value DELAY_BASED can only be used if the attribute serviceType has value VOIP.

attribute.name: srsAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: If the parameter srsAllocationStrategy in the QoS configuration for a Data radio Bearer assigned to a UE is set to ACTIVATED, then an attempt is made to allocate sounding for a UE. If several Data Radio Bearers are setup towards the UE with different QoS configurations, and the QoS configurations has different QCI parameter, an algorithm using the priority parameter in the QoS configuration, will resolve which QoS configuration that will define sounding

attribute.name: tReorderingDl
attribute.description: This timer is used by the receiving end of Acknowledged Mode (AM) or Unacknowledged Mode (UM) Radio Link Control (RLC) entity in UE, to detect loss of downlink RLC protocol data units at lower layers.
attribute.dependencies: Not applicable for RLC TM. Only relevant when rlcMode is UM or AM

attribute.name: tReorderingUl
attribute.description: This timer is used by the receiving end of the Acknowledged Mode (AM) or Unacknowledged Mode (UM) Radio Link Control (RLC) entity in eNB, to detect loss of uplink RLC protocol data units at lower layers.
attribute.dependencies: Not applicable for RLC TM. Only relevant when rlcMode is UM or AM

attribute.name: ulMinBitRate
attribute.description: The scheduler will attempt to achieve minbitrate for all bearers before giving any user a higher rate. Value 0 means that the minRate scheduler is not used.
attribute.dependencies:
This parameter will only be used if one of the following Proportional Fair scheduling algorithms, "maximum_C_over_I", "proportional_fair_low", "proportional_fair_medium", "proportional_fair_high" or "equal_rate", has been selected.
Only relevant if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: relativePriority
attribute.description: The relative priority associated with a QCI.
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the feature states of the QoS Aware Scheduler , Proportional Fair Scheduler, and the Rps are enabled.

attribute.name: serviceType
attribute.description: Indicates the service that the bearer is used for.
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the license for QoS Aware Scheduler is present and the feature is active.

attribute.name: drxProfileRef
attribute.description: Points out the DRX profile associated with this QCI. If not set the default reference will be to the DrxProfile instance corresponding to Local Distinguished Name (LDN) = ManagementElement=1, ENodeBFunction=1, DRxProfile=0.
attribute.dependencies: The DRX profile must exist, otherwise it will be interpreted as default DRX profile.

attribute.name: drxPriority
attribute.description: The relative priority among the DRX profiles, i.e. if the bearer that is setup with this QCI has a higher DRX priority than any of the existing bearers, the DRX configuration will be set to those selected by the drxProfileId for this QCI. The drxPriority has to be unique across all the configured QciProfilePredefined and QciProfileOperatorDefined MOC instances except for instances where the drxProfileId is the same. That is, instances that share the same drxProfileId may have the same drxPriority value. Also note that larger drxPriority values indicate higher relative priority.

attribute.name: counterActiveMode
attribute.description: Defines the interpretation of active for the QCI: FALSE (DEFAULT): Active time is measured in the case of: DRB: as the time when there is data in a buffer, DL and/or UL, with an added guard period of 100 ms thereafter UE: as the time when there is data in a buffer, DL and/or UL, with an added guard period of 100 ms thereafter in any of the DRBs connected to the UE The pmCounters for active E-RABs are stepped in case of data in a buffer, DL and/or UL. TRUE: Active time is measured in the case of: DRB: from the first data occurence in a buffer to the last data occurence in a buffer for that DRB UE: from the first data occurence in a buffer to the last data occurence in a buffer for any DRB associated with the UE The pmCounters for active E-RABs are always stepped since the DRB is considered always active

attribute.name: rohcEnabled
attribute.description: Indicates if Robust Header Compression (ROHC) is enabled.

attribute.name: dlResourceAllocationStrategy
attribute.description: Defines the downlink resource allocation strategy of the QoS Class Identifier (QCI).
attribute.dependencies: Changes to this parameter take effect only if the licenses for Downlink Frequency Selective Scheduling and QoS Aware Scheduler are present and the features are active.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: ExternalENodeBFunction
class.description: This managed object represents another ENodeB.

attribute.name: eNodeBPlmnId
attribute.description:
The Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) ID of the node. The PLMN ID consists of:
1. MobileCountryCode, MCC, 3 digits 2. MobileNetworkCode, MNC, 2 or 3 digits (the correct number of digits is set in the mncLength member of this Struct).
Example: If MCC=125 and MNC=46, then plmnId=12546.
Note: default PLMNIdentity is not a valid PLMN Identity.

attribute.name: ExternalENodeBFunctionId
