This MO models a fan group. A fan group is one or more fans which are supervised and controlled as a group. The MO ID will match the physical fan group ID.
Dependencies: Can only exist in the node when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: FanGroupId
attribute.description: Identity of the fan group. It matches the number on the physical unit and it is the value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description: Indicates the current fault LED status of the fan group. The LED is physically located on the corresponding SCU.
attribute.deprecated: Since 11A. Replaced by fanGroupFaultIndicator.

attribute.name: fanGroupFaultIndicator
attribute.description:
The current fault indicator status of the fan group shown by the optical fan group fault indicator on the Support Control Unit (SCU).
Valid values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = Fans connected and no fault exists in this unit. • STEADY_ON = A fan fault exists in this unit. • SLOW_BLINK = A fan in this unit is disconnected.

class.name: ControlPort
class.description:
This MO models a Control Port. It is used to switch on/off external equipment.
Dependencies: Can only exist in the node when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Defines the operational state of the ControlPort.

attribute.name: ControlPortId
attribute.description: The ID of the ControlPort. It matches the number of the physical port and is the value component of the Relative Distinguished Name (RDN).

attribute.name: equipmentName
attribute.description: The external device being controlled.

attribute.name: normallyOpen
attribute.description: The active state of the control port. True = Setting portStatus=On closes the circuit. False = Setting portStatus=On opens the circuit.

attribute.name: portStatus
attribute.description: Controls the current status of the external device connected to the port.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

class.name: BatteryBackup
class.description:
This MO models batteries that can be indirectly controlled by one BFU. No data is obtained from the battery itself.
The functionality represented by this MO will not work until a HwUnit MO of type BFU exists.
Dependencies: Can only exist in the node when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: BatteryBackupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: batteryCurrent
attribute.description: The measured battery current. When the battery is charging, the current is positive. When the battery is discharging, the current is negative.

long.undefinedValue: -9999 indicates no contact with Battery Fuse Unit (BFU).

attribute.name: batteryDisconnectTemp
attribute.description:
The temperature at which the battery is disconnected. Applies to both main and priority loads. The battery is disconnected when batteryTemperature > batteryDisconnectTemp.
Note: Only specified batteries should be set to values > 60, and then only after consulting with Ericsson personnel and the battery manufacturer.

attribute.name: batteryDisconnectTempCeaseOffset
attribute.description: The offset for the disconnect temperature below which the battery will be reconnected. Applies to both main and priority loads. The battery is reconnected when batteryTemperature < batteryDisconnectedTemp - batteryDisconnectTempCeaseOffset.

attribute.name: batteryTemperature
attribute.description: The current temperature reported by the battery temperature sensor installed on the battery.

long.undefinedValue: 999 (no contact with BFU, BFU has no battery or BFU has no temperature sensor)

attribute.name: batteryType
attribute.description: The type of battery to which the installed battery conforms. The type is related to the capabilities of the battery.
attribute.dependencies: batteryType = UNKNOWN is valid only when chargingMode = USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: batteryVoltage
attribute.description:
The measured battery voltage. It is equal to the attribute systemVoltage, PowerSupply MO, when the battery is connected.
0 means the battery is disconnected.

long.undefinedValue: -1 means no contact with the Battery Fuse Unit (BFU)

attribute.name: boostChargeTime
attribute.description: The time in boost charge. Value zero (0) means that boost charging is disabled.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: boostChargeTriggerVoltage
attribute.description: Defines the trigger voltage for boost charge. When the trigger voltage is surpassed during discharge, the consecutive charging is boost charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: chargingMode
attribute.description:
The type of battery charging used. If charging is user-defined, the charging algorithm and parameters must be specified.
If chargingMode = AUTOMATIC, the following attributes are not used: • chargingVoltage • tempCompVoltageSlope • nominalTemp • tempCompMinVoltage • tempCompMaxVoltage • increasedChargeVoltage • boostChargeTime • boostChargeTriggerVoltage • equalizeChargeTime • equalizeChargeCyclicInterval • intermittentChargeConnectVoltage • intermittentChargeConnectTime • intermittentChargeDisconnectTime
attribute.dependencies: If the charging mode is AUTOMATIC, the system charges according to behavior defined in the attribute batteryType.

attribute.name: chargeMaxCurrent
attribute.description: Maximum allowed battery current during charging. The maximum battery current will be limited if the maximum current supported by the BFU is lower than this defined value.

attribute.name: chargingVoltage
attribute.description: The desired battery voltage for charging at 25 degrees Celsius.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is relevant only when attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: equalizeChargeCyclicInterval
attribute.description: The number of days between equalize charging. The cycle is reset at restart.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: equalizeChargeTime
attribute.description: The time in equalize charge. Value zero (0) means that equalize charging is disabled. To enable equalize charging, the value must be set to a number other than zero (0).
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: increasedChargeVoltage
attribute.description: The charge voltage used at boost charging and equalize charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: intermittentChargeConnectTime
attribute.description: Defines the period following disconnection after which the battery is reconnected. Used in intermittent charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: intermittentChargeConnectVoltage
attribute.description: Defines the minimum battery voltage level allowed for a disconnected battery. When minimum level is reached, the battery is reconnected. Used in intermittent charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: intermittentChargeDisconnectTime
attribute.description: Defines the time until the batteries are disconnected (during this time the batteries are connected). Value zero (0) means that intermittent charging is not enabled.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: nominalTemp
attribute.description: Nominal temperature for temperature compensated charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: tempCompMaxVoltage
attribute.description: The maximum voltage allowed for temperature compensated charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: tempCompMinVoltage
attribute.description: The minimum voltage allowed for temperature compensated charging.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: tempCompVoltageSlope
attribute.description: A compensation factor that expresses the amount of voltage changes caused by temperature. Used in temperature compensated charging. Higher temperature gives a lower charging voltage. Fixed battery charging is achieved by assigning this attribute the value zero. Example: The default value -96 = -0.096 V per 1 degree Celsius, gives that a 10 degree temperature increase changes the voltage from e.g. -50.000 V to -49.040 V
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if attribute chargingMode in MO BatteryBackup has the value USER_DEFINED.

attribute.name: sharedBattery
attribute.description: Indicates if the RBS shares a battery with another RBS or other power consumer on the site. The setting of this attributes has a great impact on the system behavior.
attribute.dependencies: If sharedBattery is set to True a backup time test will be used as battery test. A battery capacity test cannot be executed if shared batteries are used.

attribute.name: batteryInstallationDate
attribute.description: The date when the batteries in the battery backup of the RBS were installed and taken into service. Format: YYYYMMDD.
attribute.dependencies: The date must not be a future date. Changing this attribute will cause the system to restart battery capacity test calculations and recalculate attribute referenceBatteryCapacity.

attribute.name: testMode
attribute.description: The mode of the battery test.
attribute.dependencies: The following attributes are only relevant if testMode is set to CONFIGURED: testStartDay, testStartTime, testStartMonths and minimumStateOfHealth.

attribute.name: testStartDay
attribute.description: The day of month for periodic battery tests.
attribute.dependencies: The attribute is relevant only when testMode has the value CONFIGURED. Combination of testStartDay and testStartMonths must be a valid date.

attribute.name: testStartTime
attribute.description: The time of day to start periodic battery tests. Format: HH:MM, 24-hour format.
attribute.dependencies: The attribute is only relevant if testMode has the value CONFIGURED.

attribute.name: testStartMonths
attribute.description: The months in which periodic battery tests are performed. A battery test is performed in the months listed in the parameter. A month may be listed only once in the parameter. Default value = MARCH, SEPTEMBER.
attribute.dependencies: The attribute is only relevant if attribute testMode has the value CONFIGURED.

attribute.name: minimumStateOfHealth
attribute.description: The minimum requirement for the State-of-Health of a battery when conducting a battery capacity test. An alarm is raised if State-Of-Health is lower than minimumStateOfHealth. State-of-Health is defined as estimated battery capacity divided by referenceBatteryCapacity * 100.
attribute.dependencies: The attribute is only relevant if sharedBattery is set to false.

attribute.name: referenceBatteryCapacity
attribute.description: The calculated reference battery capacity. This value is calculated at the first battery capacity test (manual or periodic) or when a significantly higher capacity is detected. The attribute is used in battery capacity tests.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute has a defined value only if sharedBattery is set to False and at least one battery capacity test has been conducted. This attribute will be recalculated at the first battery capacity test after the attribute batteryInstallationDate has been changed.

attribute.name: minimumBackupTime
attribute.description: The minimum requirement for backup time for the installed batteries when conducting a battery backup time test. An alarm is raised if measured backup time is shorter than minimumBackupTime.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is only relevant if sharedBattery is set to true.

attribute.name: nextScheduledTestDate
attribute.description: Date of next scheduled periodic battery test. Format: "YYYYMMDD".
attribute.dependencies: The value is undefined if testMode has the value DISABLED.

attribute.name: batteryTestIsRunning
attribute.description: State whether a battery test is running or not. Possible values: - true: A battery test cycle has been started - false: Either the battery test is disabled or there is not any ongoing battery test.

action.name: startEqualizeCharging
action.description: Starts equalize charging.

action.name: stopEqualizeCharging
action.description: Stops equalize charging.

action.name: startBatteryTest
action.description: Starts an on demand battery capacity test or battery backup time test. A battery capacity test will go into testState PENDING if the batteries are not fully charged and in parameter forced is set to False. The test will in this case be initiated when the batteries are fully charged, if this occurs within 24 h.

parameter.name: forced
parameter.description: Specifies if forced initiation should be used or not. Forced initiation means that a number of pre-conditions are overridden and that the test can be started even if these pre-conditions are not fulfilled. Overridden pre-conditions: - batteries are considered fully charged - system is not running on batteries in case of battery time test No alarms are raised as a result of the battery test if parameter forced is set to true. Manual evaluation of the test result is needed. Dependencies: Attribute referenceBatteryCapacity is not updated as a result of the battery test if parameter forced is set to true.

action.dependencies: A battery capacity test will be executed if attribute sharedBattery is set to False and if attribute mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect is -43 V or lower. Otherwise a backup time test will be executed.
action.disturbances: The RBS is powered from the batteries during the test. This battery discharge will make the RBS more sensitive to mains power failure during the test. Repeated battery discharge will cause aging of the batteries.

action.name: stopBatteryTest
action.description: Stops an ongoing battery capacity test or battery backup time test that was started via action startBatteryTest.

action.name: readBatteryTestStatus
action.description: Action for reading out the status of an ongoing battery test (testState is IN_PROGRESS or PENDING). Valid for on demand test and periodic test. Valid for battery capacity and backup time tests. Updated values can be retrieved by issuing this action regularly during a test. Out parameter values are not stored persistently and can therefore only be read during a test. All out parameter values, except for testState, are undefined in testState PENDING

action.name: readBatteryTestResult
action.description: Action for reading out the result of a finished battery test. Output data is stored persistently. This means that the result can always be read for the last finished on demand test and periodic test separately. The action is valid for battery capacity and backup time tests.

parameter.name: testType
parameter.description: Type of battery test to read result for.

class.name: PowerDistribution
class.description:
This MO represents the logical resource providing configuration and supervision support for the cabinet power distribution capabilities. Examples include configuration of alarm levels and supervision of input voltage.
The functionality represented by this MO will not work until a HwUnit MO of type PDU exist.
Dependencies: Can only exist in the node when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: PowerDistributionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect
attribute.description: The voltage at which the Battery Fuse Unit (BFU) must disconnect the main load. The main load is disconnected when systemVoltage is below mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect Example: The default value -430 = -43.0 V, gives that the main load is disconnected if systemVoltage is e.g. -42.9 V.
attribute.dependencies: priorityLoadUndervoltageDisconnect - mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect >= 0.2 V. mainLoadUnderVoltageDisconnect > systemUndervoltageAlarmLevel If mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect < -43.0 V a battery backup time test will be executed instead of a battery capacity test

attribute.name: priorityLoadUndervoltageDisconnect
attribute.description: The voltage at which the Battery Fuse Unit (BFU) must disconnect the Priority Load. The primary load is disconnected when systemVoltage is below priorityLoadUndervoltageDisconnect. Example: The default value -425 = -42.5 V, gives that the priority load is disconnected if systemVoltage is e.g. -42.4 V.
attribute.dependencies: priorityLoadUndervoltageDisconnect - mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnect >= 0.2 V

attribute.name: undervoltageDisconnectCeaseOffset
attribute.description:
The offset for the disconnected voltage above which the Battery Fuse Unit (BFU) reconnects the load. Applies to both main and priority load. The main load is reconnected when system voltage is above (mainLoadUndervoltageDisconect - undervoltageDisconnectCeaseOffset).
systemVoltage = batteryVoltage when the system is running on battery supply.
Example: The default values gives a main load undervoltage reconnection at -430 – 40 = -470 (-47.0 V DC), the load is reconnected if systemVoltage is e.g. -47.1 V.
Note: The batteries are reconnected when systemVoltage is above (mainLoadUndervoltageDisconnected -underVoltageDisconnectCeaseOffset) and batteryVoltage is above -39.0V

class.name: PowerSupply
class.description:
This MO represents the logical resource providing configuration and supervision support for the cabinet power supply. Examples include configuration of charging algorithms and supervision levels and switching functions on/off etc.
Dependencies: Can only exist in the node when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: PowerSupplyId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: nominalVoltage
attribute.description: The desired system voltage.
attribute.dependencies: Superseded by chargingVoltage when MO BatteryBackup is created

attribute.name: systemOvervoltageAlarmCeaseOffset
attribute.description: The offset for the system over voltage level below which the system over voltage alarm is ceased. The alarm cease condition is true when systemVoltage is below SystemOvervoltageAlarmLevel + SystemOvervoltageAlarmCeaseOffset. Example: The default values -575 + 5 = -570 (-57.0 V) gives an alarm cease if systemVoltage is e.g. -56.9 V

attribute.name: systemOvervoltageAlarmLevel
attribute.description: Alarm level for system over voltage. The alarm active condition is true when systemVoltage is above SystemOvervoltageAlarmLevel Example: The default value -575 (-57.5 V) gives an alarm if systemVoltage is e.g. -57.6 V

attribute.name: systemUndervoltageAlarmCeaseOffset
attribute.description: The offset for the system under voltage level above which the system undervoltage alarm ceases. The alarm cease condition is true when systemVoltage is above SystemUndervoltageAlarmLevel - SystemUndervoltageAlarmCeaseOffset. Example: The default values -440 - 30 = -470 (-47.0 V) gives an alarm cease if systemVoltage is e.g. -47.1 V

attribute.name: systemUndervoltageAlarmLevel
attribute.description: Alarm level for system undervoltage. The alarm is raised when systemVoltage is lower than SystemUndervoltageAlarmLevel. Example: The default value -440 (-44.0 V) gives an alarm if systemVoltage is e.g. -43.9 V
attribute.dependencies: systemUndervoltageAlarmLevel < mainLoadUnderVoltageDisconnect

attribute.name: systemVoltage
attribute.description: The measured system voltage. It is equal to the attribute batteryVoltage, MO BatteryBackup, when the battery is connected.

long.undefinedValue: -1 (no connection with neither PDU, BFU nor PSU)

class.name: ExternalNode
class.description: This MO represents an external node sharing certain resources (such as climate, power and external alarm hardware) with this node and possibly other external nodes. With node is understood a node with a ManagedElement MO as top MO. The number of MO ExternalNode must match the actual number of external nodes if the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true. In this case the MO is used for configuration purposes and attribute informationOnly has the value false. MO ExternalNode is optional to create if attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to false. In this case the MO is used only for information purposes and attribute informationOnly has the value true. The communication between the nodes is established via configuration of this MO if supportSystemControl in MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true in this node.
class.dependencies: Can only have child MO EcPort when the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction is set to true.

attribute.name: ExternalNodeId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: logicalName
attribute.description: Reflects the value of attribute logicalName on MO ManagedElement in the external node. The undefined value, an empty string, is used for a node that has no configured logicalName. The value NOT AVAILABLE is used when information is currently unavailable from the external node.

attribute.name: supportSystemControl
attribute.description: Reflects the value of the attribute supportSystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction in the external node. The value NOT_AVAILABLE is used if information is currently unavailable from the external node.

attribute.name: fullDistinguishedName
attribute.description: Reflects the Full Distinguished Name (FDN) of MO ManagedElement in the external node. The undefined value, an empty string, is used for a node that has no configured Full Distinguished Name, such as a GSM node. The value "NOT AVAILABLE" is used if information is currently unavailable from the external node.

attribute.name: radioAccessTechnology
attribute.description: Reflects the radio access technology supported by the external node. The value NOT_AVAILABLE is used if information is currently unavailable from the external node.

attribute.name: informationOnly
attribute.description:
Indicates if the MO data is only for informational purposes or for configuration purposes.
When set to true, the MO contains read-only data about the external nodes. The number of MO ExternalNode does not have to match the actual number of external nodes. The MO attributes are populated with data if a corresponding external node exists.
When set to false, the MO contains configuration data such as MO EcPort. The MO ExternalNode number must match the actual number of external nodes.
attribute.dependencies: The attribute value must be false if attribute supportsystemControl on MO EquipmentSupportFunction has the value true and vice versa.

class.name: EcPort
class.description: This MO represents one port in a HwUnit MO or ExternalNode MO where the Enclosure Control Bus (ECB) is connected.

attribute.name: EcPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: hubPosition
attribute.description: The hub port that the external node or HW unit is connected to, used for addressing purposes. Must be set for HwUnit types CBU, DU, BFU, PSU, PDU and SUP. In case of SUP, only in configurations with two SUPs, and then only for the second SUP (with ID SUP-2). Not applicable for other HwUnit types. There are restrictions per RBS type on which hub ports that can be used for connection of specific HwUnit types. Valid values: • A0-A8, B0-B8: SHU is used as hub. • A-E, X, Y: SCU/SUP is used as hub. • "": used when hub position is not applicable and EC-bus is used for communication. Value NA is also possible to use in this case. • AUX NA: Used when hub position is not applicable and AUX-bus is used for communication. The overlay mapping is A IN = A0, B IN = B0.

attribute.name: cascadingOrder
attribute.description: The cascading order when there are multiple HUBs or units connected in a cascade chain. The first unit in a cascade chain has value 1. If the EC-bus isn’t connected in cascade then the value shall be set to 0 (not applicable).

class.name: SupportSystemConfiguration
class.description: This MO is used to configure the support system in the RBS cabinet.

attribute.name: SupportSystemConfigurationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

action.name: configureSupportSystem
action.description: Configures the support system.

parameter.name: supportSystemXmlFile
parameter.description: Full path and name of Site Equipment XML file.

class.name: EquipmentSupportFunction
class.description: This MO represents the logical functions needed for other equipment to function properly. These are functions like Power Supply and Climate.

attribute.name: supportSystemControl
attribute.description: Indicates if the node controls and supervises the climate, power, and external alarm hardware in the cabinet. Only one node in the cabinet can control and supervise climate and power.

attribute.name: EquipmentSupportFunctionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: logicalName
attribute.description: This is a mirrored value of the attribute logicalName, MO ManagedElement.

attribute.name: fullDistinguishedName
attribute.description: The Full Distinguished Name of the MO ManagedElement in this node.

attribute.name: radioAccessTechnology
attribute.description: The radio access technology this node supports.

attribute.name: productNameME
attribute.description: The attribute reflects the value of attribute productName on MO ManagedElement in the node.

class.name: EFuse
class.description:
This MO models an electrical fuse related to power distribution.
Dependencies: Can only exist when MO HwUnit is of type PDU.

attribute.name: eFuseIndicator
attribute.description:
The operational status of the e-fuse. The indicator is physically located on the corresponding Power Distribution Unit (PDU).
Valid values: • NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = The power is not distributed. • STEADY_ON = Power is distributed from the e-fuse port. • SLOW_BLINK = E-fuse tripped.

attribute.name: EFuseId
attribute.description: The ID of the electrical fuse that matches the number on the physical e-fuse and provides the value component of the RDN.

class.name: RfPort
class.description: This MO represents port on the RU/RRU of various type depending on MOid. It represents an antenna feeder port on the RU/RRU when it has the MOid; A, B C, etc... It represents a cross connection port on the RU/RRU when it has the MOid; RXA_IO or RXB_IO. It represents a RET-port on the RRU if it has the MOid; R.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: RfPortId
attribute.description: This is the name of the antenna port connector on the radio unit.
attribute.dependencies: Must be unique for RfPort MOs under the same DeviceGroup.

attribute.name: nodeUniqueRfPortId
attribute.description: Internal identifier for the RfPort to ease error traceability.

attribute.name: vswrSupervisionActive
attribute.description: Indicates if supervision of Voltage Standing Wave Ratio (VSWR) is enabled for the branch of this port on the Radio Unit. VSWR supervision is possible on a TX branch only.

attribute.name: maxCurrent
attribute.description: Indicates the upper current limit over which a failure should be reported for this branch.

attribute.name: minCurrent
attribute.description: Indicates the lower current limit below which a failure should be reported for the branch.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a sequence of two references, one to the RfBranch MO and another to either the AntennaNearUnit MO or the ExternalTma MO reserving this MO instance.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: vswrSupervisionSensitivity
attribute.description:
The sensitivity of Voltage Standing Wave Ratio (VSWR) supervision.
A high value enables detection of a low reflected power (high return loss). A low value requires a high reflected power (low return loss) to cause an alarm.
VSWR = (1+10^(-RL/20))/(1-10^(-RL/20))
Where RL is Return Loss
The relation between the sensitivity and return loss on the RU is defined as:
RL = 6 + vswrSupervisionSensitivity [%]*0.08 dB
This gives VSWR=1.5 for 100% sensitivity and VSWR=3 for 1% sensitivity.

class.name: AntennaCtrlDevice
class.description: This MO models an antenna system control device located inside a replacable unit

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: hardwareVersion
attribute.description: The hardware version of the antenna control device.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13A. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: productNumber
attribute.description: Uniquely Identifies the model of the included Antenna System Control Unit

attribute.name: selfTestStatus
attribute.description:
This attribute indicates the status of ongoing selfTest operation. In case no selfTest has been performed since last DU restart it shows state UNKNOWN.
NOTE: The selfTestStatus is not used to verify or confirm if a selfTest has been performed or not.

attribute.name: serialNumber
attribute.description: Unique number for each unit listing product and manufacturing details.

attribute.name: softwareVersion
attribute.description: The software version of the antenna control device.

attribute.name: AntennaCtrlDeviceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN

action.name: downloadSoftware
action.description: This action fetches the Antenna Near Unit SW package from a file server and downloads the firmware file on the antenna control device. The antenna control device will run on the new firmware when the action is completed.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: The ip-address or hostname of the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the antenna control device.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The file path to the software to be downloaded to the antenna control device.

parameter.name: userName
parameter.description: The user name to the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the antenna control device.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the antenna control device.

action.disturbances: The Antenna System Control Unit will be restarted to ensure it to run in the new SW. Doing this might affect traffic.

action.name: selfTest
action.description: This action will execute an implementation-specific test procedure of the antenna control device's own performance (i.e. of physical and processor functions)
action.disturbances: The action may affect traffic.

action.name: restartUnit
action.description: This action restarts the antenna control device part of the replacable unit.
action.disturbances: The action may affect traffic.

class.name: AntennaPath
class.description: This MO is used to model the RF path from the Radio Unit to the air interface. RF path caracteristics are known by the system.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: AntennaPathId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SectorEquipmentFunction MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: ExtTmaConnectorId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ulTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Uplink traffic delay in the low noise amplifier branch associated with this connector.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the SectorEquipmentFunction.

attribute.name: dlTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Downlink traffic delay in the low noise amplifier branch associated with this connector.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the SectorEquipmentFunction.

attribute.name: ulGain
attribute.description: Uplink gain in the low noise amplifier branch associated with this connector.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the SectorEquipmentFunction.

attribute.name: dlAttenuation
attribute.description: Downlink attenuation in the low noise amplifier branch associated with this connector.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the SectorEquipmentFunction.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Reference to the RfBranch MO that is connected to this port of the External TMA unit.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the SectorEquipmentFunction.

class.name: RfBranch
class.description: This MO represents the connection from an antenna feeder port on the RU to one antenna feeder connector on one or several antenna units. The MO represents all equipment between the radio and the antenna which isn't modelled by any other MO. That includes feeder, filters and non-supervised, non-controlled TMA

attribute.name: RfBranchId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
To provision the RfBranch not to be used for Tx transmission, even though it might be Tx-capable, the RfBranchId value should follow the format: "any_string"_NO_TX

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: dlAttenuation
attribute.description: Downlink attenuation between the connector on the Radio Unit (RU)/Remote Radio Unit (RRU) and the connector on the antenna unit. The attenuation includes feeder, filters, and non-supervised, uncontrolled Tower Mounted Amplifiers (TMAs). The sequence contains 15 entries and each entry represents one 5-MHz interval. The first entry represents the attenuation value of the lowest frequency interval in the frequency band, and so on. The number of intervals depends on the frequency band. For information on the different frequency bands, refer to 3GPP TS 36.104. The value range for each entry is -500 to -2, -1, 0-500 (-50 to 50 dB). Unused entries are set to -1.

attribute.name: ulAttenuation
attribute.description: Uplink attenuation between the connector on the Radio Unit (RU)/Remote Radio Unit (RRU) and the connector on the antenna unit. The attenuation includes feeder, filters, and non-supervised, uncontrolled Tower Mounted Amplifiers (TMAs). The sequence contains 15 entries and each entry represents one 5-MHz interval. The first entry represents the attenuation value of the lowest frequency interval in the frequency band, and so on. The number of intervals depends on the frequency band. For information on the different frequency bands, refer to 3GPP TS 36.104. The value range for each entry is -500 to -2, -1, 0-500 (-50 to 50 dB). Unused entries are set to -1.

attribute.name: dlTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Downlink traffic delay between the connector on the Radio Unit (RU)/Remote Radio Unit (RRU) and the connector on the antenna unit. The delay includes feeder, filter, and non-supervised, uncontrolled Tower Mounted Amplifiers (TMAs). The sequence contains 15 entries and each entry represents one 5-MHz interval. The first entry represents the attenuation value of the lowest frequency interval in the frequency band, and so on. The number of intervals used depends on the frequency band. For information on the different frequency bands, refer to 3GPP TS 36.104. The value range for each entry is 0-800000 (0-800000 ns). Unused entries are set to -1. NOTE: The range supported by the actual Radio Unit may be smaller and must be considered when configuring the antenna system.

attribute.name: ulTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Uplink traffic delay between the connector on the Radio Unit (RU)/Remote Radio Unit (RRU) and the connector on the antenna unit. The delay includes feeder, filter, and non-supervised, uncontrolled Tower Mounted Amplifiers (TMAs). The sequence contains 15 entries and each entry represents one 5-MHz interval. The first entry represents the attenuation value of the lowest frequency interval in the frequency band, and so on. The number of intervals used depends on the frequency band. For information on the different frequency bands, refer to 3GPP TS 36.104. The value range for each entry is 0-800000 (0-800000 ns). Unused entries are set to -1. NOTE: The range supported by individual radio units may be smaller and must be considered when configuring the antenna system.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SectorEquipmentFunction MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: tmaRef
attribute.description: Reference to a possible TMA that is connected to this RfBranch.

attribute.name: rfPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to the RfPort MO that represents the physical antenna feeder connector on the Radio Unit (RU)/Remote Radio Unit (RRU), to which this RfBranch is connected.

attribute.name: auPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to the AuPort MO that represents the physical antenna feeder connector on the antenna unit, to which this RfBranch is connected.

class.name: AntennaNearUnit
class.description: This MO represents a hardware unit installed in the antenna system that can be controlled and supervised by the system.

attribute.name: AntennaNearUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: uniqueId
attribute.description:
Subset of the unique identifier of the Antenna Near Unit. It is used to support advanced antenna system configurations, such as cascaded RETs. Leave empty when the units are not cascaded.
The value stated is a subset of the uniqueID(concatenation of the vendor code and the antenna near unit serial number) which must contain enough significant characters/digits to be unique among the antenna near units (with iuantDeviceType single antenna RET or multiple antenna RET) connected to the RfPort. See also 3GPP 25.462.
Some vendors use specific modifications of the serial number on the device label to define the unique ID. Contact the vendor of the antenna near unit (RET) to obtain the mapping between the serial number taken from the label and the unique ID.

attribute.name: anuType
attribute.description: Indicates if the antenna near unit is an IUANT or an Ericsson proprietary antenna unit.
attribute.dependencies: If IUANT is set then the attribute iuantDeviceType needs to be set to a value specified in section 4.7 in 3GPP 25.462 as well.

attribute.name: serialNumber
attribute.description: Unique number for each unit listing product and manufacturing details.

attribute.name: productNumber
attribute.description: Uniquely Identifies the model of Antenna Near Unit

attribute.name: softwareVersion
attribute.description: The software version of the antenna near unit.

attribute.name: hardwareVersion
attribute.description: The hardware version of the antenna near unit.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: rfPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to an instance of an RfPort from which this antenna near unit is controlled and supplied with power.

attribute.name: iuantDeviceType
attribute.description:
Type of IUANT-compliant antenna line device.
Takes its value from section 4.7 of 3GPP TS 25.462 (after conversion from hex to decimal):
- 1 indicates single-antenna Remote Electrical Tilt (RET) device - 2 indicates tower mounted amplifier - 17 indicates multi-antenna RET device
NOTE: 3GPP TS 25.462 defines device types by providing hexadecimal codes. The code must be converted to decimal in order to be used. If multi-Antenna RET Device is indicated as 0x11HEX in 3GPP TS 25.462, the decimal equivalent 17 must be used here.

attribute.name: onUnitUniqueId
attribute.description:
The unique ID reported by the physical antenna near unit. The first two characters of the ID are the vendor code.
The value is extracted from the response message sent by the antenna near unit during connection establishment. 3GPP TS 25.462 specifies the procedure in detail.

attribute.name: selfTestStatus
attribute.description:
This attribute indicates the status of ongoing selfTest operation. In case no selfTest has been performed since last DU restart it shows state UNKNOWN.
NOTE: The selfTestStatus is not used to verify or confirm if a selfTest has been performed or not.

action.name: restartUnit
action.description: Restarts the Antenna Near Unit.
action.disturbances: The action may affect traffic.

action.name: downloadSoftware
action.description: This action fetches the antenna near unit SW package from a file server and downloads the firmware file on the Antenna Near Unit. The Antenna Near Unit will run on the new firmware when the action is completed.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: The ip-address or hostname of the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the Antenna Near Unit.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The file path to the software to be downloaded to the Antenna Near Unit.

parameter.name: userName
parameter.description: The user name to the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the Antenna Near Unit.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to the FTP-server storing the software to be downloaded to the Antenna Near Unit.

action.disturbances: The Antenna System Control Unit will be restarted to ensure it to run in the new SW. Doing this might affect traffic.

action.name: selfTest
action.description: The Antenna Near Unit will execute an implementation-specific test procedure of its own performance (i.e. of physical and processor functions)
action.disturbances: The action may affect traffic.

action.name: readUserData
action.description:
The ANU answers with user-specific data stored in the non-volatile memory reserved for such purpose.
Transaction Required: Yes

parameter.name: memory_offset
parameter.description: The memory offset to calculate the relative memory address to point the user data area where the required information is stored in (2 octets – UnsignedInteger)

parameter.name: numberOfOctetsToRead
parameter.description: The number of octets to be read from that relative memory address. It must be lesser or equal than 70 (1 octet – UnsignedInteger ) (MaxDataTransmitLength - 1)

action.name: writeUserData
action.description: The ANU shall store user data in non-volatile memory. The data is stored in the user data area using the relative memory address offset given in the initiating message and starting with zero.

parameter.name: memory_offset
parameter.description: The memory offset to calculate the relative memory address to point the user data area where the required information will be stored in (2 octets – UnsignedInteger)

parameter.name: numberOfOctetsToWrite
parameter.description: The number of octets to be written starting on that relative memory address. It must be lesser or equal than 68 (MaxDataReceiveLength-3) (1 octet - UnsignedInteger)

parameter.name: userDataW
parameter.description: numerOfOctetsToWrite octets containing User Specific data to be written in the non-volatile memory area of the ANU.

action.disturbances: The action may affect traffic.

class.name: ExternalTMA
class.description: This MO represents an External TMA that cannot be controlled but supervised (fault handling) and/or DC-power supplied through the antenna feeder.

attribute.name: ExternalTMAId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Indicates the operational state of the ExternalTma.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: powerSupervisionSupported
attribute.description: Indicates if the external Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) unit can report problems by power-toggling on the feeder.

attribute.name: tmaBypassSupported
attribute.description: Indicates if the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) supports bypass mode when low noise amplifier failure occurs.
attribute.takesEffect: At next unlock of the object.

attribute.name: rfPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to an instance of an RfPort from which this externalTma is controlled and supplied with power.

class.name: RetSubUnit
class.description: This MO represents the device, either a single RET or a subunit of the multi RET providing for remote electrical tilting of the antenna unit where it is mounted.

attribute.name: RetSubUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: electricalAntennaTilt
attribute.description: The electrically-controlled tilt of the maximum of the antenna's main beam with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis (see 3GPP TS 25.466). It is a signed value. Positive value indicates downtilt, and negative value indicates uptilt.
attribute.dependencies: RetSubunit.minTilt <= RetSubunit.electricalAntennaTilt <= RetSubunit.maxTilt AND AntennaSubunit.minTotalTilt <= (AntennaSubunit.installedMechanicalTilt + RetSubunit.electricalAntennaTilt ) <= AntennaSubnit.maxTotalTilt Throws exception AttributeValueOutOfRangeException
attribute.disturbances: Change may affect traffic as the antenna beam is moving.

attribute.name: minTilt
attribute.description:
Minimum electrical tilt supported by the RET subunit. The electrical tilt is defined as the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis. It is a signed value. Positive value indicates downtilt, and negative value indicates uptilt.
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: maxTilt
attribute.description:
Maximum electrical tilt supported by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET) subunit. The electrical tilt is defined as the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt.
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaSerialNumber
attribute.description: Unique hardware identifier of the antenna where the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET) subunit operates. This parameter is part of IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaModelNumber
attribute.description: Vendor-specific antenna model identifier. This parameter is part of IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaBearing
attribute.description: Antenna bearing on the antenna subunit where the RetSubunit is installed. Antenna bearing is expressed as bearing value x 10. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain for each of four operating bands, starting with the lowest value. The gain value corresponding to each band is transmitted within one octet. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Replaced by iuantAntennaOperatingGain.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Refers to the AntennaSubunit MO that has the tilt controlled by this RetSubunit.

attribute.name: subunitNumber
attribute.description: Subunit identifier carried on L7 messages in which subunits are pointed with the help of application level identifiers.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingBand
attribute.description: Operating band used by the antenna subunit connected to this RetSubunit. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification and has no operational impact. (For details on coding, see table B.2 of Annex B on 3GPP TS 25.466)

attribute.name: calibrationStatus
attribute.description:
This attribute indicates the status of ongoing calibration operation. In case no calibration has been performed since last DU restart it shows state UNKNOWN.
NOTE: The calibrationStatus is not used to verify or confirm if RET is calibrated or not. The RET is calibrated unless an alarm indicates otherwise.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain for each of four operating bands, starting with the lowest value. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

action.name: sendAntennaConfigurationFile
action.description:
The ANU stores vendor and antenna specific configuration data for the relationship between the movement of the drive system and the beam tilt position of the addressed antenna.
Transaction Required: Yes

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: The ip-address or hostname of the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The file path to the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: userName
parameter.description: The user name to the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

action.name: forceCalibration
action.description:
Exercises the antenna drive unit over its entire range of travel to ensure fault-free operation and synchronize the measured and actual beam tilt of the antenna
Transaction Required: No
action.disturbances: This is a Time Consuming Procedure (TCP) that cannot be executed simultaneously with another TCP, while it can be executed simultaneously with a maximum of one EP. It may affect traffic.

class.name: TmaSubUnit
class.description: This MO represents the TMA SubUnit providing low noise amplification of the uplink received by the reserving branch.

attribute.name: TmaSubUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ulGain
attribute.description: Internal uplink gain of the TMA Subunit as specified in 3GPP TS 25.466

attribute.name: dlTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Internal traffic delay for the downlink.

attribute.name: ulTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Internal traffic delay for the uplink.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Refers to the instance of the RfBranch MO to which this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) Subunit is connected.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaSerialNumber
attribute.description: Unique hardware identifier for the antenna where the antenna near unit is installed. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaModelNumber
attribute.description: Vendor-specific antenna model identifier. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingBand
attribute.description: Operating band used by the Antenna Subunit connected to this TmaSubunit. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (for details on coding see table B.2 of Annex B on 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain on the central frequency (resolution of 5MHz) of the band transmitted on the antenna port where this subunit is installed. The attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaInstalledMechanicalTilt
attribute.description: Antenna tilt fixed on the installation, defined as the inclination of the antenna element axis with respect to the vertical plane. It is a signed value. A positive value indicates downtilt, and a negative value indicates uptilt. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaBearing
attribute.description: Antenna bearing expressed as bearing value x 10. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqTx
attribute.description: Downlink frequency band across this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) SubUnit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path (see 3GPP TS 25.466).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeTx.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRx
attribute.description: Uplink frequency band across this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) SubUnit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum for the TMA transmission path (see 3GPP TS 25.466).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeRx.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitMinGain
attribute.description: Minimum gain available on this TMA Subunit.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitMaxGain
attribute.description: Maximum gain available on this TMA Subunit.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitGainRes
attribute.description: Gain resolution on the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit expressed in gain value [dB] times 4 (see 3GPP TS 25.466).

attribute.name: subunitNumber
attribute.description: Subunit identifier carried on L7 messages. While an antenna near unit is identified by one High-Level Data Link Control (HDLC) address (L2), subunits are identified by application level (L7) identifiers.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: dlAttenuation
attribute.description: Internal attenuation in downlink of the TMA Subunit

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeTx
attribute.description:
Downlink frequency band across the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path .
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeRx
attribute.description:
Uplink frequency band across the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path.
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain for each of four operating bands, starting with the lowest value. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

class.name: AntennaSubunit
class.description: This MO groups the antenna elements that, because of being controlled by the same RET radiate with the same tilt angle.

attribute.name: AntennaSubunitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: totalTilt
attribute.description:
Total antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET). Total tilt is defined as the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane.
Tilt is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt, found by the following equation:
totalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt+RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, this value does not account for the inclination that the antenna beam may have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: minTotalTilt
attribute.description:
The minimum antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET) described by the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt. The limitation on total tilt is found by the following equation:
TotalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt + RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, the total tilt value does not necessarily account for the inclination that the antenna beam might have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: maxTotalTilt
attribute.description:
The maximum antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET), described by the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt. It sets a limitation on total tilt which is given by:
TotalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt + RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, this value does not account for the inclination that the antenna beam might have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: retSubunitRef
attribute.description: Reference to the RetSubunit controlling the tilt of this AntennaSubunit.

attribute.name: azimuthHalfPowerBeamwidth
attribute.description: Specifies the azimuth half power beamwidth for the antenna.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsAmp
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight amplitudes for custom common channel beamforming weights. At least one of the eight amplitudes have to be non-zero for the custom beamforming weights to take effect. NOTE: Actual value = Set value / 100
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by customComChBeamfrmWtsAmplitude. Has no functional behavior.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsPhase
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight phases for custom common channel beamforming weights.

attribute.name: commonChBeamfrmPortMap
attribute.description: This parameter selects between co-polarized and cross-polarized beamforming antenna port mapping. This parameter has no effect if azimuthHalfPowerBeamwidth is set to 65. In that case, "cross-polarized" antenna port mapping will be used.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsAmplitude
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight amplitudes for custom common channel beamforming weights. At least one of the eight amplitudes have to be non-zero for the custom beamforming weights to take effect. NOTE: Actual value = Set value / 100

class.name: AntennaUnit
class.description: This MO represents an antenna unit that contains several antenna subunits installed with a common mechanical tilt.

attribute.name: AntennaUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: mechanicalAntennaTilt
attribute.description: The fixed antenna tilt of the installation, defined as the inclination of the antenna element axis with respect to the vertical plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt.

class.name: AntennaUnitGroup
class.description: This MO is a container of references to the antenna and antenna near products (RET/TMA) serving a Sector.

attribute.name: AntennaUnitGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SectorEquipmentFunction MO instance that reserves this MO instance.
attribute.dependencies: The MO may not be deleted if it is reserved.

class.name: AuPort
class.description: This MO represents an antenna feeder port on the Antenna Unit where the antenna branch is connected.

attribute.name: AuPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the RfBranch MO that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: RicmDeviceSet
class.description:
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the grand-parent AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit is created. For the MO to be correctly configured the AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit must refer to a proper PiuType.
This MO models a Radio Interface Connection device set.

attribute.name: RicmDeviceSetId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage of a device group:
• ACTIVE • BUSY • IDLE

class.name: RiPort
class.description:
This MO represents a port on the DU or the Radio where the Radio Interface (CPRI and HSSL possibly in case of XMU) cable is connected. It is used to connect a Radio to a DU or to another Radio.
When the RiPort is a child of PlugInUnit (i.e. the DU), the valid RDN values are A, B, C, D, E and F. When it is a child of AuxPlugInUnit representing a radio, the valid RDN values are DATA_1 and DATA_2. When it is a child of AuxPlugInUnit representing an XMU, the valid RDN values are B1, B2, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, and D6.
The RiPort on each unit must refer to each other to make the configuration of the radio interface connection complete.

attribute.name: RiPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: remoteRiPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to the RiPort-object on the remote unit to which this unit is connected.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: SrioTestPort
class.description: This MO presents a sRIO test port on DU. It is used to connect to the UE simulator UcTool.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Defines the operational state.

attribute.name: portNr
attribute.description:
Port to open
Disturbance: Requires a node restart to take affect

attribute.name: SrioTestPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: OptionalFeatureLicense
class.description: Each instance of this feature MO class represent an optional feature.

attribute.name: OptionalFeatureLicenseId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: markedForDeletion
attribute.description: A timestamp indicating the garbage collection time for the MO instance. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

attribute.name: serviceState
attribute.description: Indicates whether the feature is operable or inoperable, and whether the feature is providing service.

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the license, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: keyId
attribute.description: The license key ID for the feature.

attribute.name: featureState
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the licensed feature. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the feature. Please refer to feature CPI document for details on steps needed to make feature functionality available.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: CapacityFeatureLicense
class.description: Each instance of this capacity MO class represent a capacity license.

attribute.name: CapacityFeatureLicenseId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: gracePeriodResetThreshold
attribute.description: Configures how many percent the licensed value must be increased before grace period is activated again.

attribute.name: gracePeriodActivationThreshold
attribute.description: Shows how much accumulated overshoot (% over 24 hours of the current licensed capacity) is allowed before Grace Period is activated.

attribute.name: gracePeriodLength
attribute.description: The length of grace period i.e. the number of days that grace period is active

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the license, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: capacityType
attribute.description: Defines the type for the capacity license.

attribute.name: gracePeriod
attribute.description: Shows information about grace period

attribute.name: licensedCapacity
attribute.description: Defines the node licensed capacity as defined in the License Key File.

attribute.name: keyId
attribute.description: The license key ID for the capacity license.

attribute.name: currentCapacityLimit
attribute.description: Indicates the current capacity limit applied in the node. noLimit = true is shown when emergency state or grace period is activated.

attribute.name: capacityUnit
attribute.description: Defines the unit for licensed capacity.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: markedForDeletion
attribute.description: A timestamp indicating the garbage collection time for the MO instance. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

class.name: XmuDeviceSet
class.description: This MO models an auXiliary Multiplexing Unit (XMU) device set.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: XmuDeviceSetId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description: Indicates the usage of a device group.

class.name: XpProgram
class.description:
This MO models a program executing on an auxiliary unit.
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the grand-parent AuxPlugInUnit MO is created. For the MO to be correctly configured, the AuxPlugInUnit MO must refer to a proper PiuType MO.

attribute.name: XpProgramId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: startState
attribute.description:
Indicates if the XpProgram can be used after an auxiliary unit restart. Program use is allowed if the state is enabled.
Only 1 program is allowed to have the state ENABLED at the same time for each device group.

attribute.name: loadModule
attribute.description: Refers to the corresponding LoadModule MO. It contains information for loading: product data, load module file path, and file size.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: AuxPlugInUnit
class.description: This MO models an auxiliary plug-in unit.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.
attribute.dependencies: Modification of the attribute value is not allowed as long as ENodeBFunction::technicianPresent=true.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description: The product ID of the installed AuxPlugInUnit/HW Unit. If the corresponding hardware unit is not installed yet, the struct contains empty strings.

attribute.name: greenLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the operational status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not readable at the moment STEADY_LIGHT = Power present SLOW_BLINK = Missing resource FAST_BLINK = Load or test in progress FLICKERING = Busy
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute operationalIndicator.

attribute.name: redLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the fault status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = No fault STEADY_LIGHT = PIU fault
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute faultIndicator.

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the information status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = PIU unlocked STEADY_LIGHT = PIU locked SLOW_BLINK = Shutting-down in progress FLICKERING = Busy
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute maintenanceIndicator.

attribute.name: AuxPlugInUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Defines the operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status of the device.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Refers to the corresponding PiuType MO. Used by the auto-configuration and system upgrade functions to create corresponding device group and XpProgram MOs.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: unitType
attribute.description: Mirrors the attribute PiuType.productData(productName).

attribute.name: positionRef
attribute.description: Refers to the cabinet or shelf in which the AuxPlugInUnit is placed or to which it belongs.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: The absolute position of the AuxPlugInUnit in a shelf. Position numbering starts from left or ground with the first position numbered 1. A board can occupy more than one position, depending on its width. When a board occupies more than one position, its position number is the left-most position it occupies.

attribute.name: positionInformation
attribute.description:
The position of a AuxPlugInUnit. It can be:
- On a shelf - Not on a shelf but inside or outside the cabinet - At a remote site
If the hardware is contained on a shelf, the attribute position is used. Otherwise this attribute can be used, for example, to provide the address of a remote site, or to indicate that the unit is installed in connection to a specific shelf.

attribute.name: faultIndicator
attribute.description:
The fault status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical indicator on the unit.
Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No hardware fault. • STEADY_ON = Hardware fault.
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see redLed.

attribute.name: operationalIndicator
attribute.description:
The operational status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical indicator on the unit. Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No power. • STEADY_ON = Operational, the unit can perform its intended purpose. • SLOW_BLINK = Dependent resource missing, the unit is non-operational. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_STEADY_ON = Loading software, the unit is operational during software loading. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF = Loading software, the unit is non-operational during software loading.
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see greenLed

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description:
The maintenance status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical maintenance indicator on the unit. Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = Non-maintenance mode (board unlocked) • STEADY_ON = Full maintenance mode (board locked) • SLOW_BLINK = Removing ongoing traffic in unit • FAST_BLINK = Alarms suppressed in unit
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see yellowLed.

action.name: writeRepairDeliveryNoteToHwLog
action.description:
Writes hardware log entry requested by the operator. Only one hardware log entry is allowed for each hardware unit, and update of an existing entry is not allowed.
preparedBy Name of operator preparing the log entry.
countryCode Two-letter country code.
stateCode The hardware status when the failure occurred. R = Repaired unit failed during installation or test. S = Unit in service failure occurred. T = New unit failed during installation or test.
descriptionOfFault Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described. For product safety also specify; fire, water damage, and so on.
trNumber If the board has a connection with a trouble report a trouble report number must be supplied.
reference Complaint reference.
Transaction Required: No
Parameters
preparedBy Data Type: String Range: 1..15
countryCode Data Type: String Range: 2..2
stateCode Data Type: String Range: 1..1
descriptionOfFault Data Type: String Range: 1..64
trNumber Data Type: String Range: 0..10
reference Data Type: String Range: 0..8

action.name: readRepairDeliveryNoteFromHwLog
action.description:
Reads the content of the hardware log entry written by the operator using the writeRepairDeliveryNoteToHwLog action.
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: reconfigureProgramPrepare
action.description: Seeks a matching PIU type for an auxiliary plug-in unit at SW upgrade. Depending on found PIU type, the XP program is reconfigured.

action.name: restartUnit
action.description: Restarts the corresponding auxiliary plug-in unit. The XP program with startState = enabled is reloaded from flash memory (forced reload).
action.disturbances: This action may affect traffic.

class.name: TrDeviceSet
class.description:
