If this MO is created automatically, as a consequence of creating the SystemClockDistribution MO, it is deleted automatically when the SystemClockDistribution MO is deleted.
For details about the position of the Timing Units in the subrack, see the attribute boardPositions in the related MO SubrackProdType.

attribute.name: TimingUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: tuSystemClock
attribute.description: State of the system clock signal.

attribute.name: gpsOutEnabled
attribute.description:
Set to true means GPS out is enabled.
For details on which boards support the setting of gpsOutEnabled = true, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.dependencies: If it is set to true it is not possible to create a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO. It is not possible to set it to true if a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO exists.

attribute.name: hptsiOutEnabled
attribute.description:
Set to true means GPS port is reversed to output with HPTSI protocol.
For details on which boards support the setting of hptsiOutEnabled = true, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.dependencies: If it is set to true it is not possible to set gpsOutEnabled = true, create a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO. It is not possible to set it to true if gpsOutEnabled = true or a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO exists.

class.name: Synchronization
class.description:
Synchronization
This MO administers synchronization references for network synchronization and displays the system clock state of the node.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Synchronization=1.

attribute.name: SynchronizationId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: degradationIsFault
attribute.description: Determines whether a transmission link degradation (for example, high bit-error rate) is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault or not. This attribute is applicable only for traffic carrying synchronization references.

attribute.name: syncReference
attribute.description:
List of resources for synchronization references. Possible references are: E1PhysPathTerm, E3PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, T3PhysPathTerm, Os155SpiTtp, TuSyncRef, IpSyncRef, GpsSyncRef, PacketFrequencySyncRef, PacketTimeSyncRef and HptsiSyncRef. The IpSyncRef is not supported in TUB1 nodes.
A synchronization reference is added by using the action addSyncRefResource.
If one value in this attribute is NULL, the respective values in the attributes syncRefActivity, syncRefPriority and syncStatus are not relevant.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefPriority
attribute.description:
Synchronization reference priority.
1 represents the highest and 8 the lowest priority. Every synchronization reference must have a unique priority value. Value 0 means not applicable, that is, no synchronization reference with this priority is defined.
This attribute is mandatory when adding a synchronization reference (using the action addSyncRefResource). A priority value can be changed with the action changeSyncRefPriority, provided that the priority is not already assigned to some other synchronization reference.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefActivity
attribute.description:
List of attributes for synchronization references, where each attribute specifies whether the respective synchronization reference is active. Zero or one reference is active.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefStatus
attribute.description:
List of status attributes for synchronization references.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest1Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 1% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of the 1% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period. No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest10Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 10% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition:
This counter is calculated on the basis of the 10% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period.
No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest50Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 50% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of the 50% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period. No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: nodeSystemClock
attribute.description: State of the system clock on the node.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: pmMaxDelayVariation
attribute.description: This counter shows the Maximum Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of maximum and minimum packet delays for the active IP reference at the end of each GP, as follows: Max Delay Variation = Max Packet Delay - Min Packet Delay No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable (that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter)

attribute.name: testMode
attribute.description: Specifies if the test mode is used.

attribute.name: fixedPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node has a fixed position.
If set to true, the node is operating in survey mode, until it has acquired its position. After that, the node changes to position-hold mode.
If set to false, the node is prevented from entering the position-hold mode and the GPS performance enhancements functions that require fixed position, must be disabled.

attribute.name: ptpFreqFeatureState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp frequency feature state.

attribute.name: ptpFreqLicenseState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp frequency license state.

attribute.name: sfnInitializationTime
attribute.description:
Specifies the time when SFN is initialized to zero.
The time is TAI given as a string with the following format: <YYYY-MM-DD>T<hh:mm:ss>

attribute.name: ptpTimeFeatureState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp time feature state.

attribute.name: ptpTimeLicenseState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp time license state.

action.name: addSyncRefResource
action.description:
This action adds one synchronization reference. As a result of the action, one set of values to the attributes syncReference and syncRefPriority are added to the Synchronization MO.
Description of exceptions: - AlreadyRegistered: this reference is already registered - MaxNoOfRefRegistered: maximum number (8) of synchronization references already present - PriorityAlreadyInUse: syncPriority is identical to an existing synchronization reference priority - PriorityOutOfRange: invalid syncPriority value - InvalidMoReference: invalid syncReference for registration as a synchronization reference (invalid MO type) - NotPermitted: the MO referenced by syncReference is not permitted as a synchronization reference.

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference to be added. See description of attribute syncReference.

parameter.name: syncPriority
parameter.description: Priority of synchronization reference. Each synchronization reference must have a unique priority value.

action.name: removeSyncRefResource
action.description:
This action removes one synchronization reference that has previously been added.
Description of exceptions: - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference to be removed. See description of attribute SyncReference.

action.name: changeSyncRefPriority
action.description:
This action changes the synchronization priority of one previously registered synchronization reference.
Description of exceptions: - PriorityAlreadyInUse: syncPriority is identical with an existing synchronization reference priority - PriorityOutOfRange: invalid syncPriority value - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference, whose priority will be changed. See description of attribute syncReference.

parameter.name: syncPriority
parameter.description: The new priority for the synchronization reference. Each synchronization reference must have a unique priority value.

action.name: resetLossOfTracking
action.description:
This action resets the detected Loss of Tracking error condition on one synchronization reference. After resetting, the synchronization reference is usable again.
Description of exceptions: - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference, for which the Loss of Tracking status is to be reset. See description of attribute SyncReference.

class.name: GpsSyncRef
class.description:
Global Positioning System (GPS) synchronization reference
For details on which boards support GPS synchronization references, see the description of the relevant board.
Dependencies: It is not possible to create a GpsSyncRef MO, if gpsOutEnabled in the MO TimingUnit is set to true.

attribute.name: GpsSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: satelliteInformation
attribute.description: Information about the satellites in view.

attribute.name: latitude
attribute.description: The latitude of the node.

attribute.name: longitude
attribute.description: The longitude of the node.

attribute.name: altitude
attribute.description:
The altitude of the node.
Unit: 1 m

attribute.name: hdop
attribute.description: The horizontal dilution of precision.

attribute.name: vdop
attribute.description: The vertical dilution of precision.

attribute.name: observationPoint
attribute.description: The observation point of the GPS receiver.

attribute.name: gpsRefState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver/data.

attribute.name: noOfSatellitesInView
attribute.description: The number of satellites in view.

attribute.name: gpsCompensationDelay
attribute.description: The delay of the GPS.

class.name: SystemClockDistribution
class.description:
System Clock Distribution
This MO is used by NSS to propagate the system clock distribution path alarms issued from the specific SCXB boards.

attribute.name: SystemClockDistributionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

class.name: PacketTimeSyncRef
class.description:
Packet Time Synchronization Reference
Administers Time/Phase synchronization.
Only support multicast and E2E.

attribute.name: transportLayerRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of GigaBitEthernet MO.

attribute.name: asymmetryCompensation
attribute.description: Set in steps of 1 ns. The +/- sign is relative to the downlink.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: PacketTimeSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ptpDomain
attribute.description:
Specifies the PTP domain.
Has to be a unique number among the configured packetTimeSyncRef and packetFrequencySyncRef objects.

attribute.name: ptpGrandMasterIdentity
attribute.description: The grand master port that sends synchronization messages.

attribute.name: ptpQualityLevel
attribute.description: The master clock quality level.

attribute.name: ptpOwnPortIdentity
attribute.description: The own port identity.

attribute.name: ptpParentPortIdentity
attribute.description: The parent port that sends synchronization messages.

attribute.name: pBit
attribute.description: The pBit value used for transmitted frames, if value 0 is used then an untagged frame is used. If any other value than 0 is used the a priority tagged frame is used (VlanID=0).

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO.

attribute.name: packetSyncStatus
attribute.description:
Packet synchronization status.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, as specified below:
0 NO_FAULT: The reference can be selected as a synchronization reference.
1 NO_ANNOUNCE: No Announce messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
2 CLOCK_CLASS: The clockClass of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef).
4 CLOCK_ACCURACY: The clockAccuracy of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 (that is, 34 in decimal).
8 NO_SYNC: No Sync messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
16 ERRATIC_SYNC: Sync messages are arriving irregularly but are not totally missing. This could indicate packet loss in the network.
32 LOW_SYNC_RATE: The PTP server states that the intended interval between Sync messages is too long to meet the needs of the ordinary clock slave.
64 NO_DELAY_RESP: There has been no Delay_Resp from the PTP server for the last 8 Delay_Req messages sent to it. For the first Delay_Req, this indication is set after only 2 missed responses (with initial request interval 8 seconds).
128 LOW_DELAY_REQ_RATE: The PTP server in its Delay_Resp messages states a minimum allowed interval between Delay_Req messages that is too long to meet the needs of ordinary clock slave.
256 UC_NEG_NO_REPLY: There has been no reply to some (or all) of the messages sent to the PTP server requesting unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp.
512 UC_NEG_NO_AGREE: In unicast negotiation with the PTP server, the server will either not comply with the message intervals requested for unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp, or it will not provide a duration of at least 60 seconds for these requests.
1024 UC_NEG_MC_NOK: In the phase of unicast negotiations, the clockClass is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef) and/or clockAccuracy is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 of the grandMaster clock reported in the first Announce message.
2048 UC_NEG_CANCELED: The PTP server has canceled previously granted unicast transmission of one or more of the message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_resp.
Example: 17 means ERRATIC_SYNC + NO_ANNOUNCE (16+1)

class.name: PacketFrequencySyncRef
class.description:
Packet Frequency Synchronization Reference
Administers frequency synchronization for PTP.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of a IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: cachedIpAddress
attribute.description: Indicates the latest IP address received from the DNS server with the specified domain name. If domain name is not valid or no value yet received from the DNS server this will be a null string.

attribute.name: PacketFrequencySyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: serverAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the domain or IP address of the server can be either IPv4 or IPv6.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
A valid domain name: - has characters of type letters, numbers and a hyphen "-", where hyphens can be anywhere in the middle of a name, but cannot be located at the end or beginning of a name - cannot have spaces - is case insensitive - can include dots for the use of sub domains.
If this MO refers to an IpAccessHostEt MO, the IP address in this attribute must be of same format as the referenced IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: packetSyncStatus
attribute.description:
Packet synchronization status.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, as specified below:
0 NO_FAULT: The reference can be selected as a synchronization reference.
1 NO_ANNOUNCE: No Announce messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
2 CLOCK_CLASS: The clockClass of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef).
4 CLOCK_ACCURACY: The clockAccuracy of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 (that is, 34 in decimal).
8 NO_SYNC: No Sync messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
16 ERRATIC_SYNC: Sync messages are arriving irregularly but are not totally missing. This could indicate packet loss in the network.
32 LOW_SYNC_RATE: The PTP server states that the intended interval between Sync messages is too long to meet the needs of the ordinary clock slave.
64 NO_DELAY_RESP: There has been no Delay_Resp from the PTP server for the last 8 Delay_Req messages sent to it. For the first Delay_Req, this indication is set after only 2 missed responses (with initial request interval 8 seconds).
128 LOW_DELAY_REQ_RATE: The PTP server in its Delay_Resp messages states a minimum allowed interval between Delay_Req messages that is too long to meet the needs of ordinary clock slave.
256 UC_NEG_NO_REPLY: There has been no reply to some (or all) of the messages sent to the PTP server requesting unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp.
512 UC_NEG_NO_AGREE: In unicast negotiation with the PTP server, the server will either not comply with the message intervals requested for unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp, or it will not provide a duration of at least 60 seconds for these requests.
1024 UC_NEG_MC_NOK: In the phase of unicast negotiations, the clockClass is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef) and/or clockAccuracy is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 of the grandMaster clock reported in the first Announce message.
2048 UC_NEG_CANCELED: The PTP server has canceled previously granted unicast transmission of one or more of the message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_resp.
Example: 17 means ERRATIC_SYNC + NO_ANNOUNCE (16+1)

Specifies the PTP domain.

class.name: HptsiSyncRef
class.description: High Precision Time Synchronization Interface synchronization reference. This MO can only be created on DU-based nodes.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: hptsiCompensationDelay
attribute.description: The HTPSI compensation delay.

attribute.name: hptsiLeapSeconds
attribute.description: The number of HPTSI leap seconds.

attribute.name: hptsiPpsState
attribute.description: The HTPSI pps state.

attribute.name: hptsiStateOfClockSource
attribute.description: The HTPSI state of clock source.

attribute.name: hptsiMonitorAlarm
attribute.description:
The HTPSI monitor alarm.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, according to the list below.
0 Not used 1 Antenna open 2 Antenna shorted 4 Not tracking satellites 8 Not used 16 Survey-in progress 32 No stored position 64 Leap second pending 128 In test mode 256 Position is questionable 512 Not used 1024 Almanac not complete 2048 Not used
Example: 17 means Survey-in progress + Antenna open (16+1)

attribute.name: hptsiJitterLevel
attribute.description: The HTPSI jitter level.

attribute.name: hptsiClockSource
attribute.description: The HTPSI clock source.

attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.
